<summary>
* The invention relates to a dental apparatus for cleaning and massaging teeth and gums.
	*The apparatus comprises a mouthpiece with upper and lower channel members that fit over the teeth and snugly against the gums.
	*The channel members are joined by a membrane structure and pneumatic means are provided to move the channel members relative to the gums to massage them.

* The apparatus also includes hydraulic means to clean the teeth and gingival crevices and to lubricate the gums during massaging.
	*The hydraulic means includes a hose that provides a gentle steady stream of water and/or cleaning fluid to clean and flush out the teeth and gums.
	*The fluid serves as a lubricant during the massaging action and any fluid seepage is sucked out of the mouth through suction hoses.

* The apparatus is operated by a control box that provides air pulses and water or air pulses alone or water alone.
	*The control box includes an air pump that operates cyclically to alternately provide pulses of air with periods of no air between the air pulses.
	*The control box also includes a source of water that can be mixed with a cleaning fluid and a drain hose to drain out the fluid drawn out of the mouth.

* The apparatus can be operated in three modes: with both air and cleaning fluid, with air only, or with cleaning fluid only.
	*The control box includes three ON-OFF switches to provide the three modes of operation.
	*A remote control device is also provided to operate the apparatus from a distance.

* The invention can be modified to include additional features such as bristles to assist the massaging action and a single coupling arrangement to couple the control panel to the mouthpiece.
	*These modifications can be made without departing from the spirit and scope of the invention.
	*The invention provides a relatively simple and highly effective means for cleaning teeth and massaging gums.</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to the field of pelvic floor reconstruction using implants, specifically addressing the issue of pelvic organ prolapse (POP) in women.
	* POP occurs when the muscles and tissues supporting the pelvic organs weaken or become damaged, causing the organs to shift out of position.
	* The invention aims to provide a reliable anchoring of the mesh implant to surrounding tissues and ligaments.

* The invention includes a needle for surgical threading of a strap of an implant through tissue, featuring a trap for trapping the strap, a tip for threading, and a mechanism for releasing the trap.
	* The trap may comprise a niche and a rod for grasping the end of the strap.
	* The mechanism for releasing the trap may be manually driven or comprise a cable for removing the rod from the end of the strap.

* The invention also includes an anterior implant with at least two first straps for threading into the arcus tendineous fascia pelvic (ATFP) ligaments and at least two second straps for threading into the sacrospinous (SS) ligaments.
	* The anterior implant may include a loop between the second straps for anchoring to the cervix.
	* The implant may be used for reconstructing organs such as the urinary bladder, colon, and small intestine.

* A posterior implant is also described, featuring at least two straps for threading into the SS ligaments and a loop for anchoring to the cervix and perineal body.
	* The posterior implant may be used for reconstructing organs such as the colon, small intestine, and uterus.
	* The implant may include spaces for reducing its weight.

* The invention includes a method for using the needle to thread a strap through a surface, involving trapping the strap, threading the needle, releasing the trap, and returning the needle.
	* The method may be used for installing the anterior or posterior implant.
	* The method allows for threading from the accessible side of the tissue without requiring additional perforations.

* The invention provides a solution for pelvic floor reconstruction using implants, addressing the issue of reliable anchoring and providing a method for threading straps through tissue.
	* The invention includes various embodiments and aspects, including the needle, anterior and posterior implants, and methods for installation.
	* The invention aims to improve the quality of life for women suffering from pelvic organ prolapse.</summary>

<summary>

• The invention relates to methods and apparatus for providing ventilatory assistance matched to a subject's respiratory need.
	• The ventilatory assistance can be for a subject who is either spontaneously or non-spontaneously breathing, or moves between these breathing states.
	• The invention is especially suitable for spontaneously breathing human subjects requiring long-term ventilatory assistance, particularly during sleep.

• The invention aims to match the phase and degree of assistance to the subject's spontaneous efforts when ventilation is well above a target ventilation.
	• It also aims to automatically adjust the degree of assistance to maintain at least a specified minimum average ventilation without relying on the integrity of the subject's chemoreflexes.
	• Additionally, it aims to provide some immunity to the effects of sudden leaks.

• The invention uses a fuzzy membership function to determine the instantaneous phase in the respiratory cycle as a continuous variable.
	• It calculates the instantaneous phase based on the instantaneous airflow and its rate of change.
	• The phase is calculated from 0 to 1 revolution, with 0 representing the start of inspiration and 1 representing the end of expiration.

• The invention uses a method for calculating the instantaneous inspired volume of a subject, operable substantially without run-away under conditions of suddenly changing leak.
	• It calculates the instantaneous inspired volume as the integral of the corrected respiratory airflow multiplied by the fuzzy negation of an index J.
	• The index J varies from 0 to 1 and is equal to the fuzzy extent to which the corrected respiratory airflow is large positive for longer than expected.

• The invention provides a method for providing ventilatory assistance in a spontaneously breathing subject.
	• It calculates the instantaneous phase in the respiratory cycle and selects a desired pressure modulation amplitude.
	• It calculates a desired instantaneous delivery pressure as an end-expiratory pressure plus the desired pressure modulation amplitude multiplied by the value of a waveform template function at the calculated phase.

• The invention provides a method for providing assisted ventilation to match the subject's need.
	• It describes a desired waveform template function with a domain of 0 to 1 revolution and a range of 0 to 1.
	• It calculates the instantaneous phase in the respiratory cycle and a desired amplitude of pressure modulation.

• The invention provides a method for calculating the desired amplitude of pressure modulation.
	• It calculates a target airflow equal to twice the target ventilation divided by the target respiratory rate.
	• It derives an error term equal to the absolute value of the instantaneous low-pass filtered respiratory airflow minus the target airflow.

<summary>
• The invention relates to a novel electro-surgical dissection and cauterization instrument for use primarily in laparoscopic/endoscopic procedures.
	• The instrument is designed to overcome the problems of prior art electro-surgical instruments, such as obstruction of the surgeon's view and unintentional cauterization of healthy tissue.

• The instrument includes a rigid arm extending between the distal, working tip electrode and the insulating sleeve, with at least a portion of the arm laterally offset from the longitudinal axis of the sleeve.
	• This design provides maximum visualization of the working tip electrode and operation site by the surgeon.

• The instrument also includes an electrical insulating layer along the entire length of the tool up to the exposed working tip electrode, eliminating the risk of inadvertent cauterization of tissue.
	• The insulating layer is disposed upon the arm from the sleeve to the base of the working tip electrode.

• The working tip electrode comes in many different shapes, depending on the needs of the surgeon in a particular surgical application.
	• Examples of working tip electrodes include a hook, a flattened spatula, and a substantially circular, planar spatula.

• The instrument is designed for easy handling and use by the surgeon, and is suitable for use in a variety of surgical procedures, including lysis of adhesions, cholecystectomy, and appendectomy.
	• The instrument is also suitable for use in open surgeries that do not include the use of an endoscope.

• The invention provides a single-use, disposable, electro-surgical and cauterizing instrument for endoscopic procedures.
	• The instrument is designed to be used with a conventional electro-surgical unit, and includes a plug for connecting the tool to the unit.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to a magnetic resonance imaging apparatus that allows exposures with the subject in at least two predetermined exposure positions, with at least one exposure taking place using predetermined adjustment parameters.
	• The apparatus includes a magnet, at least one patient receptacle, at least one support plate, and a predetermined number of transmit and/or receive coils.

• In known magnetic resonance imaging apparatuses, exposure parameters must be modified at least partially for different exposure positions, requiring a readjustment of the apparatus.
	• The adjustment serves to optimize the RF chain and the homogeneity of the main magnetic field in a volume under examination.

• The exposure parameters are patient-dependent, and a precise adjustment is necessary for patient safety with respect to RF exposure.
	• Known apparatuses recognize automatically whether exposure parameters must be modified and carry out a readjustment if warranted.

• The adjustment process normally requires 10 to 90 seconds per exposure position, which is not available in certain examination procedures.
	• This includes tracking doses of contrast agent over a larger body region that exceeds the available homogeneity volume.

• The present invention provides a magnetic resonance imaging apparatus that provides high-contrast exposures in a short time, even given an examination of larger body segments.
	• The required adjustment parameters are determined in a preceding adjustment process and stored until the conclusion of the examination.

• The adjustment parameters can be modified by means of a spatial modification of position of the support plate or by connection and/or disconnection of the transmit coils and/or receive coils.
	• The adjustment parameters are used again when identical or suitably similar exposure parameters are reached in the context of the same examination.

• The inventive solution is suitable for a large number of different forms of magnetic resonance imaging apparatuses, including cylindrical magnets and horseshoe magnets.
	• The patient receptacle is fashioned as a patient tube given cylindrically shaped magnets.

• The apparatus includes a support plate, transmit coils, receive coils, a generator, a receiver, and an adjustment unit that processes inputs and supplies control signals.
	• The adjustment unit supplies control signals to the generator, transmit amplifier, matching elements, receive amplifier, receiver, and shim coil system.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to fasteners for albums such as photographic albums and scrapbooks where it is required to add or replace album pages.
	*The fastener has a pair of strap anchors, one adapted to be attached to the front cover and the other to the back cover, a strap adapted to pass through aligned apertures in the covers and album pages from the strap anchor at the front to the strap anchor at the back.

* The strap anchors are in the form of a channel in which the strap is a snap lock to be releasably locked therein against displacement.
	*The strap is snap-locked into the channel by snapping engagement beneath locking lips at an open side of the channel facing the base of the channel.

* The base of the channel and opposing surface of the strap have formations which are engaged to prevent longitudinal displacement of the strap within the channel when its in its engaged position beneath the lips.
	*These inter-engaging formations on the base of the channel and surface of the strap may consist of closely-spaced lateral ribs which are preferably of saw-tooth profile in cross-section.

* The strap enters into the channel via an aperture in the base of the channel and that aperture is bordered by a projection adapted to extend into the adjacent hole in the cover to ensure correct location between the strap anchor and the cover.
	*The strap anchors can be adhesively attached to the respective covers, for example by double sided adhesive tape.

* The present invention also provides an album having at least two fasteners as defined above mounted along the spine part of the album, the strap anchors of each fasteners being attached to the respective covers of the album.
	*The fasteners can be produced inexpensively so that their overall cost can be maintained at level comparable with that of the conventional fastening screws.

* The insertion of the straps through the sheets when adding or replacing sheets is significantly easier than insertion of the two-part fastening screws conventionally used.
	*The straps also provide significantly greater versatility in increasing the size of the album as the only controlling factor of the thickness of the album is the length of the strap.

* The strap anchors are actually applied to what is an inside surface of the cover, and in the secured configuration of the fastener, an inner extension flap of the cover is folded over to conceal the two strap anchors and straps.
	*This configuration of front cover, which is repeated also for the back cover, corresponds to that which is used in albums using conventional screw-type fasteners.

*

<summary>
• The present invention relates to a sulky with a new construction design that can be manufactured from light metal and other lightweight yet durable materials.
	• The sulky has a stable construction where the shafts and crossbar transfer the load to the wheel planes only.
	• The design allows for easy assembly by the user themselves using ordinary hand tools.

• The sulky has a weight reduction of approximately 40% compared to traditional sulkies, with a total weight of around 18 kg in a ready-to-use state.
	• The weight reduction is achieved through the use of light metal and other lightweight materials.
	• The sulky's design also allows for a more efficient manufacturing process.

• The sulky's end frames are casted from light metal, such as aluminum, using a chill-casting or press-casting process.
	• The crossbar is manufactured from extruded aluminum or a similar light metal.
	• The wheels and shafts are fastened to the end frames using conventional fastening techniques.

• The sulky's design allows for easy storage and transportation, as it can be packed into a flat box.
	• The user can assemble the sulky themselves in a short amount of time, around a quarter of an hour.
	• The sulky's design also allows for a more efficient manufacturing process, reducing tool expenses and storing charges.

• The sulky's crossbar is designed with internal extending protrusions and strengthening elements to provide a stable and reliable connection.
	• The strengthening elements are made from a material with higher rigidity than the extruded profile, such as stainless steel.
	• The connection method ensures a stable and reliable assembly using simple means.

• The sulky's end frames are designed to be symmetrical relative to the wheel planes, providing a stable construction.
	• The loads are evenly distributed due to the symmetrical design, contributing to a reliable solution.
	• The end frame's design allows for casting in a tool with only one core and two side walls.

• The sulky's design allows for a more efficient manufacturing process, reducing tool expenses and storing charges.
	• The end frames are casted in the same tool, reducing the number of spare parts and storing charges.
	• The sulky's design also allows for easy assembly by the user themselves using ordinary hand tools.

• The sulky's design provides a reliable and professional solution for users, with a lower total weight but equal user qualities to traditional sulkies.
	• The sulky's design

<summary>
* The present invention relates to a ventilation system for rotating water feeds, particularly useful in connection with water-cooled generators.
	*The invention aims to provide an arrangement that avoids the disadvantages of prior art techniques and permits automatic removal or reduction of air or gas bubbles accumulating in rotating pipes.
	*The invention is particularly useful in connection with water-cooled generators which preferably comprise coaxial feed and discharge ducts.

* The invention provides a structural arrangement that is as simple in design as possible, utilizing the pressure gradient between the inflow and outflow for automatic operation of the device.
	*The bypass is arranged in or on an end face of the feed ducts, which is of particular advantage if the branch point is at the end of the feed duct.
	*The bypass may be designed as a radially arranged pipe member with at least one inlet in the space around the axis of rotation.

* The bypass may be designed as a coiled pipe having at least one inlet opening into the space around the axis of rotation.
	*This form of construction affords advantages in that it permits the amount of leakage and bypass to be minimized by simple technical means.
	*The coiled pipe may be arranged at one end of the outer pipe, and may be provided with several inlets.

* The bypass is structured to include means for increasing the hydrodynamic resistance of flow through the bypass.
	*Such an arrangement enables the achievement of an adequate pressure drop over a short distance with a low resistance to flow.
	*This allows for a ventilation system having smaller outer dimensions to be provided.

* The invention provides a ventilation system which is relatively simple in its design and construction.
	*The system includes a radial feed duct defined by a radial feed pipe with radial discharge ducts defined by radial discharge pipes.
	*The bypass means of the invention are embodied in a bypass which includes an inlet and an outlet.

* The various features of novelty which characterize the invention are pointed out with particularity in the claims annexed to and forming a part of this disclosure.
	*For a better understanding of the invention, its operating advantages and specific objects attained by its use, reference should be had to the accompanying drawings and descriptive matter.
	*The invention may be embodied otherwise without departing from such principles.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a steering column for a motor vehicle, which comprises a jacket unit supporting a steering shaft rotatably about its longitudinal axis and a retaining part, which the jacket unit is secured non-displaceably up to a limit value of a force acting onto the jacket unit parallel to the longitudinal axis of the steering shaft in the direction toward the front of the motor vehicle.
	*The jacket unit is connected with the retaining part, for one, across an energy absorption connection, which comprises at least one bending wire or strip that, upon a displacement of the jacket unit with respect to the retaining part parallel to the longitudinal direction toward the motor vehicle front, is deformed, and is connected, for another, across a break-away connection which, up to the limit value of the force, is closed and blocks a displacement of the jacket unit with respect to the retaining part and which is released if the limit value of the force is exceeded.
	*The invention further relates to a method for the production of such a steering column.
	*The steering column is preferably implemented such that it is adjustable in length.
		*An openable and closable securement device is herein provided, in the opened state of which the jacket unit is displaceable with respect to a bracket unit supporting the jacket unit parallel to the longitudinal axis of the steering shaft and which, in its closed state, applies a securement force for the securement of the jacket unit with respect to the bracket unit against a displacement parallel to the longitudinal axis of the steering shaft.
		*In the mounted state of the steering column the bracket unit is herein firmly secured on the vehicle, at least in normal operation, thus without a crash having occurred, e.g. up to a maximum force acting in the direction of the longitudinal axis of the steering shaft.
		*The retaining part is formed by a part of the securement device.
		*The retaining part in the closed state of the securement device is herein in engagement with a securement part which is secured in position with respect to the bracket unit such that it is nondisplaceable in the direction of the longitudinal axis of the steering shaft.
	*The break-away connection between the retaining part and the jacket unit can be formed, for example, by a pin connecting these two parts, which, in the event of a crash, is sheared off if the limit value of the force acting upon the steering shaft and thereover onto the jacket unit parallel to the longitudinal axis of the steering

<summary>
• The present invention relates to a process for mounting glass panels in curved window bays of motor vehicles and the like.
	• The process utilizes flat, uncurved glass panels to form curved windows in such vehicles.
	• The conventional process of installing curved glass panels has many disadvantages, including distortion and brittleness of the glass.
		• The glass panel is distorted during the tempering and contouring process and is caused to become less flexible and more brittle.
		• Problems arise in packaging such glass for transportation and storage.
• The conventional process also makes the glass panel weaker in certain respects, making it more likely to dislodge from the bay in the event of a vehicular accident.
	• The glass panel can easily shatter and the vehicular body is less able to resist crushing.
	• The cost of a comparably sized flat glass panel is at least one eighth to one tenth the cost of a pre-treated, pre-contoured glass.
		• The difference in eventual expense to the consumer is considerable when considering the added cost for packaging and shipment of pre-contoured glass panels.
• The present invention provides an improved process for economically and inexpensively installing glass windows of a curved nature in vehicle windows and the like.
	• The process involves flexing a flat glass panel to conform to a curved window bay and securing it in place with a weather sealant and adhesive compound.
• The fastening means comprises a plurality of resilient clips uniformly spaced about the perimeter of the window bay and a reveal molding cooperatively secured to the clips.
	• The reveal molding is provided with a resilient bias, pressing on the outer surface of the glass panel, pushing the glass into conforming engagement with the bay of the window opening.
• The present invention provides a method for installing a window panel in a curved opening of a vehicle.
	• The method involves placing a flat uncontoured glass panel within the curved window bay, securing it in place with a holding means, and applying a weather sealant and adhesive compound.
• The invention also provides for the use of a continuous band of weather stripping to seal the gap between the reveal molding and the glass panel.
	• The weather stripping extends into engagement with the leaf portion of the clip.
• The permanent mounting of the glass panel is achieved using a curable adhesive sealant.
	• The adhesive sealant is inserted in the compartment between the panel and the frame, and is allowed to cure until the panel becomes fixed permanently in the window opening.
• The invention also

<summary>
  * The present invention relates to methods and apparatus for removing a gas from a liquid, particularly for separating oxygen from water on an offshore hydrocarbon recovery platform.
	*The invention aims to provide a mechanical, cylindrical gas scavenger machine with a reduced height compared to a stripping tower with a sump for chemical scavenger treatment.
	* The apparatus includes a vessel with multiple partitions dividing it into gasification chambers, each with a vapor space and a mechanism for ingesting and mixing a second gas into the liquid.
	*The second gas displaces the first gas, which is then removed through a vent, and the process is repeated in multiple chambers to achieve the desired level of gas removal.
</summary>

<summary>
• The packaging machine is a deep-drawing packaging machine with a plurality of work stations that are operable in synchronism with one another.
	• The work stations are arranged in succession in the production direction of the packaging machine, with each work station including at least one movable tool member.

• The packaging machine has a rotationally driven shaft arranged in the production direction, with at least one transfer mechanism for converting the rotational movement of the shaft into the movement required to operate the respective tool member.
	• The transfer mechanism may comprise an arrangement of toggle levers and/or a cam mechanism for converting the movement of the shaft into the movement of the respective tool member.

• The shaft may be driven in a continuous 360° rotation or alternately in different directions of rotation, depending on the desired tool-member lifting movements.
	• The shaft is supported in a plurality of cross bars of the frame, with friction bearings or ball bearings provided for supporting it.

• The packaging machine may comprise a plurality of work stations of one of the above-mentioned types, such as a forming station, a sealing station, and/or a separating or cutting station.
	• At least two work stations of the packaging machine may be arranged on different vertical levels, allowing for a more compact structural design.

• The packaging machine may be provided with a frame for supporting the shaft, with the frame being adequate to stabilize the shaft and prevent the generation of vibrations.
	• The frame may comprise a plurality of lateral longitudinal bars and cross bars interconnecting said longitudinal bars.

• The tool members of the work stations may be adapted to be displaced in the production direction of the packaging machine, allowing for easy adaptation to varying conditions.
	• The displacement or adjustment of the tool members may be executed without the necessity of acting on the shaft and/or the transfer mechanism.

• The packaging machine may be modified in many respects, such as providing further work stations and/or driving further tool members of the existing work stations by means of the common shaft.
	• Tool members may be implemented as replaceable components, with the tools being removable from the packaging machine laterally relative to the production direction.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a finishing article with a drive member non-removably affixed thereto for mounting on a rotatable spindle of a power tool.
	• The drive member includes a backing flange having gripping means radially extending therefrom secured by a retaining nut positioned on the opposite side from the backing flange.

• The retaining nut extends through an opening in the finishing article from the face toward the back of the finishing article and has a radial flange at one end thereof seated against the finishing article face.
	• The retaining nut also has protrusion means extending outwardly from the other end thereof for non-removably securing the retaining nut and the backing flange together on the finishing article without the use of adhesives.

• A pressure cap defining a central opening is held in place by the gripping means on the backing flange and extends longitudinally away from the backing flange.
	• The pressure cap engages the power tool spindle seat for placing the abrasive finishing article in compression during use thereof when the finishing article is operatively secured upon the spindle of the power tool.

• The invention provides a disposable finishing article drive member assembly that securely holds the article during operation.
	• The assembly is light in weight, vibration-free, and less expensive than prior art throw-away articles while meeting all safety standards currently known and in existence.

• The invention eliminates the need for adhesives in manufacturing, reducing labor costs and potential failures due to adhesive breakdown.
	• The design also eliminates the need for keyed parts and die-cast mounting hubs, reducing bulk, weight, and cost.

• The invention provides a secure attachment of the abrasive finishing article to the power tool and precludes relative rotation of the grinding wheel with respect to the driving member.
	• The increased compression force generated by the design ensures a secure attachment and prevents disengagement from the spindle.

• The invention accommodates all currently known sizes of standard diameter depressed center grinding wheels.
	• The design allows for easy assembly and disassembly, making it suitable for a wide range of applications.

• The invention provides a smooth operation with no vibration, due to the perfect alignment of parts and parallel abutting surfaces when in compression.
	• The design ensures that only the wheel can cause vibration, and only if it is not properly balanced during construction.

</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a hydraulic unit for a vehicle brake system, which includes a housing block, a motor, and a covering hood. The unit has at least one pump with a piston that is indirectly drivable by an electric motor via an eccentric.
	*The eccentric is rotatable inside an eccentric chamber, and a conduit extends downward from the eccentric chamber to prevent pressure fluid from entering the electric motor.
	*The conduit is connected to a spring chamber, where the pressure fluid is collected, and a pressure equalization conduit is provided to equalize the pressure between the spring chamber and the interior of the motor.

* The hydraulic unit has a pressure equalization system that prevents water from entering the unit while allowing pressure equalization with the ambient atmosphere.
	*The system includes a cable sheath that surrounds a cable and is connected to a plug part, which is inserted sealingly into a socket in the housing.
	*The cable sheath acts as a pressure equalization conduit between the ambient atmosphere and the interior of the housing and indirectly for the motor as well.

* The invention provides several advantages, including cost savings, a hermetic seal of the unit from the environment, and the ability to immerse the housing block in water without risk of damage.
	*The unit can be produced economically with fewer conduits, and the design allows for the use of a housing block known from prior art without changing its size or basic internal design.
	*The engineer can decide how much pressure fluid should be stored, and the unit can be designed for various applications, including automatic braking and traction control.</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a power and free conveyor system that allows for the transfer of carriers from one predetermined path to another by pushing across a transfer zone in a minimum period of time.
	*The system achieves this through the use of a third dog that is normally urged to an operative carrier pushing position but is held by the track out of operative position, allowing for selective transfer of the carrier over short and long distances.
* The system can accommodate various configurations, including transfers across short and long distances, and can be operated by moving the dogs upwardly simultaneously or sequentially as required.
	*This allows for flexibility in the design and operation of the conveyor system, enabling it to be adapted to different applications and requirements.
* The invention provides a solution to the problem of transferring carriers between conveyors moving at different speeds or in different directions, and can be used in a variety of industries and applications.
	*The system is designed to minimize costs and maintenance, and to provide a reliable and efficient means of transferring carriers between conveyors.</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a grounding product for railroad car center plate assembly bowl liners of the all polymeric type.
	• The liner material used has similar mechanical properties to the liner disclosed in Chierici and Murphy U.S. Pat. No. 4,075,951, but has improved electrical properties.
	• The disclosures in Wulff U.S. Pat. No. 4,241,667 and Chierici and Murphy U.S. Pat. No. 4,075,951 are incorporated by reference.

• The liner is composed of a base ultra high molecular weight polyethylene (UHMW-PE) material with a conductive material additive.
	• The preferred composition is UHMW-PE specially mixed with 2.0% carbon black.
	• The conductive material can be added as a particulate to UHMW-PE in particulate or powder form and then the mixture heated under mold pressure for thermoforming.

• The liner has all the benefits as disclosed in the Chierici et al patent and in addition is conductive, thereby eliminating the need for any additional grounding apparatus.
	• The liner is defined by a high density polymer of dry self lubricating characteristics that is pliable but non-stretchable.
	• The liner is also conductive, made from ultra high molecular weight polyethylene specially mixed with a conductive material such as 2% carbon black.

• The full bowl liner embodiments of the invention contemplate that the liner side wall and floor portion are proportioned to fully fill the space between the truck bolster bowl and the body bolster center plate.
	• The liner side wall is proportioned to fill the space between the bowl side wall and the body bolster center plate side wall.
	• The liner holds the center plate against movement in the plane of the bowl.

• The configuration of the liner is much like the older steel liner, with a flange that extends outwardly from a bevelled portion at an approximately 90 degree angle.
	• This provides a level of line sealing contact with the center plate neck portion.
	• The precise dimensions and proportions can be adapted to particular center bowl needs.

• The liner freely carried in its captured location between the bowl and center plate forms two slip surfaces with the center plate assembly to insure the needed swivelling action of the car trucks with respect to the car body.
	• The primary slip surface is between the upper surface of the liner and the body bolster center plate's lower surface or planar

<summary>
• The invention deals with a valve used for controlling bulk dispensing of viscous substances such as sauces, salad dressings, catsup, mustard, etc.
	• The valve is designed to be operated with one hand while the other hand is holding the receiving vessel.

• The prior art provides two main types of valves for this purpose: the rotatable cylindrical tube type and the ball-type.
	• Both types of valves have limitations, such as not being able to be disassembled for cleaning and allowing for residue accumulation.

• The present invention provides a gate valve that can be mounted on the spout of a bag or pouch.
	• The gate valve includes a tubular sleeve, a dispensing passage, and a gate valve member that can be reciprocated to control the flow of the substance.

• The gate valve member is curved complementally to the guide plate and has a flat-finger lug and a split lug for operation.
	• The gate valve member can be moved between opened and closed positions with the fingers of one hand.

• The valve assembly can be disassembled for cleaning and reassembled easily.
	• The valve can function when the valve assembly is in an inclined position and can be actuated with one hand only.

• The valve provides an effective seal when closed and allows for complete cut-off of the flow.
	• The passage is completely unobstructed when the valve is opened.

• The valve can be used in a dispenser with a bag containing a viscous substance.
	• The dispenser has a vertical slot that receives the spout of the bag and cooperates with flanges to lock it in a downwardly-inclined position.

• The valve assembly can be mounted on the spout of the bag by guiding the tapered sleeve into the spout.
	• The interior surfaces of the spout frictionally seal with the adjacent exterior surface of the sleeve.

• The gate valve member can be moved gradually or quickly between opened and closed positions.
	• The movement of the gate can be controlled by exerting pressure on the lugs of the guide member and the gate valve member.
</summary>

<summary>
  • The present invention provides a vehicle rearview mirror system that is tolerant of different protocols of an output of a vehicle control.
	• The system includes a variable reflective element which assumes a partial reflectance level in response to a drive signal.
	• The mirror control determines the protocol of the output of the vehicle control including monitoring the output of the vehicle control in attempting to conclude a state of the output of the vehicle control.
	• The output of the vehicle control may be gear status information, engine information, alarm information, or door status information.

  • The mirror control may include a microcomputer having software and the microcomputer determines the protocol by software processing.
	• The microcomputer may monitor the output of the vehicle control upon starting of the vehicle and/or upon running of the vehicle.
	• The rearview mirror system may include at least one light sensor and the mirror control may establish a value for the drive signal in response to an output of the at least one light sensor.
	• The mirror control may maintain a reverse-inhibit-running parameter and a reverse-inhibit-ignition-cycle parameter.
</summary>

<summary>
  * The present invention is directed to an anti-lock braking system employing an anti-dive device with a damped telescopic front suspension. The anti-dive device is responsive to the brake force applied to the front wheel.
	*The anti-dive unit is provided on the front surface of the lower portion of each of the telescopic forks or the bottom case in one of the forks.
	*The anti-dive unit is provided with a housing having an upper port communicated with the lower hydraulic chamber, a lower port communicated with the hydraulic relay chamber, and a valve chamber communicating these ports with each other.
  * The anti-lock control unit is provided in a hydraulic pipe by which an output port of the front master cylinder and the input port of each of the brake calipers are connected.
	*The anti-lock control unit consists mainly of a hydraulic pump adapted to be driven by the front wheel when braking, a modulator having a hydraulic control chamber, and a pressure discharge valve provided in a communication passage between the hydraulic control chamber and an oil tank.
	*The sensor consists of a speedup gear into which power is input from the front wheel, a flywheel adapted to be rotated by the speedup gear, a cam means for converting overrun rotation of the flywheel into axial displacement, and an output lever means capable of operating the pressure discharge valve in accordance with the axial displacement of the flywheel.
</summary>

<summary>

* The present invention relates to movable partitions and panels used to separate or insulate cargo during transportation or storage.
	*The invention is particularly useful for multi-temperature transport, where cargo needs to be maintained at different temperatures.
	*The partitions and bulkheads can be used in refrigerated trailers, railcars, or ocean-going containers.
	*The invention aims to improve the efficiency and reduce the costs of temperature-controlled transportation.

* The invention includes an improved partition system with at least two panels independently attached to one or more mounting assemblies.
	*Each panel can be moved independently to define different cargo areas with varying temperatures.
	*The panels can be slidably attached to ceiling-mounted rails or side walls of the trailer.
	*The mounting assembly can be a trolley assembly or any other mechanism that permits rotational, slideable, or hinged movement.

* The panels can be raised and lowered with a minimum of fore and aft clearance, allowing for efficient use of space.
	*The panels can be secured relative to one another with various means, such as straps and buckles or cooperating channels and grooves.
	*The invention can be used without center partition panels, and the panels can be placed side by side to make a full-width horizontal bulkhead.
	*The panels can be separated from one another prior to raising them, reducing the amount of rearward clearance needed.

* The rail system can be modified to accommodate additional panels or panels of different widths.
	*The end rails can be replaced with end caps or omitted entirely, and the longitudinal rails can be replaced with a continuous rail or a series of independently mounted receiving members.
	*The mounting members can be selected to enable the bulkheads to swing open like a door or slide in the axial direction.
	*The rail members can be mounted on a vertical surface, such as a trailer wall.

* The strap and locking mechanism used to raise and lower the panels can be modified to provide additional functionalities.
	*The strap can be positioned over guide pins, and the flange can be rigidly attached to a cam.
	*The cam can be forced upward by a spring to lock the strap in place, and the strap can be pulled downward to lower the bulkhead.
	*The strap can be free to travel over the guide pins as long as it is maintained in a vertical position with substantial tension.

* The invention can be used in various configurations, such as in refrigerated trailers, railcars, or ocean-going containers.
