<summary>
• The invention relates to a novel sanitizable rotary valve for use in liquid chromatography and fluid handling systems, particularly in the pharmaceutical industry.
	• The valve is designed to separate and purify biological macromolecules without the need for disassembly.
	• It features a unique diaphragm-like elastomeric seal that allows for partial separation of the rotor-stator faces for flushing and sanitizing.
	• The valve is suitable for use in simulated moving bed (SMB) counter-current operation and can be used with various types of columns and solid phase media.
	• It provides a simple and reliable means of ensuring sealing of all ports and maintaining an acceptable sealing integrity over a useful life.

• The valve design includes a rotor with a body and a stator with a body, both having inner surfaces that face each other.
	• The rotor has a pair of connection ports and a sealing means comprising a diaphragm with a plurality of rotor port sealing means.
	• The stator has a pair of connection ports and a means for at least one SIP/barrier gutter located on an inner surface of the valve.
	• The valve also includes orthogonal actuating means for incrementally adjusting the rotor perpendicular to its direction of linear motion.

• The invention also includes a multi-port sliding valve with a linear slider and a stator having a plurality of connection ports and associated channels.
	• The valve features a sealing means comprising a diaphragm with at least one slider port sealing means.
	• It also includes at least one connection port capable of being in fluid communication with a source of SIP fluid.
	• The valve has orthogonal separation means for partially separating the slider body from the stator body for flushing and sanitizing.

• The valve is designed to provide a sanitizable slider valve in which the port-sealing faces of the slider and stator may be intermittently flushed and cleaned.
	• It features a fluid barrier stream that continually purges the external limits of the port-sealing faces to prevent accumulation of dried material.
	• The valve is tolerant of imperfect flatness or parallelism of the stator or slider sealing faces.
	• It maintains an acceptable sealing integrity over a useful life at least equal to that of typical chromatographic beds used for pharmaceutical manufacturing purification processes.

• The invention also includes an insert molding process for forming in place a rotary valve diaphragm seal.
	• The process involves affixing a mold base to the rotor and capping the ports of the rotor with flange-forming plugs

<summary>
* The present invention relates to gas-liquid contacting trays and improvements in valve-tray assemblies, particularly an improved tray valve assembly for a process column.
	*The tray valve assembly includes a plurality of apertures formed in the tray having a valve cover mounted thereon.
	*The valve cover is mounted by first and second legs, the first leg being disposed to intercept the flow of liquid across the tray and being wider than the second leg.
	*The legs are mounted to the tray in outwardly slotted portions thereof for defining the orientation of the valve relative to the liquid flow.

* The invention also includes an improved method of mixing vapor with liquid discharged from a downcomer of a process column onto an underlying cross-flow tray.
	*The method comprises forming the tray with a plurality of directional thrust valves disposed therein, the valves being formed of generally circular disc members disposed above circular apertures formed within the tray.
	*The disc members have first and second legs in support thereof, the first leg being wider than said second leg for directing flow therearound.
	*The step of forming the disc members includes biasing the frontal end of the disc which first engages the liquid flow downwardly relative to the rear end for facilitating the directional flow of vapor therethrough.

* The present invention provides a method of and apparatus for enhanced vapor liquid flow manifesting increased efficiency with a directional thrust valve assembly.
	*Such a valve tray assembly is provided by the present invention wherein a circular tray valve is supported by first and second support legs, oriented into the liquid flow of the tray with the first leg having a wider surface area presented to the flow for diverting the flow therearound.
	*The width of the first leg is substantially less than the diameter of the circular valve aperture, about which the liquid is induced to flow into engagement with the vapor passing therethrough.
	*The valve assembly, when used in conjunction with, and outwardly of, a raised active inlet area further controls initially directed liquid flow from the active inlet area beneath the downcomer.

* The invention also includes an alternative embodiment of the valve structure, a stationary upstanding aperture cover having the advantages of the two-leg, slotted orientation.
	*The lead leg is wider than the rear leg and is both angulated and permanently formed in active tray section to facilitate the diversion of liquid flow therearound.
	*The method of formation may include punching, and/or stamping, which is conventional metal forming technology.
	*This figure is provided

<summary>
* The present invention relates to a fluid pressure regulator assembly that generates power while regulating fluid pressure.
	*The assembly reduces variances in output pressure due to large differences in input pressure.
	*It is inexpensive to manufacture and maintain, lightweight, and portable.

* The assembly comprises a pressurized fluid source, a vane motor, a fluid regulator, and a generator.
	*The vane motor converts pressurized fluid into mechanical power, which is then converted into rotational and/or electrical energy.
	*The fluid regulator regulates the pressure of the fluid exiting the vane motor.

* The vane motor is preferably a vane-type motor, but can be any suitable device for translating fluid pressure into mechanical motion.
	*It has a drive shaft, a casing, and a hollow interior with an inner drum and vanes.
	*The vanes are constructed of stainless steel with wear-resistant tips.

* The fluid regulator is preferably of the type known in the art, constructed of steel, with a high-pressure cavity and a low-pressure cavity.
	*The cavities are in fluid communication with each other via an opening with a valve stem.
	*The valve stem is designed to completely seal off fluid communication between the high-pressure and low-pressure cavities.

* The assembly can be used in various applications, such as gas grills, self-contained underwater breathing apparatuses, and welding assemblies.
	*It can be used to generate electricity or mechanical power.
	*It can be constructed of any desired material and dimensions.

* An alternative embodiment of the present invention uses dual vane motors to produce electricity and mechanical work.
	*The first vane motor is coupled to a generator, while the second vane motor is coupled to a pulley and belt.
	*The assembly can be used in vehicles driven by pressurized flammable fluids.

* The present invention provides an advantage by extracting work from pressurized fluid while reducing its pressure.
	*This allows the use of a smaller or more inexpensive pressure regulator.
	*The assembly can be used in conjunction with any number of motors and generators to recover work from pressurized fluid.
</summary>

<summary>
* The pallet system features a pallet with at least one pair of parallel guide rails raised above its top surface, configured to be straddled by side supports of a tray.
	*The space between each pair of guide rails is substantially open, allowing for efficient use of space.
	*The guide rails are raised above the level of a weight bearing area of the top surface of the pallet, providing stability and support.

* The pallet system includes at least one end stop on the top surface of the pallet, positioned to limit longitudinal movement of a tray loaded on the pallet.
	*The end stops may be implemented as a continuous rail across the pallet surface or as individual stops at the ends of the guide rails.
	*The end stops help to secure the trays in place and prevent them from shifting during transport.

* The pallet system includes two end plates, configured to be vertically positioned at edges of the pallet at ends of the guide rails.
	*The end plates have an inside surface shaped to complement contours of the end surfaces of the tray, providing additional stability and support.
	*The end plates may be narrower than the pallet or load, allowing them to be used with pallets and loads of different widths.

* The pallet system allows for efficient loading and unloading of trays, and is suitable for automated loading and unloading.
	*The trays can be slid onto the pallet along the guide rails, and the end stops help to secure them in place.
	*The pallet system provides enhanced stability when loaded and wrapped, reducing the risk of damage to the trays and their contents.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to an electrical driven flying saucer based on magnetic suspension, which comprises a saucer shell, a saucer cabin, a rotary-wing system, and a control system.
	* The rotary-wing system is a magnetic suspension electromotive rotary-wing system, which includes magnetic suspension rotary-wing wheels, an electromotive ring, a magnetic suspension shaft, and a magnetic suspension guide rail.

* The magnetic suspension rotary-wing wheels are suspended in the space restricted by the electromotive ring, the magnetic suspension shaft, and the magnetic suspension guide rail, and go around the magnetic suspension shaft under an electromagnetic thrust.
	* The magnetic suspension rotary-wing wheels comprise blades, a magnetic suspension inner ring, and a magnetic suspension outer ring, which are connected along the radial direction to form an impeller.

* The magnetic suspension electromotive flying saucer has a compact design structure, reasonable layout, small weight, and high motive power conversion efficiency, and its rotary-wing system and power system can be easily manipulated and controlled.
	* The design of the rotary-wing suspension structure avoids the contact and friction between the high-speed rotary-wing and the interior of the saucer shell, reduces the noise and vibration, and guarantees the operational safety.

* The present invention also provides two improvement solutions, including coaxial axial dual magnetic suspension electromotive rotary wings and coaxial radial dual magnetic suspension electromotive rotary wings, which can overcome the reactive torque of the rotary wing and realize stable and easy power control.
	* The coaxial axial dual magnetic suspension electromotive rotary wings include an upper rotary-wing system and a lower rotary-wing system, which rotate in reverse directions and provide lift or forward thrust in the same time.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to streptavidin muteins, which are modified forms of streptavidin that have improved binding affinity for peptide ligands. These muteins are useful for the isolation, purification, and determination of biological substances, particularly recombinant proteins.

	• The streptavidin muteins of the invention have at least one mutation in the region of amino acid positions 44 to 53, which results in a higher binding affinity for peptide ligands compared to wild-type streptavidin.
	• The muteins can be produced using recombinant DNA technology and can be used in various applications, including affinity chromatography, Western blot, and ELISA.

• The invention also relates to a process for the production of streptavidin muteins, which involves transforming a host cell with a vector containing a nucleic acid coding for the mutein, culturing the host cell, and isolating the mutein.

	• The streptavidin muteins can be used in a labelled form, where they carry at least one label, such as a radiolabel, fluorescent label, or chromophore label.
	• The muteins can also be used to immobilize proteins that are fused with a peptide sequence, allowing for the purification and detection of these proteins.

• The streptavidin muteins of the invention have several advantages over conventional streptavidin, including improved binding affinity and the ability to bind to peptide ligands under mild conditions.

	• The muteins can be used in a variety of applications, including the purification and detection of recombinant proteins, and can be used in combination with other streptavidin ligands, such as biotin and derivatives thereof.
	• The invention also relates to a reagent kit that contains a streptavidin mutein and optional standard buffer and auxiliary substances and additives, which can be used in various methods, including isolation, purification, and determination methods.</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to methods of forming substituted guanidines utilizing nickel catalysts.
	• Nickel catalysts are used to guanylate amines or pyrrolidines with guanylating agents such as thioureas or isothioureas.
	• The nickel catalysts are preferably derived from nickel-boride alloys, nickel-phosphide alloys, aluminum-nickel alloys, nickel on kieselguhr, and nickel on silica/alumina.
	• The guanylating agents are preferably thioureas and isothioureas, which have specific general formulas and can be protected with groups such as Boc or Cbz.
	• The reactions are preferably carried out at room temperature in a solvent system, and the nickel catalyst can be recovered and reused.

• The invention provides a method for synthesizing N-substituted and N,N-disubstituted guanidines from bis-protected thioureas in the presence of a nickel catalyst.
	• The protecting groups can be easily cleaved from the resulting guanidines under mild reaction conditions.
	• The bis-protected thioureas can be utilized to guanylate both aromatic and aliphatic primary and secondary amines at room temperature with high yields.
	• The reaction scheme involves the formation of a carbodiimide intermediate, which then reacts with the amine to give the corresponding guanidine.
	• The nickel catalyst promotes the guanylation reaction by coordinating with the divalent sulfur of the thiourea and undergoing oxidative insertion.

• The invention also provides a method for synthesizing N-arylsulfonyl protected methylisothioureas and their use in guanylation reactions.
	• The N-arylsulfonyl protected methylisothioureas can be used to guanylate aliphatic and aromatic amines in the presence of a nickel catalyst.
	• The reaction scheme involves the formation of a carbodiimide intermediate, which then reacts with the amine to give the corresponding guanidine.
	• The nickel catalyst promotes the guanylation reaction by coordinating with the divalent sulfur of the isothiourea and undergoing oxidative insertion.
	• The reaction conditions can be optimized by varying the solvent and temperature.

• The invention provides several examples of guanylation reactions using different nickel catalysts and guanylating agents.
	• The examples demonstrate the effectiveness of the nickel catalysts in promoting the guanylation reactions.
	• The reactions can

<summary>
* The present invention relates to a novel apparatus and a method for continuously electrolytic coloring of strips or wires of aluminum or aluminum base alloys.
	* The invention provides an apparatus and a method for continuously conducting an anodic oxidation and an electrolytic coloring of an aluminum strip or wire without need for a large amount of electrical energy.

* The apparatus of this invention comprises a means for continuously supplying an aluminum strip or wire, an anodic oxidation bath, an electrolytic coloring bath, an electric circuit, and a means for passing the aluminum strip or wire continuously and successively through the baths.
	* The anodic oxidation bath composition used in this invention is usually an aqueous solution of 10 to 55% sulfuric acid.

* The thickness of the oxide film formed on an aluminum strip or wire by the anodic oxidation is thicker than 4 microns.
	* If the thickness of the oxide film is less than 4 microns, the oxide film formed on the aluminum strip or wire tends to not be colored by the electrolytic coloring treatment.

* The electric current used in the anodic oxidation can be a direct current or direct and alternating superposed currents.
	* In the latter case, the occurrence of local dissolution of the oxide film formed can be prevented.

* The aluminum strip or wire having the oxide film or layer formed in the anodization is, then, continuously immersed in an electrolytic bath containing at least one of a nickel salt, a cobalt salt, a copper salt, a tin salt, and selenious acid.
	* The bath composition for the electrolytic coloring bath used in this invention is selected suitably from the above-described components depending on the desired color.

* The aluminum strip or wire immersed continuously in the electrolytic coloring bath is rendered capable of functioning as a cathode indirectly by the action of the electrode disposed in the bath.
	* The current density and the electrolytic period of time in the bath are controlled by the area of the aluminum strip or wire immersed, the amount of electric current applied, and the period of immersion of the aluminum strip or wire.

* The apparatus of this invention will be explained practically by the embodiment illustrated in the accompanying drawing.
	* Various modifications within the scope of this invention are also employed in this invention in addition to the embodiment shown.

* The aluminum strip or wire passed through the electrolytic coloring bath is introduced in the sealing bath through the wash bath.
	* The sealing bath is employed for accomplishing a conventional sealing treatment, such as

<summary>
* The invention relates to a process of producing transgenic plants transformed on a chromosome, a process of screening nucleotide sequences for a desired phenotype in plants, and transgenic plants and libraries of plants or plant seeds obtained or obtainable according to the processes of the invention.
	*The process involves providing plant cells or plants with at least two different vectors that are adapted to recombine with each other by site-specific recombination in the plant cells for producing a non-replicating recombination product containing a DNA sequence of interest.
	*The DNA sequence of interest contains sequence portions from at least two of the at least two different vectors, which are necessary for expressing a function of interest from the DNA sequence of interest.
	*The process allows for the production of transgenic plants or plant cells that are stably transformed on a chromosome with a DNA sequence of interest, which can be used for various applications such as DNA library screening, gene function analysis, and functional genomics.
</summary>

<summary>

* The present invention relates to a swash plate type compressor for compressing a refrigerant gas, by rotating a swash plate.
	*The swash plate type compressor has been used in automotive air conditioning systems for many years.
	*The compressor has a cylinder block with cylinder bores disposed parallel to the axis of the cylinder block.
	*A rotary shaft rotatably mounted within the cylinder block carries an aluminum swash plate.

* The swash plate has two facial surfaces and an end surface that contact pivoting shoes within the pistons.
	*The facial and end surfaces of the swash plate are subject to high load conditions and are susceptible to premature wear.
	*The interfacial surfaces between the swash plate and pistons are subject to very high load conditions and are susceptible to premature wear.
	*Protecting these surfaces from wear increases the life of the compressor and also increases the compressor efficiency.

* The present invention is directed to a swash plate type compressor having a cylinder block with cylinder bores disposed parallel to the axis of the cylinder block.
	*A rotary shaft rotatably mounted within the cylinder block carries an aluminum swash plate.
	*The swash plate is fixed to the rotary shaft and has two facial surfaces and an end surface.
	*The facial surfaces have between 0.0005 inches (12.7 μm) to 0.002 inches (50.8 μm) of a heat curable, cross-linked coating.

* The coating comprises a polyfluoro elastomer bonded directly to the aluminum, a lubricious additive and a load bearing additive.
	*The polyfluoro elastomer is dissolved in either a water base or hydrocarbon solution.
	*The polyfluoro elastomer is selected from a class of materials which will form highly cross-linked long chain polymers.
	*Especially preferred are polyfluoro elastomers of polytetraflouroethylene (PTFE).

* The lubricious additive is selected from a group of materials that provide reduced friction in applications that use little or no oil.
	*Such lubricious materials include carbon black, molydisulfide, cesium fluoride, lithium fluoride and mixtures thereof.
	*The load bearing additive is selected from a group of materials that provide high hardness and durability in dry conditions.
	*Such load bearing materials include boron carbide, boron nitride, oxides of aluminum, oxides of magnesium, spinels of aluminum, spinels of magnesium, silicon carb

<summary>
* The present invention relates to organic polymers suitable for use in anti-reflective coatings on semiconductor devices, and methods for preparing them.
	*The polymers of the present invention can be used to form a layer which prevents the reflection of light from lower layers coated on a semiconductor chip when photolithography processes using short wavelength light sources are employed.
	*The polymers of the present invention are designed to facilitate light absorption at wavelengths of 193 nm and 248 nm by having groups that absorb light strongly at both wavelengths.
	*The polymers of the present invention form a cross-linked structure when they are coated on a wafer and baked at high temperatures, allowing them to form an organic anti-reflective coating material which is spectroscopically stable under conventional photolithographic conditions.

* The present invention also provides an anti-reflective coating composition containing a polymer of the present invention alone or in combination with other light-absorbing compounds, and the anti-reflective coating formed from these compositions, as well as preparation methods therefor.
	*The anti-reflective coating composition of the present invention is prepared by dissolving a polymer of the present invention in an organic solvent, and subsequently adding thereto one or more compounds selected from the group consisting of anthracene and its derivatives, fluorenone derivatives, fluorene and its derivatives, fluorenol, xanthone, quinazarin and fluorescein.
	*The organic solvent used for the preparation can be any suitable conventional organic solvent, preferably a solvent selected from the group consisting of ethyl 3-ethoxypropionate, methyl 3-methoxypropionate, cyclohexanone, propylene glycol and methyletheracetate.
	*The amount of the solvent used in preparing the anti-reflective coating composition according to the present invention is preferably 200-5000% (w/w) with respect to the weight of the polymer used.
</summary>

<summary>
  • The invention relates to a white, flame-retardant, UV-resistant, thermoformable, oriented film made from a crystallizable thermoplastic, with a thickness of 10-350 μm, comprising at least one white pigment, one flame retardant, and one UV absorber.
	• The film has good orientability and thermoformability, and very good optical and mechanical properties, and can be produced cost-effectively.

  • The film comprises a crystallizable thermoplastic principal constituent, such as polyethylene terephthalate, polybutylene terephthalate, or polyethylene naphthalate, and may be a single-layer or multilayer film.
	• The film may also have a coating of various copolyesters or adhesion promoters, and may be produced using known coextrusion technology.

</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to an improved method for producing 143a (1,1,1-trifluoroethane) by continuous gas phase hydrofluorination of 1,1-difluoro-1-chloroethane using heterogeneous catalysis.
	• The process uses a chromium salt catalyst, which may be unsupported or supported, in the absence or presence of a cocatalyst selected from nickel, cobalt, and manganese salts.
	• The reaction is carried out at a temperature between 30° C. and 400° C., preferably between 100° C. and 250° C.
	• The molar ratio of HF to 142b can vary between greater than 1:1 and 20:1, preferably between greater than 1:1 and 10:1.
	• The process can be carried out using 142b as a feed and 1,1-dichloro-1-fluoroethane (141b), 1,1,1,3,3-pentafluorobutane (365), or HCl as a co-feed.
	• The reactor effluent will contain 143a, HCl, and HF, which can be separated by distillation or other methods known in the art.
	• The process can be carried out in an adiabatic reactor, which provides a method for producing 143a at high conversion and selectivity using a simple reactor design and a specific range of initial temperatures and HF/142b molar feed ratios.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to an improved process for the deacylation and desulfurization of a compound having a specific formula, using hypophosphorous acid to improve product yield and reduce impurities.
	• The process involves reacting an acylated compound with an aqueous mixture of hypophosphorous acid and hydrochloric acid or hydrobromic acid.
	• The use of hypophosphorous acid reduces the amount of elemental sulfur and sulfur-containing organic impurities formed during the reaction.

• The starting materials for the process are triazolothiadiazines, which can be prepared by reacting 4-amino-5-mercapto-3-substituted-1,2,4-triazoles with alpha-haloketones or by reacting 2-hydrazino-5-substituted-1,3,4-thiadiazines with acyl halides.
	• The triazolothiadiazines are then acylated using an anhydride, and the resulting acylated compound is reacted with hypophosphorous acid and hydrochloric acid or hydrobromic acid.

• The process has several advantages, including the formation of H2S instead of sulfur, which is readily removed from the reaction zone, and the fact that hypophosphorous acid does not reduce nitro groups or affect other functional groups in the molecule.
	• The process is also straightforward and economical to carry out, making it readily adaptable by industry.

• The invention provides a process for the preparation of 3,6-di-substituted-1H-pyrazolo[5,1-c]-1,2,4-triazoles from their triazolothiadiazine precursors.
	• The process involves reacting the triazolothiadiazine with an acylating agent to form an acylated intermediate, and then reacting the acylated intermediate with hypophosphorous acid and hydrochloric acid or hydrobromic acid.

• The R, R', and R" radicals in the compounds used as starting materials and produced as intermediates and desired products are defined as "inert substituents" that meet certain criteria.
	• The criteria include stability under process conditions, non-reactivity towards other reagents, and not preventing the formation of the desired compound.

• The process can be conducted in the presence of a catalytic quantity of a Bronsted or Lewis acid, and the reaction conditions can be varied to optimize

<summary>
* The invention relates to a method and apparatus for forming fiber mixtures from a plurality of fiber types by sequentially taking partial quantities from different fiber lots.
	*The method involves measuring the entire momentary quantity of the stored fiber lot prior to the first pass or prior to each pass of the bale opener.
	*The measured quantity is used to determine a partial quantity that corresponds to a predetermined proportion of the momentary entire quantity.
	*The determined partial quantity is continuously removed only from the measured fiber lot.
	*The process is repeated for each fiber bale in sequence, with the partial quantities being taken off the fiber bales in a predetermined number of bale opening passes.
	*The method ensures that all fiber bales are opened without fiber residuals and that an optimally homogeneous mixture is obtained.

* The apparatus includes a bale opener, a quantity measuring device, and a control device that controls the mode of operation of the opener as a function of the signals transmitted by the quantity measuring device.
	*The bale opener may be a plucker, stripper roll, spiked apron, or picker.
	*The quantity measuring device may be a frequency counter, weighing device, or height-measuring arrangement.
	*The control device determines the precise partial quantities to be removed and controls the fiber removing operation.
	*The control device may have a timing relay that predetermines a maximum period to ensure that the partial quantity from each stored fiber lot is removed not later than at the end of the predetermined period.

* The method and apparatus are particularly adapted for making mixtures of throughout constant quantity proportions.
	*The initial total quantity of each fiber bale is measured, and a constant partial quantity is calculated once.
	*The partial quantities are removed from the fiber bales in succession in a fixed number of passes.
	*The method ensures that the opening of the fiber bales can be effected within a predetermined period.
	*The supply of after-connected processing machines with fiber tufts can be ensured by coordinating the output rate of the bale opener with that of the after-connected processing machines.

* The invention also relates to a preferred embodiment of the method and apparatus.
	*The fiber removal from the stored fiber lot can be accelerated to ensure that the partial quantities are removed not later than the lapse of the predetermined period.
	*The control device may have a control apparatus and a computer that determines the precise partial quantities to be removed and controls the fiber removing operation.
	*The control apparatus may have a timing

<summary>
• The present invention relates to a method and apparatus for forming bias laid, non-woven fabrics with yarns laid at an angle of from 30° to 150° to the long axis of the fabric.
	• The invention provides a rake mechanism that is synchronized with, but driven separately from, the conveyors, yarn carrying means, and bonding mechanism.
	• The rake mechanism is used to accept and retain the yarns being carried by the yarn carrying means at either end of the extremities of travel of the yarn carrying means.

• The apparatus for stitching the various layers of the bias laid, non-woven fabric together can be any of the machines presently employed in the textile industry for such a purpose.
	• The machine can be a stitching machine, a knitting machine, or a device which applies an adhesive at selected points along the fabric length and width in order to hold the yarns together.
	• The bonding mechanism can be a Liba Copcentra-HS stitching machine, which is provided with an oscillating crank mechanism that slows down near the end of each stroke.

• The yarn carriers move back and forth between the moving conveyors, and each yarn carrier carries a plurality of individual, equally spaced yarns.
	• The yarn carriers are caused to move beyond each conveyor and its associated rake system, and as the yarn carrier passes beyond the rake system, it moves downwardly.
	• The yarns being carried by the yarn carrier are accepted between the needles of the rake mechanism on the appropriate side of the fabric forming apparatus.

• The rake system is used to place the yarns onto or between the appropriate needles on the conveyors of the fabric forming mechanism.
	• The yarns can be placed between adjacent needles on the conveyors, or can be impaled on those needles.
	• The rake system can be moved a distance which is the same as the width of the yarns being carried by the yarn carrying means, or may move a distance equivalent to only a portion of the width of the yarns.

• The density of the fabric can be controlled by overlapping of return courses on first courses.
	• This is accomplished without loss of parallelism, and the amount of overlap is dependent upon the width of the yarns in the carrier.
	• The amount of movement of the rake systems and of the carriers in a direction opposite the direction of fabric formation is dependent upon the speed of the conveyor.

• The fabric formed in accordance with the present process is generally used in the formation of structural

<summary>
• The present invention relates to weft insertion in a multiple-color air jet loom, providing a method and apparatus for inserting different weft threads with a weft carrying force suited for each thread.
	• This is achieved by ejecting air from main nozzles or subnozzles under different pressures or for different intervals of time, allowing for stable insertion of various weft threads while preventing undue consumption of pressurized air.

• The invention includes various embodiments, such as dividing subnozzles into groups with different spacings or orifice diameters, using regulators to supply air under different pressures, and employing directional control valves to selectively supply air to main nozzles or subnozzles.
	• These embodiments enable the production of different weft carrying forces, allowing for the efficient insertion of different weft threads, including thicker and thinner threads, in a multiple-color air jet loom.

• The invention also includes control systems, such as electric signal generators and on-off command units, to regulate the supply of pressurized air to main nozzles and subnozzles.
	• These control systems enable the precise control of air pressure and ejection timing, reducing the occurrence of weft insertion failures and stabilizing the weft insertion process.

• The present invention is applicable to air jet looms using more than two different weft threads and can be modified to incorporate various features from different embodiments.
	• The invention provides a flexible and efficient solution for weft insertion in multiple-color air jet looms, allowing for the production of high-quality fabrics with varying weft thread types and thicknesses.
</summary>

<summary>
  * The present invention relates to a bast fibre yarn obtained through spinning bast fibres, and a process of making thereof, in particular, relates to a bast fibre yarn obtained through twice health-preserving bast fibres and blended spinning bast fibres and other fibres, together with a process of making thereof.
	*The process for spinning bast fibres comprises the steps of health preserving bast fibres, opening, cleaning, and carding the health preserved bast fibres, then drawing the carded health preserved bast fibres into bast fibre strips, health preserving said bast fibre strips, and spinning the health preserved bast fibre strips into bast fibre yarn.
  * The invention also provides a multi-fibre yarn obtained through blended spinning bast fibres and other fibres, and further provide an efficient process of making thereof, which may also with low end breakage rate.
	*The process for blended spinning bast fibres and other fibres comprises the steps of health preserving bast fibres, blending the health preserved bast fibres with other fibres, then opening, cleaning, and carding the blended fibres, after that drawing the carded blended fibres into multi-fibre strips, health preserving said multi-fibre strips, and spinning the health preserved multi-fibre strips into multi-fibre yarn.
</summary>

<summary>
  • The present invention relates to rolls for use in nipped roll presses, particularly in the manufacture of paper, and provides apparatus and methods for accurately detecting, measuring, and removing the effects of rotational variability from a covered roll used in nip presses.
	• The invention uses multiple sensors circumferentially spaced at various cross-directional positions along the sensing roll to cancel the effects of rotational variability.
	• The sensors are designed to measure the pressure being placed against the web that is being advanced through the nip press.
	• The pressure measurements from the multiple sensors for each cross-directional position are averaged and used to calculate and display the nip pressure profile that is developed across the nip region.
  • The invention provides advantages over sensing rolls and systems that utilize a single sensor assigned to measure the pressure at a particular cross-directional position.
	• The use of multiple sensors allows for the calculation and display of a rotational variability profile, which can provide the operator with additional real-time information to obtain a more accurate nip pressure profile.
	• The invention can compensate for rotational variability in the sensing mechanism by calculating an average pressure value at each cross-directional position.
</summary>

<summary>
  * The invention is a combination electrical cord support and article holder for an ironing board, designed to keep the electrical cord of an electric iron organized and out of the way while ironing, and to hold small items such as spray starch or a beverage container within easy reach.
    * The device consists of a clamp that attaches to the ironing board, a flexible cord support that can be raised or lowered, and a detachable article holder that can be removed when not in use.
    * The cord support has a coiled spring section that allows it to flex and move, and a locking tab that keeps it in place when raised.
    * The article holder has a circular hoop and a pair of support bars that form a base for holding small items, and can be detached from the clamp by removing the tangs from the openings in the second brace.
 
  * The device also includes an electrical outlet that can be mounted to the clamp, allowing the iron to be plugged in and kept organized.
    * The outlet can be mounted in different locations, such as below the article holder or to the side, depending on the user's preference.
    * The device is designed to be easy to use and install, and can be removed from the ironing board when not in use, making it a convenient and practical solution for ironing needs.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to buttonhole controlling devices for a sewing machine.
	*The device is designed to select the length of a buttonhole to be sewn and automatically sew a buttonhole of the selected length.
	*The device is effective regardless of the type of material being sewn.
	*The device prevents the formation of open buttonholes or buttonholes with overlapping stitches.

* The buttonhole controlling device includes a foot pad and a travelling assembly.
	*The travelling assembly moves with the work fed during the sewing of a buttonhole.
	*The travelling assembly includes a slidable member that may be positioned by a button for which a buttonhole is to be sewn.
	*The slidable member carries a tab to actuate a tripping lever on the machine.

* The device includes an adjustable stop mounted on the travelling assembly.
	*The adjustable stop engages the tripping lever to terminate the formation of a buttonhole.
	*The adjustable stop allows the operator to precisely define the closure point of the buttonhole.
	*The adjustable stop prevents the formation of open buttonholes or buttonholes with overlapping stitches.

* The device is attached to a presser bar of a sewing machine.
	*The device includes a foot pad that attaches to the presser bar.
	*The foot pad includes a slot to receive a pin affixed in the foot pad.
	*The device includes a travelling assembly that moves with the work fed during the sewing of a buttonhole.

* The device includes a gaging element that may be shifted away from an anchor element.
	*The gaging element includes an upstanding abutment and a set of rails.
	*The gaging element may be used to center and locate a button.
	*The gaging element includes a tab to actuate a tripping lever on the machine.

* The device includes a tripping lever that controls the operation of the sewing machine.
	*The tripping lever is actuated by the tab on the gaging element.
	*The tripping lever controls flexible contacts to cause the machine to sew a buttonhole.
	*The tripping lever is engaged by the adjustable stop to terminate the formation of a buttonhole.

* The device allows the operator to adjust the length of the buttonhole.
	*The operator can adjust the position of the adjustable stop.
	*The operator can adjust the screw to change the position of the adjustable stop.
	*The operator can use a sample piece of material to test the device and

<summary>
* The invention relates to an apparatus for treating a dyed or printed textile web with a liquid such as a washing or rinsing solution.
	*The apparatus includes a conveyor, a liquid applicator, a suction device, and a dwell stretch.
	*The conveyor has an endless sieve belt for transporting the textile web along a predetermined substantially horizontal path.

* The liquid applicator is disposed at a first station along the path for applying the liquid to the web during motion thereof along the path.
	*The suction device is disposed at a second station along the path at a point downstream of the first station for removing the liquid from the web by a suction process during motion of the web along the path.
	*The suction device preferably extends transversely to the web and to the belt and is disposed below and substantially juxtaposed to an upper section of the belt.

* The dwell stretch is disposed between the applicator and the suction device for conducting the textile web in a spread-out condition and in a single layer through at least one dwell loop.
	*The dwell stretch may be formed by an air pass, wherein the textile web is completely free of support or guiding elements at least along major portions of the dwell stretch or loop.
	*The dwell stretch may also include at least one freely rotatable drum disposed above the upper section of the sieve belt.

* The apparatus can have a compact construction, particularly if the textile web is guided back from the dwell loop to the sieve belt at a point downstream and closely adjacent to the point where the web leaves the belt.
	*The suction device is advantageously disposed near the point of return of the web to the sieve belt.
	*The suction device causes the textile web to adhere to the belt and to be entrained thereby.

* The textile web is guided in a single layer in a spread-out state and lies tensionless on the upper section of the sieve belt.
	*The textile web then passes a spray pipe having spray nozzles distributed over the width of the web, a washing or rinsing liquid being applied via the nozzles to the top side of the textile web substantially uniformly over the width thereof.
	*The textile web then passes through a dwell stretch in the form of an air pass or a sieve drum.

* The dwell stretch includes at least one freely rotatable drum disposed above the upper section of the sieve belt.
	*The dwell loop extends around the drum.
	*The dwell stretch further includes at least two rollers disposed laterally adjacent to one another

<summary>
• The dry cleaning machine has a separate air flow system for bringing ambient air into the access opening whenever the door is opened, which is exclusive of the air recirculating system and substantially reduces exhausting the residual solvent vapors from the tubs.
	• The system includes a separate intake fan and duct with a normally closed valve that isolates the intake system from the solvent vapors during normal operation.
	• The valve opens and the fan is energized when the access door is opened, drawing air into the access opening and directly into the interposed duct.
	• The system minimizes the loss of solvent by retaining the vapors within the tubs.

• The machine has a solvent flow system that includes a pump, filters, and valves that control the flow of solvent through the tubs.
	• The system has a stand-by condition where there is no flow of solvent, and a fill and wash portion where the solvent is pumped into the tubs.
	• The system also has a dump and spin portion where the solvent is drained from the tubs, and a tumble dry with heat portion where the solvent is isolated from the circulating drying air.
	• The system includes a backwash operation that reverses the flow of solvent through the filters.

• The air flow system has a stand-by condition with the access door closed, where there is no airflow.
	• During the fill and wash portion, there is no airflow, and the valves remain closed.
	• During the drain and spin portion, the valves are open to balance air pressure, but close during the spin portion to prevent airflow.
	• During the tumble dry with heat portion, the valves are open, and the blower is energized.

• The machine has a solvent vapor handling system that includes a lint box, an expandable bag, and a safety release valve.
	• The system retains the air-vapor mixture in the bag during the fill and wash portion.
	• The system permits the air-vapor mixture to flow back into the flow stream during the dry portion.
	• The system condenses the solvent vapor and separates it from the water vapor.
	• The system returns the solvent to the storage tank.

• The refrigeration system has a compression-type refrigeration unit that condenses the vapors in the condenser box.
	• The system cools the storage tank under all portions of the cycle except the drying portion.
	• The system has a thermostat that controls the refrigeration unit.
	• The system has a switch that controls

<summary>
• The present invention relates to methods and apparatus for spinning thermoplastic polymer filaments, particularly using non-eductive drawing.
	• This approach aims to overcome the limitations of conventional eductive and non-eductive systems, such as turbulence, plugging, and high energy consumption.

• The invention involves an initial quench chamber and a continuous two-dimensional slot across the entire machine width, producing a linear plane of filaments with substantially constant filament distribution.
	• This design allows for good control of cross-machine uniformity and is simpler compared to both eductive and non-eductive systems.

• No air is educted into the system, and the same air is used for quenching and drawing the filaments, eliminating the need for separate air sources and associated equipment.
	• This design also reduces noise levels and allows for higher quench pressures without structural deflection problems.

• The drawing chamber is relatively small, and the nozzle length parallel to the fiber/air stream is substantially reduced, minimizing turbulence and system hygiene issues.
	• The small amount of close tolerance machined surface area exposed to the fiber stream collects less dirt and debris, making cleaning simpler and faster.

• The position of the air knives relative to each other determines the size of the drawing nozzle opening and thus the velocity of the air going through the nozzle.
	• Filament denier can be easily changed by adjusting the size of the nozzle opening or other parameters such as air flow rate, exhaust air flow rate, and quench air temperature.

• The invention also incorporates aspects of meltblown processes to improve web formation control, allowing for better fiber distribution and a more isotropic web.
	• The velocity energy of the system expands and dissipates quickly, resulting in slower laydown speeds and better web uniformity.

• The web forming table is positioned below the slot of the quench chamber to receive filaments and form them into a non-woven web, which can be further strengthened by conventional techniques.
	• The nonwoven fabric can be wound into rolls for ease of shipping to final end users.

• The invention is useful for producing fine continuous filaments, even if they are not formed into a spunbond web, such as for pillow and cushion stuffing or baling and selling.
	• The method and apparatus of the present invention are extremely flexible and can be varied to accommodate a wide variety of materials and operating conditions.
</summary>

<summary>
• Sewing Machine Configuration
	• The sewing machine 1 includes a bed 11, a pillar 12, an arm 13, and a head 14.
	• A needle plate 34 is disposed on a top surface of the bed 11.
	• A feed dog, a feed mechanism, a shuttle mechanism, and a feed adjustment motor 83 are provided below the needle plate 34.
	• A liquid crystal display (LCD) 15 is provided on the front face of the pillar 12.

• Ultrasonic Pen Configuration
	• The ultrasonic pen 91 includes a pen body 910 and a pen tip 911.
	• A switch 913, a signal output circuit 914, and an ultrasonic transmitter 915 are provided inside the pen body 910.
	• The switch 913 is turned on and off in accordance with the position of the pen tip 911.
	• The signal output circuit 914 outputs an electrical signal to the sewing machine 1 via a cable 912.

• Receiver Configuration
	• The receivers 94 and 95 are provided at the lower left end and the lower right end of the head 14.
	• The receivers 94 and 95 have the same configuration and are configured to receive an ultrasonic wave.
	• The receivers 94 and 95 are separated from each other in the left-right direction by the length of the head 14.
	• The receivers 94 and 95 are provided above the top surface of the bed 11.

• Position Identification Method
	• The sewing machine 1 identifies a position on the work cloth 100 specified using the ultrasonic pen 91.
	• The position is identified by calculating the specified coordinates E (Xe, Ye, Ze) based on the transmission timing T1 and the detection timings T2.
	• The specified coordinates E are calculated by solving simultaneous equations represented by Formulas (5) and (6).
	• The values Xe and Ye are calculated by solving the simultaneous equations.

• Processing Flow
	• The CPU 61 performs main processing in accordance with the program stored in the ROM 62.
	• The CPU 61 determines whether an electrical signal output from the signal output circuit 914 has been detected.
	• The CPU 61 identifies a time at which the electrical signal is detected and acquires the identified time as the transmission timing T1.
	• The CPU 61 determines whether the ultrasonic wave has been detected

<summary>
• The present invention relates to fabrics and textiles, particularly cellulosic fabric or textile materials, and methods of applying functional utility enhancing preparations onto a cellulosic material.
	• The invention aims to provide textile articles with improved functional durability.
	• The preparation comprises a blended mixture of wool particles or wool powder and a binding agent, with the functional additive carried by the wool particles.
	• The wool particles or wool powder are preferably of macrofibril size or below.
	• The preparation can also comprise powdered bamboo fibre, carrier agents, and binding agents.

• The method of preparing the preparation involves pulverizing wool to obtain ultrafine wool powder, forming an ultrafine wool suspension, and adding functional additives.
	• The method may also involve pulverizing the wool powder into a suspension of ultrafine wool particles by ultrasonic crushing.
	• The duration of the ultrasonic pulverizing and homogenization process may last for 20-40 minutes and 5-15 minutes, respectively.
	• The preparation can be bonded or deposited onto the textile material by printing, padding, or foam application.

• The functional additives may include additives for ultraviolet protection, anti-bacteria, or other clothing functions.
	• The wool particles or wool powder may have a size of 200 nm or below.
	• The wool particles or wool powder may have a helix or helical structure capable of carrying the functional additives.
	• The functional additive may comprise an anti-UV agent, such as zinc oxide or titanium oxide.

• The preparation may be applied to various types of cellulosic fabric materials, including cotton or linen.
	• The cellulosic fabric material may comprise pulverized bamboo blended into the fabric material.
	• The preparation may be bonded to or deposited onto the cellulosic fabric.
	• The bonding or deposition may be by printing, padding, or foam application.

• The invention provides enhanced moisture management, wicking, and/or wrinkling resistance properties to the article.
	• The ultrafine bamboo powder may have a particle size of less than 1 μm.
	• The binding agent may be acrylic copolymer-based, and the acrylic copolymer may be aqueous dispersed.
	• The carrier agent may comprise wool particles or wool powder of macrofibril size and below.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to an automatic quilting machine for use in stitching individual selected patterns into a large fabric such as a bedspread or quilt.
	• The machine comprises a large frame, usually made of metal, onto which the fabric to be sewn is spread.
	• The sewing machine head is mounted on a cross beam which is aligned at the approximate center point of the metal frame on which the fabric is stretched.
	• The needle of the sewing machine head can stitch a pattern into any location in the fabric and the metal frame is moved in any direction relative to the fixed sewing machine head in order to bring the desired stitch location on the fabric into alignment with the sewing machine head.

• The present invention also relates to a reprogrammable function integrated into the system wherein the operator first manually draws the desired pattern on a monitor using conventional graphic systems apparatus such as a mouse.
	• The tracing function is facilitated through a computer aided design program which automatically converts the drawn pattern into computer language which then can cause the stitch to be reprogrammed at any desired location on the fabric.
	• An example of such a computer aided design program is AutoSketch-R or AutoCad-R which are federally registered trademarks of Autodesk, Inc.
	• At the end of this step, the traced pattern is stored into the memory of the computer as a digitalized image of the pattern embodied in the computer aided design program.

• The present invention also relates to a system wherein the sewing machine function is controlled by one computer usually connected to the sewing machine head and the quilting table motion in the X-direction, Y-direction, and X-Y direction is controlled by a separate computer.
	• When it is desired to change a sewing machine computer function such as a stitch or accessory functions such as trim, the sewing machine computer can be independently reprogrammed.
	• When it is desired to change the pattern, the separate computer controlling the X-Y table movement direction can be independently reprogrammed.
	• It is not necessary to reprogram both functions which is an enormous task.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to methods of making nonwoven fabrics, particularly a method of manufacturing a two-sided nonwoven fabric exhibiting a three-dimensional image.
	*The method involves providing a first precursor web comprising a first fibrous matrix and a second precursor web comprising a second fibrous matrix.
	*The first and second precursor webs are advanced onto the imaging surface of the image transfer device.
	*Hydroentanglement of the precursor web is affected to form a three-dimensionally imaged fabric.
	*The incorporation of a fiber distribution control layer acts to limit the ability of the fibrous constituent of the first precursor web and the second precursor web from becoming extensively intermixed.
	*The nonwoven fabric exhibits sufficient resistance to delamination and a pronounced difference in surface performance properties inherent to the fibrous matrix used.

* The present invention also contemplates the use of a fluid-pervious support layer or scrim to act as the fiber distribution control layer.
	*The support layer or scrim may be any suitable material, including wovens, knits, open mesh scrims, and/or nonwoven fabrics.
	*The support layer or scrim is preferably a thermoplastic spunbond nonwoven fabric.
	*The support layer or scrim may be maintained in a wound roll form or supplied by a direct spinning beam.
	*The support layer or scrim is interposed between the first and second precursor webs.

* The method of making the present two-sided, three-dimensionally imaged nonwoven fabric comprises the steps of providing at least a first precursor web and a second precursor web.
	*The precursor webs are formed into a three-dimensionally imaged nonwoven fabric by hydroentanglement on a three-dimensional image transfer device.
	*The image transfer device defines three-dimensional elements against the precursor web.
	*The first fibrous matrix is displaced into the three-dimensional topography while the second fibrous matrix is significantly retained on the side away from the three-dimensional topography.
	*The precursor webs may be subjected to pre-entangling on a foraminous-forming surface prior to juxtaposition of a support layer or scrim and subsequent three-dimensional imaging.

* The present invention may also comprise apertures in the nonwoven fabric.
	*The apertures may be of various shapes and sizes.
	*The apertures may be spaced equal distances from one another or randomly distributed throughout the resultant fabric.
	*The apertures may extend through

<summary>
* The invention relates to a device for feeding a strip of material into a sewing machine and sewing it onto a cut of fabric, ensuring continuous operation and allowing for the sewing of relatively stiff strips of material.
	*The device is designed to overcome the limitations of existing devices, which use a needle as a stop for the strip of material, causing potential damage to the needle and affecting the sewing operation.

* The device comprises a guide apparatus for feeding the strip of material, a stop that can be moved into the feed path of the strip, and a control means that controls the switching functions of the sewing machine.
	*The control means includes a signal transmitter that is actuated by the movement of the stop, which in turn controls the operation of the sewing machine.

* The stop is mounted on a two-armed lever that is biased by a spring, allowing it to be moved into the feed path of the strip and retracted from it.
	*The lever is also connected to a control cam that actuates a proximity switch, which controls the operation of the sewing machine.

* The device also includes a contact arm that detects the presence of the strip of material and actuates a proximity switch to control the operation of the sewing machine.
	*The contact arm is connected to a torsion spring that biases it into a rest position, allowing it to be lifted by the strip of material.

* The device operates by first lifting the stop into the feed path of the strip, then feeding the strip into the stitch forming area until it butts against the stop.
	*The stop is then retracted from the feed path, and the sewing machine is started to perform the sewing operation.

* The device is designed to be simple in design, rugged in construction, and economical to manufacture, making it suitable for use in a variety of applications.
	*The device can be used to sew a variety of materials, including relatively stiff strips of material, without damaging the needle or affecting the sewing operation.

* The invention provides a number of advantages over existing devices, including improved accuracy, increased efficiency, and reduced maintenance costs.
	*The device is also designed to be easy to use and maintain, making it suitable for use in a variety of settings.</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to a knitting method and a knit fabric for linking a rope- or tape-shaped knit fabric in various garments.
	* The invention aims to provide a connective knitting method that overcomes the problems of increased thickness, impaired productivity, and irregular sewing in traditional methods.

* The invention uses a flat knitting machine with at least a pair of front and rear needle beds, either or both of which are movable in the longitudinal direction.
	* The machine allows for the knitting of two tape-shaped knit pieces with a boundary between them in the longitudinal direction.

* The method involves knitting two tape-shaped knit pieces and then overlaying symmetrical loops of the final course of both pieces across the boundary.
	* The overlaid loops are then bound off gradually, repeating the process until the two pieces are connected.

* The knitting machine used in the embodiment is a flat knitting machine with multiple knitting needles disposed on needle beds laid out in a V-form.
	* The rear needle bed is movable in the lateral direction, allowing for the transfer of loops between the needle beds.

* The method involves transferring loops between the needle beds, overlaying loops, and forming new loops to connect the two knit pieces.
	* The process is repeated until the end parts of both knit fabrics are joined and the final end portion of the junction is prevented from loosening.

* The invention can be realized with different types of knitting machines, including those with two or more pairs of needle beds.
	* The front needle bed, rear needle bed, or both can be movable, depending on the machine design.

* The matrix texture of the belt-shaped knit fabric can be plain knitting, rib knitting, tubular knitting, or any other type.
	* The invention can be applied to various parts of garments, including the neck rope part of a tank top, lower end portion of baseball stockings, and neck rope part of an apron.

* The two pieces of knit fabric are knitted together and the transfers are carried out by a controlled computer following a designed knitting pattern.
	* The computer control allows for precise and efficient knitting of the connected knit pieces.

* The invention provides a connective knitting method that overcomes the problems of traditional methods, resulting in improved productivity and product quality.
	* The method allows for the creation of seamless and comfortable garments with connected knit pieces.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a flexible traction element, a production line, and a method for producing the traction element, which comprises at least one stranded cable made of a material guaranteeing tensile strength.
	*The stranded cable is sheathed by a flexible thermoplastic plastics material layer.
	*The production line comprises a reel for unwinding the stranded cables, a device for the precise orientation of the stranded cables, a heater for preheating the stranded cables, an extruder for co-extrusion of the stranded cables in a flexible plastics material jacket, a cooling trough, a roller store, a cutting device, and a storage roller.
	*The method for embedding at least one stranded cable with a plastics material-coated core strand involves degreasing and/or pretreating the unwound stranded cables, preheating them to a temperature of about ±20° C. of the melting temperature of the flexible thermoplastic plastics material, and sheathing them in the extruder with the liquefied plastics material.
	*The invention provides a traction element with increased flexibility, improved adhesion between the stranded cables and the plastics material jacket, and precise control of the spacing of the stranded cables guaranteeing tensile strength from the band surfaces.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a lockstitch sewing machine with a rotary hook arrangement that prevents co-rotation and reverse rotation of the bobbin housing.
	*The holding means are arranged on the loop cast-off side of the bobbin housing, allowing the needle thread loop to expand unhindered until its maximum expansion is reached.
	*The needle thread loop then moves through a gap between the front cam and the shoulder, and then through a gap created by the capsule release device between the rear side face and the spring rod.
* The rotary hook arrangement includes first and second cams arranged on respective sides of a projection of the bobbin housing, and a spring rod extending between the cams that cooperates with a projection of the housing.
	*The spring rod is fastened to a carrier attached to the base plate, and its free end is located between the rear side face of the shoulder and the rear cam.
	*The capsule release device gives the bobbin housing a rotational impulse counter to the direction of hook rotation, creating a gap between the rear side face and the spring rod.
* The invention provides a rotary hook arrangement that is simple in design, rugged in construction, and economical to manufacture.
	*The arrangement allows for a jerk-free and low-friction motion of the needle thread loop, and reduces the needle thread tension required for satisfactory stitch formation.
	*The invention can be embodied otherwise without departing from its principles, and is suitable for use in lockstitch sewing machines.
* The capsule release device is driven at the same speed as the rotary hook, and rotates the bobbin housing back by only a relatively small amount.
	*The device creates a gap between the rear side face and the spring rod in good time, allowing the needle thread loop to move unhindered through the gap.
	*The use of the capsule release device reduces the needle thread tension required for satisfactory stitch formation, but the rotary hook still has good sewing properties without its use.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to methods for producing silicon-containing nanowire/fiber composites and thin films from liquid silane inks by electrospinning.
	*The inks used in the invention are four-component or five-component liquid silane based compositions that include a liquid silane, a polymer, an accelerant, and a solvent, with the five-component inks also including a solid phase.
	*The solid phase component can be a particulate, photoactive or a reactive compound, and can include elements that are known to substitutionally-dope silicon, such as boron, phosphorous, arsenic or antimony containing compounds.
	*The invention also provides methods for producing polysilane nanowires and materials, and for continuous production of nanofiber strands and coated nanofiber strands.
	*The silicon-based materials and nanofibers produced by the invention can be used in a variety of applications, including as an active component in other composite materials, such as electrode composites.

* The electrospinning process used in the invention involves expelling a viscous solution of the ink through a nozzle or from a film and exposing it to a high electric field, resulting in the formation of continuous fibers that are deposited onto a substrate.
	*The fibers can be transformed into a material that contains a polysilane, an amorphous silicon and/or a crystalline silicon fraction through thermal treatment or light activation via radical polymerization.
	*The fibers can also be coated with a coherent, conductive coating, such as a carbon coating, to enhance their electrical conductivity.
	*The coated fibers can be used as a component of composite materials, such as an anode material for a lithium ion battery.
	*The invention also provides methods for producing electrically-conducting silicon-composite electrode materials using the four-component or five-component inks.

* The invention has several advantages over existing methods for producing silicon nanowires, including the ability to produce nanowires with a high aspect ratio and a uniform diameter, and the ability to produce nanowires with a high degree of crystallinity.
	*The invention also provides a method for continuous production of nanofiber strands and coated nanofiber strands, which can be used in a variety of applications.
	*The silicon-based materials and nanofibers produced by the invention can be used in a variety of applications, including as an active component in other composite materials, such as electrode composites.
	*The invention also provides methods

<summary>
* The present invention is directed to an arrangement for the control of thread tension in a spool creel having several spool holders each provided with a brake rotor working with a braking element that is adjustable by a tensioning lever carrying a roller.
	* The arrangement has a plurality of controllers, each coupled to a different corresponding one of the spool holders, and each of the controllers has a brake rotor and an adjustable, tension responsive, braking element coupled to the brake rotor.

* The tensioning lever is biased by the departing thread to take up an angular position dependent upon thread tension and net weight, and the force generated by the preferred biasing arrangement operates in addition to the weight force on the tensioning lever.
	* The thread tension is also altered, and this change can be centrally set so that the thread tension can be determined for the entire creel.

* The biasing arrangement is preferably formed by a piston/cylinder assembly, which can readily follow the swinging movement of the tensioning lever by changing their length.
	* Using a pneumatic drive at the same time prevents contamination of the threads by the pressurizing substance.

* The tensioning lever in the total working area subtends an angle A to the horizontal plane of more than 45°, and the working elevation angle of the biasing arrangement attached to the tensioning lever should preferably subtend an angle B of less than 45°.
	* In particular, it is preferred that the angle A should be in the range of 60° to 80° and the angle B in the range of 30° to 40°.

* The braking shoe can be held by the tensioning lever, which gives rise to a rather simple mode of construction with few additional parts.
	* Furthermore, the tensioning lever ensures that the braking shoe on restart of the warping machine is removed from contact with the further braking surface and therefore no locking can occur.

* The alternate embodiment of FIGS. 3 and 4 corresponds substantially to that illustrated in FIGS. 1 and 2, with the replacement of the friction brake with an electromagnetic brake.
	* The magnetic system brakes by generating eddy currents in braking disc 28, and the more disc 28 is covered by system 27, the greater the braking effect.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to a sewing machine detector for detecting the position of a sewing needle and the speed of the sewing machine.
	• The detector is integral with the drive and control elements of the sewing machine.
	• The detector overcomes the disadvantages of conventional detectors, such as the influence of static noise and vibration.
	• The detector includes a thinner and more compact detecting section.

• The detector includes flat, sheet-shaped light shielding discs mounted coaxially to a shaft connected to a sewing machine shaft.
	• The light shielding discs detect the sewing machine speed and needle positions.
	• The light shielding discs are made of light-transmitting synthetic resin.
	• The light shielding discs have printed light shielding areas and angle indications.

• The detector includes an optical fiber supporter that supports the optical fibers linearly, reducing stress and enabling accurate optical axes.
	• The optical fiber supporter includes reflecting portions that reflect light to the light receiving optical fibers.
	• The detector includes a power indicating window that receives one end of the power indicating optical fiber.
	• The detector provides stable and reliable operation despite shaft vibration and excessive wear.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to a simplified process for the continuous production of viscose rayon yarns having a high degree of whiteness.
	*The process involves completion of coagulation, treatment with water having a non-alkaline pH, and drying, which results in a yarn with a degree of white not lower than 45.
* The process is carried out preferably with spinning speeds not lower than 90 m/min, and the washing is carried out at temperatures between 20° and 30° C. for a period of time between 25 and 40 seconds.
	*The water used for washing should have a pH between 4.0 and 5.5 and be free from cations in amounts higher than specified limits.
* The invention also relates to the chemical composition of the wash water, which can be obtained by treating water from the industrial distribution network with weakly acid ion exchange resins.
	*The treatment with resins is continued until the pH of the water reaches values between 4 and 5.5, preferably between 4 and 4.7.</summary>

<summary>
* The inventors created a system to deaerate pulp after oxygen bleaching, addressing issues with vacuum washers and foam formation.
	*The system features a small deaeration tank with an inlet pipe, outlet, and tangential swirl inducing inlet pipe.
	*The tank's design allows for optimal deaeration, with the swirl inducing fluid being the filtrate from the washer after the oxygen bleach.
	*The system can be used with either atmospheric pressure or low pressure/vacuum, and the tank can be closed to recover steam or oxygen.
	*The deaeration tank's size and shape are designed to be compact and efficient, with a diameter similar to that of the oxygen reactor.
	*The system's operation is controlled by various sensors and valves, ensuring a consistent and effective deaeration process.

* The deaeration tank's design includes specific features such as a splash plate, outlet, and filtrate swirler inlet.
	*The inlet pipe is positioned to allow the pulp to enter the tank above the surface of the slurry and splash against the side wall.
	*The outlet is located in the bottom plate of the tank and is sized to handle the amount of pulp leaving the tank.
	*The filtrate swirler inlet is positioned to provide a swirl to the slurry, and its diameter is designed to accelerate the filtrate to the required velocity.
	*The emergency bypass line is also positioned to allow for easy bypassing of the deaeration tank in case of an upset condition.

* The system's operation involves the pulp being carried into the deaeration tank and splashing against the side of the tank.
	*The pulp then drains down to the body of the slurry in the tank, where it is swirled by the filtrate from the washer.
	*The height of the slurry in the tank is controlled by a height sensor, which operates a valve to control the flow of pulp into the washer.
	*The system can be used with either vacuum or pressure washers, and the deaeration tank can be closed to recover steam or oxygen.
	*The system's design allows for easy maintenance and operation, with minimal moving parts and no need for motors.

* The deaeration tank's size and shape can vary depending on the specific application.
	*The tank's diameter can range from 0.75 to 1.5 times the diameter of the oxygen reactor.
