<summary>
  • The invention relates to biomimetic tendon-reinforced (BTR) composite materials with improved properties, including high out-plane stiffness and strength-to-weight ratio.
	• The BTR composite materials are designed using a function-oriented material design (FOMD) process, which employs topology optimization to optimize the material distribution and maximize the out-plane stiffness.

  • The BTR composite structure consists of several key components, including fibers, stuffer members, and joints, which are arranged to provide optimal load-carrying capacity and stiffness.
	• The fibers are concentrated and optimally arranged along the load paths, and the stuffer members are aligned to provide additional support and stability to the structure.
</summary>

<summary>
  • The present invention relates to a load-limiting device for braced frames that can dissipate energy during a dynamic event and limit the loads transmitted to the structure.
	• The device is designed to undergo plastic deformation in response to high lateral loads, and can be easily removed and replaced after plastic deformation.
	• The device can be used in various structural applications, including buildings, bridges, and heavy lifting equipment, and can be configured to accommodate different types of bracing systems.

  • The load-limiting device has a unique design that allows it to dissipate energy through plastic deformation, and can be manufactured in various shapes and sizes to accommodate different structural applications.
	• The device has a connection means that allows it to be attached to the brace of a structure, and can be designed to have a plurality of connection points to connect to a typical braced frame.
	• The device can be made of various materials, including metal and high-strength materials, and can be designed to have elasto-plastic stress strain properties.

  • The load-limiting device can be used to limit the loads transmitted to a structure during a dynamic event, and can be designed to withstand high dynamic loads and seismic stress.
	• The device can be used in conjunction with externally mounted braces, and can be designed to accommodate different types of bracing systems.
	• The device can be checked after a dynamic event to determine if plastic deformation has occurred, and can be easily removed and replaced if necessary.
</summary>

<summary>
  * The present invention relates to a bedroom cabinet, specifically a unit type bedroom cabinet designed for a flophouse facility with individual rooms on an existing building floor. 
	*The cabinet has a floor area approximately equal to a bed, a height allowing a user to sit up, and a circumference completely shut off from the outside except for a doorway.

  * The invention aims to overcome disadvantages of conventional bedroom cabinets, such as lack of mechanical strength, reduced dwelling area, and poor sound-proofing. 
	*The proposed cabinet features a dual construction with an outer casing and an inner casing, allowing for a clearance between them to form boxes for electric devices or shelves without projecting into the cabinet or outer periphery.
</summary>

<summary>

• The present invention relates to a portable, temporary guard rail support for use in the erection of a safety barrier or fence at construction sites.
	• The invention aims to provide a simple and effective guard rail system that meets safety guidelines and can be assembled and disassembled efficiently.
	• The guard rail support is designed for use in high-rise apartment and office building construction, where safety barriers are required around the perimeter of uncompleted floors.

• The guard rail support consists of a substantially flat bottomed base plate, an upright column, at least one guard rail support bracket, a kick board retaining flange, an angular brace, and a safety tie-off ring.
	• The base plate is provided with bores for receiving fastening means to anchor the support to a floor or ground surface.
	• The guard rail support bracket and retaining flange are dimensioned to accommodate two adjacent, overlapping wooden rails.

• The guard rail support can be used to construct a safety barrier with overlapping wooden rails, where the rails are secured within the rail supporting brackets and retaining flanges of adjacent guard rail supports.
	• The safety barrier can also be constructed with a mesh-like fence structure, where the mesh is supported and secured within the rail supporting brackets and retaining flanges of the guard rail supports.
	• The guard rail support can be used in conjunction with a concrete-filled steel base for added stability and support.

• The guard rail support is designed to meet safety regulations, including the requirement for a top rail, an intermediate rail, and a toe or kick board.
	• The rail supporting brackets are spaced along the upright column to adhere to safety regulations, and the retaining flange is dimensioned to accommodate a kick board of at least 3.5 inches in height.
	• The safety tie-off ring is designed to support a static load of 5000 lbs and provide a secure attachment point for safety lines.

• The guard rail support is easy to install and remove, and can be attached to the floor of a building under construction prior to insertion of the wooden rails or safety fences.
	• The assembly of a safety guard rail fence or barrier can be quickly mounted in place, and the disassembly and removal of the guard rail supports can be carried out in an efficient manner.
	• The guard rail support reduces or eliminates the liability resulting from inadequately re-installed guard rails.

• The guard rail support is durable and can be used repeatedly for many years, providing a high return on investment and cost savings.

<summary>
  *  The present invention is a pulsed power device and a method of using the pulsed power device for Enhanced Oil Recovery (EOR). The device uses a coupled process of direct electrohydraulic (EH) acoustic vibrations and electromagnetically-induced high-frequency acoustic vibrations to stimulate oil production.
    *   The device can be customized to produce specific frequencies that will achieve optimal stimulation by activating specific scales of inclusions in the reservoir, and can be used in a variety of configurations, including single-level and multi-level discharge devices, and multiple tools in multiple wells.

  *  The invention also includes the use of EM pulse sources that do not generate a direct acoustic shock pulse, and can be used in more sensitive wells that will not tolerate the strong shock effect of an EH pulse generator.
    *   The invention also includes improvements to the basic EH sonde, such as the use of processors instead of electronic circuitry, and refinements in the design of the discharge section, including the use of a sleeve exploder configuration and hollow EH electrodes with a pencil exploding filament device or a spooled feeding device for an exploding filament.</summary>

<summary>
  * The present disclosure relates to a splice for a soil reinforcing element, which is used in Mechanically Stabilized Earth (MSE) structures.
	*The splice includes a first wave plate and a second wave plate, each defining one or more transverse protrusions configured to receive and seat a corresponding number of transverse wires of the soil reinforcing element and a grid-strip.
	*The splice further includes a first perforation defined in the first wave plate and a second perforation defined in the second wave plate, and a connective device extensible through the first perforation and the second perforation to couple the first wave plate to the second wave plate.

  * The splice is used to extend the length of a soil reinforcing element, which is not long enough to adequately reinforce a vertical facing into adjacent backfill.
	*The splice couples one or more grid-strips to the soil reinforcing element, and the combination of the soil reinforcing element, splice, and grid-strip may be characterized as a single composite soil reinforcing element.
	*The grid-strip may include at least two longitudinal wires welded or otherwise attached to a plurality of transverse wires, and the spacing between each transverse wire of the grid-strip may be the same or substantially the same as the spacing between each transverse wire of the soil reinforcing element.

  * The splice is secured by coupling the first wave plate to the second wave plate using a connective device, such as a threaded bolt or similar mechanism.
	*The connective device may be extended through one or more perforations defined on each plate, and secured against removal from the splice by threading a nut or similar device onto its end.
	*One or more washers may also be used to provide a biasing engagement with each plate, and the nut and connective device configuration may be substituted with any attachment methods known in the art.
</summary>

<summary>
  *  The present invention relates to a novel design for a plow blade which provides a fluid passage and points of fluid ejection that is produced with basic manufacturing processes allowing efficient production.
     *  The invention includes a blade construction with a multiple component assembly, providing the ability to rebuild a blade by replacing a portion of the blade that may be worn.
     *  The invention also includes a process of ejecting a specific fluid at specific points along a plow blade, maximizing desirable characteristics while minimizing the volume of ejected fluid.
     *  This method is adaptable in static plowing and vibratory plowing utilities, and lubricating the sides of the blade/chute that come into contact with the ground with fluid has been found to greatly reduce the amount of drag (friction).
 
  *  The invention provides a plow that can be tailored to provide fluid injection characteristics to match specific job requirements, with components manufactured with traditional manufacturing processes.
     *  The flow paths are defined by stacking together leading edge sections with flow voids, and welding or otherwise attaching them to a blade.
     *  The configuration provides appropriate function and provides an easily tailored configuration.
     *  The invention allows for varying the length of the fluid tube, the number of leading edge sections, and the location and number of stitch welds to match the requirements of a specific job.
     *  The invention also allows for the use of a manifold with drilled holes and nozzles to control the flow rates and location of the fluid injection.</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to a building system, specifically stucco type cavity wall construction techniques and resultant consumables, subassemblies, assemblies, etc.
	• The invention aims to provide a building system that allows for panels of greater than 2.4 meters in height and 4 meters in width without movement joints.
	• The system includes a frame or substructure, battens, a first mesh attached to the battens, a second mesh supported by a plaster matrix, and the plaster matrix applied as more than one layer.
	• The plaster matrix penetrates the first mesh, interposes both meshes, attaches to the second mesh, and covers the second mesh.
	• The system also includes a wall wrap, flashing tape, and a moisture barrier to prevent water ingress.
	• The battens are preferably made of timber, treated to H3.1 or H3.2, and are spaced at 300 mm centers.
	• The mesh is preferably made of metal, with a paper backing, and is stapled to the battens.
	• The plaster matrix is applied in three coats: a base coat, a levelling coat, and a top coat.

• The system includes various components, such as a bottom member, a window and door head, a soffit and sill flange, and a jam flashing, all made of uPVC.
	• These components provide a drip edge, moisture drainage openings, and a bellows-like central region for movement control.
	• The system also includes a vertical movement control joint, a horizontal movement control joint, and a Z flashing for the horizontal movement control joint.
	• The components are designed to work together to provide a weather-tight seal and to accommodate movement in the building.

• The system requires a continuous concrete foundation or slab edge thickening under all walls.
	• The system is intended to be fixed to timber walls with studs at 600 mm centers, heights up to 4.8 m, and dwangs spaced at up to 900 mm centers.
	• The system is able to resist wind face loading up to and including those associated with VH wind speed zones.
	• The weight of the total system is 41 kg/m2 and does not contribute to the building lateral bracing.

• The system may be fixed to wet timber framing provided the interior lining and insulation is not installed until the framing moisture content is less than 18%.

<summary>
  * The invention relates to a safe and door structure, particularly a floor safe, with a valuables receiving chamber and a door that can be easily assembled and removed.
    *The safe construction includes a liner with grooves formed on the walls, which receive bar members that couple together to form a door receiving groove.
    *The door is a steel plate member with a lockset and a lockbolt that engages a notch in the liner, providing secure locking and protection against prying.
 
  * The invention also includes a modified liner embodiment that is more economical and uses concrete and rebars to provide structural integrity.
    *The modified liner has a lower portion with a door receiving ledge and upper portion with grooves that receive the door.
    *The liner is surrounded by concrete and rebars, which provide strength and protection, and a lock notch and bar member are used to provide shear strength at the locking location.
    *The door is inserted and removed in the same manner as the previous embodiment, and the lockbolt operates in a direction transverse to the direction of insertion to increase the strength of the safe.</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to the monitoring and measuring of fluid pressures in geological formations, and more particularly to measuring techniques which more accurately measure the fluid pressure in the formation at a desired elevation or depth.

	• The invention provides a more reliable connection system between a pressure sensing location within a cement grouted borehole and the transducer system used to monitor the pressure in the surrounding geological formation.
	• This is accomplished by cementing a conduit fitted with a filter at its bottom end in the borehole at a desired location.
	• The filter is the inlet to the pressure measuring apparatus.

• The invention includes a method of monitoring a fluid pressure in a subterranean formation, which includes forming a borehole in the subterranean formation at least to a depth where the fluid pressure is to be measured.

	• A conduit is placed into the borehole to a depth so that a bottom inlet end of the conduit is laterally adjacent a location where the formation pressure is to be measured.
	• A non-return valve is used in the conduit so that liquid cannot pass upwardly all the way through the conduit.
	• A cementitious material is placed in the borehole until the cementitious material rises at least above the bottom inlet end of the conduit.

• The invention also includes a method of monitoring a fluid pressure in a subterranean formation, which includes connecting a pressure sensing device to a bottom inlet end of a conduit.

	• The conduit is lowered into the borehole until the inlet end of the conduit is at a depth where the formation pressure is to be measured.
	• The borehole is then filled with a cementitious material to a level substantially above the inlet end of the conduit.
	• The cementitious material is prevented from flowing up the conduit, whereby the cementitious material surrounds the inlet end of the conduit.

• The invention provides a method of monitoring a fluid pressure in a subterranean formation, which includes placing a conduit in a borehole formed in the subterranean formation.

	• A pressure measuring inlet of the conduit is located at a depth where the formation pressure is to be measured.
	• A pressure sensing device is connected to the conduit to measure pressures at the pressure measuring inlet of the conduit.
	• The borehole is filled with a cementitious material above and below the pressure measuring inlet of the conduit.

• The invention includes a method of monitoring a fluid pressure in a subterranean formation, which includes forming a borehole in the subterranean formation at least to a depth

<summary>
* The present invention relates to a jointing structure in vehicle traveling path joints and the like having an expansion function, and is useful in applications mainly to vehicle traveling path joints in new transit systems, monorails and the like, and besides, to road bed plate joints in road bridges, footbridges and the like.
	* The jointing structure comprises more than one step provided face to face at the coaxially built traveling path ends with an expansion gap between, more than one elastic member respectively mounted inside the above more than one step, and a joint block mounted on the above more than one elastic member across the above expansion gap.

* The jointing structure is designed to prevent the occurrence of tire fall-in and/or stuck-in situations for the achievement of smooth and safe vehicle traveling, and is adaptable for applications of various tire configurations different in tire diameter.
	* The joint block is placed across the expansion gap, and thus, the adequate management of accuracy of each member if given may be adapted to prevent the differences in level from occurring in any joint portion between the joint block and the traveling path.

* The elastic members are desirably of a material that is hard to be deformed vertically and vice verse easy to be deformed horizontally in a soft manner, and the present invention employs elastic members mainly consisting of laminated rubber.
	* The elastic members and the joint block are fitted to each other detachably by bolting or the like and consequently, may be easily given the maintenance thereof as well.

* The jointing structure may be provided with supporting blocks inside the steps with the joint block between in order to protect the traveling path ends with the thus mounted supporting blocks so as to prevent the traveling path ends from being damaged due to tire impingement and/or impact responses and the like at the time of passage of the vehicles.
	* The supporting blocks may be of concrete or high-strength fiber-reinforced concrete like the traveling path and the joint block.

* The jointing structure may be provided with more than one joint block in the traveling path joint in order to decentralize the expansion gap in the traveling path joint into more than one expansion gap to make the size of each individual expansion gap smaller.
	* For instance, the size of the expansion gap in the traveling path joint may be reduced down to one fourth by mounting the intermediate joint blocks one by one to the opposite sides of the intra-step joint block.

* The present invention provides a method of mounting an elastic member in vehicle traveling path joints and the like having

<summary>
* The present invention relates to track transport systems, specifically floor track systems used in sanitary fluid treatment chambers for transporting food stuffs on wheeled hand trucks.
	*The invention aims to prevent the wheels or other support structure on the dolly from contaminating the treatment fluid.
	*The invention also seeks to segregate the wheels of the trucks used to support the product to be treated from the recirculated treatment solution.

* The invention is particularly useful in the meat processing industry, where cooked meat products are chilled using a fluid treatment chamber with a system for showering the meat products with a chilled brine solution.
	*The brine solution is pumped under pressure through a distribution piping system and showered onto meat-laden hand trucks.
	*The temperature of the cooked meat is quickly lowered by transferring the heat to the showered liquid.

* The enclosed floor track system of the invention includes a wheel channel into which the wheels of the truck roll, and which is disposed above the fluid level on the floor by support legs.
	*The wheel channel includes opposed sidewalls, one of which extends upwardly more than the other and has attached to it a cover plate horizontally overlying the top of the channel.
	*The vertical space between the shorter sidewall and the cover plate above it accommodates the axle structure connecting the truck frame to the wheel disposed in the channel.

* In another embodiment of the invention, the enclosed floor track is structured to accommodate trucks with downwardly depending struts supporting the wheel structure.
	*The sidewalls of the wheel channel extend upwardly beyond the top of the wheel structure and include at the top edges thereof inflatable elastomer seals.
	*These seals are hose-like and are attached along the length of the sidewall top edges so as to enclose around the hand truck wheel struts and prevent entry of the brine solution into the guide track.

* The invention provides several advantages, including preventing the brine solution from being contaminated by the hand truck wheels and allowing for the recovery and reuse of the brine solution.
	*The invention also prevents corrosion of the hand truck wheel bearings and the deterioration of the rubber wheels.
	*The enclosed track system according to the present invention prevents the brine solution from coming into contact with the hand truck wheels and becoming contaminated.

* The invention is not limited to use in the meat processing industry and may find applications in other industries where wheeled hand trucks are used to transport products in a sanitary environment.
	*The principles of the invention may be applied

<summary>
* The lock device is designed to prevent a boom of a backhoe work machine from being rotated downward by its weight, and it consists of an engaging member and an engaged member that can be operated manually.
	* The engaging member is a plate with a hook part and a slot, and it is supported by a support pin and a guide member, allowing it to be held in a lock position or a lock release position.

* The lock device is constructed to be easy to use and maintain, with a simple and compact design that reduces the number of parts and assembly processes.
	* The guide member is designed to keep the engaging member at a prescribed position, and it is formed by bending a plate into an L-like shape, allowing it to be fixed to the side surface of the support pin.

* The lock device is designed to be safe and reliable, with a slip-prevention mechanism that prevents the engaging member from slipping off the support pin.
	* The slip-prevention mechanism consists of a slip-prevention plate that is fixed to the tip of the support pin, and it is designed to be inserted into the engaging member at a prescribed angle.

* The lock device is designed to be versatile and adaptable, and it can be used in various applications such as excavating devices, loaders, and cranes.
	* The lock device can be used to lock a boom, an arm, or other components in a stored position, and it is available for use in a variety of machines and equipment.</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to swimming pool vacuum cleaning devices, specifically a vacuum cleaning apparatus with a flexible platform that can be adjusted relative to the pool bottom to regulate suction efficiency.
	• The adjustment is made possible by a novel feature that allows for the quick and easy regulation of the amount of suction being exerted by the suction head.

• The invention overcomes the drawbacks of prior art devices, which lack a simple adjustment mechanism on the vacuum head itself to regulate suction.
	• Prior art devices require adjusting the vacuum at the circulation pump, which is inconvenient and time-consuming.

• The invention features a suction head assembly with a generally rectangular, horizontally extending platform and a central portion with an opening and an upwardly extending cylindrical member.
	• The platform is provided with a handle assembly and is preferably integrally formed from a yieldably deformable plastic material.

• The invention includes outboard roller assemblies connected to the platform proximate each end portion, each comprising a pair of spaced apart ribs or walls with vertically extending slots.
	• The outboard roller assemblies are used to adjust the vertical height of the rollers relative to the platform.

• The invention also features inboard roller assemblies interconnected with the platform on either side of the central opening, with a similar construction to the outboard roller assemblies.
	• The inboard roller assemblies include a weight and a cover, and are used to adjust the spacing between the central, suction portion of the platform and the pool bottom.

• A specially configured frame member is connected to and spans the platform, with a central portion and spaced end portions that extend outwardly on either side of the longitudinally extending edges of the platform.
	• The frame member is used to adjust the height of the inboard rollers relative to the platform.

• The invention includes a roller height adjustment device that can be provided in kit form for use in combination with certain types of prior art suction head assemblies.
	• The roller height adjustment device comprises a pair of frames, connector means, and adjustment means, and can be assembled to an existing suction head assembly with minimum modification.

• The invention provides a simple and easy-to-use adjustment mechanism that can be manufactured inexpensively and is easy to connect to existing devices.
	• The adjustment mechanism allows for precise regulation of the suction exerted by the vacuum head without the need for regulation of the remotely located suction source.

• The invention can be used in combination with certain types of prior art suction head assemblies, and can be assembled with minimum modification.
	• The invention is suitable for use in

<summary>
* The present invention relates to an apparatus for retrieving a wear bushing from around the interior of a well head and casing, including a sub-unit for mounting onto a drill string.
	* The apparatus provides a retriever section that is slidably movable between the end collars of the sub-unit, allowing for vertical movement while preventing rotational movement.

* The retriever section is adapted with means, such as protruding members, for engaging with an extended J-slot of a wear bushing, and is designed to retrieve the wear bushing without the use of a drill bit.
	* The apparatus can be threadably engaged between any two sections of drill pipe, allowing for easy removal and installation of the wear bushing during drilling operations.

* The invention solves the problem of crimping the walls of the wear bushing due to the weight of the drill string, by allowing the retriever section to have approximately 3 feet of vertical play while aligning with the slots of the wear bushing.
	* This feature eliminates the need for a rigid connection between the retriever section and the mandrel section of the drill pipe, reducing the risk of damage to the wear bushing or the retriever unit.

* An additional embodiment of the retriever section is designed to retrieve a particular type of wear bushing with a threaded collar section, using a threaded lower end section to threadably engage the wear bushing.
	* This embodiment is also slidably attached to the mandrel section of the sub-unit, allowing for easy installation and removal of the wear bushing.</summary>

<summary>
• The field of this invention is generally downhole vibratory tools and more specifically those tools that selectively allow passage therethrough for other tools.
	• The tool is capable of letting a wireline or other tools pass through a passage therethrough that can be subsequently closed by landing a plug on a seat.

• The dump valve is disposed annularly about the central passage so that cycling the tool does not cause it to be slammed against a seat.
	• The valve is cylindrically shaped with a seal ring that simply slides between surfaces to close and open the valve, eliminating significant cyclical impacts.

• The tool has modular stacked piston units that increase the area of total pistons exposed to the applied pressure, thus increasing the delivered power of the tool.
	• The modular design allows selection of the number of pistons to match the power required for the particular work string, surface equipment, or anticipated downhole conditions.

• The tool can be operated so that there are jarring blows delivered in every cycle or by avoiding such jarring blows, depending on the amount of surface overpull applied to the string.
	• The tool can also be operated to have impacts on each cycle with the pistons against the housing, or without impact, and can still be effective in releasing a fish.

• The tool provides large amplitude vibrations in a tubing string and relies on a single valve for operation, making it suitable for stimulation or fishing operations.
	• The tool can also have a rotational lock between the mandrel and the housing for the purposes of torque transmission.
</summary>

<summary>
  • The present invention relates to an apparatus and method for constructing a retaining wall using pre-manufactured parts, allowing for taller walls and shorter bases.
	• The retaining wall system consists of a precast concrete face panel with an integral counterfort and a precast base piece.
	• The face panel and counterfort are connected to the base using a shear key and grout.
	• The system does not require temporary shoring and can be customized to various sizes and shapes.

  • The invention provides several advantages over prior art, including increased flexibility, reduced installation and transportation costs, and improved stability.
	• The system can be used in various applications, including retaining soil, sand, pebbles, or rocks.
	• The counterfort can be designed with different shapes and sizes, and can include openings for drainage.
	• The base can be textured or roughened to increase friction with the subsurface ground, and can be set on shims or H-piles for added stability.
</summary>

<summary>
  • The present invention relates to systems and methods for producing or delivering heat at or near the down hole end of production tubing of a producing oil or gas well for improving production therefrom.
    • The invention addresses two primary shortcomings of conventional approaches to heating oil and paraffin down hole: the heat is not properly focused where it needs to be, and existing down hole heaters fail for lack of design elements which would protect electrical components from chemical or physical attack while in position.
    • The invention provides a down hole heating system for use with oil and gas wells which exhibit less than optimally achievable flow rates because of high oil viscosity and/or blockage by paraffin.

  • The down hole heating system of the present invention includes a heat insulating packer, perforated tubing, a stainless steel tubing collar, and a heating unit.
    • The heating unit includes electrical resistance type heater rods, the electrical current for which is supplied by cables which run down the exterior of production tubing and connect to leads at the upper end of the heating unit.
    • The heat insulating packer and stainless steel collars are included in their stated form for “containing” the heat from the heating unit within the desired zone to the greatest practical degree.

  • The present invention also includes the method for use of the above-described system for heat treating an oil or gas well for improving well flow.
    • The method would be one which included use of a down hole heating unit with suitably shielded electrical connections substantially as described, along with installation of the heat-retaining elements also as described to properly focus heat on the producing formation.
    • The present method may also be utilized by substituting cable (“wire line”) for the down hole pipe for supporting the heating unit while pipe is pulled from the well bore.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to down hole tools for conducting mechanical activities in wells, specifically a mechanism for installing and removing objects in wells, including stuck or lost objects.
	*The mechanism is designed to effectively connect to a down hole object and disconnect upon simple mechanical movement.
	*The invention is directed to the improvement of U.S. Pat. No. 4,061,389, specifically to promote effective connection and disconnection of a pull tool to a down hole object.

* The invention is effectively adapted to be provided on a wire line controlled pulling tool and run into the well casing or well bore.
	*The tool structure takes the form of an outer tubular body having an inner body structure disposed in movable relation therein.
	*Telescoping movement of the inner and outer body structures causes the overshot or spear to selectively move into gripping relationship with the object.

* The tubular outer body is secured about the inner body by means of a catch mechanism having a locking position and an unlocking position.
	*The catch mechanism includes a pin structure that is selectively positioned within pin receiving grooves.
	*A control spring is employed to ensure that the pin alternately enters one or the other of a pair of unlocking or locking grooves.

* The invention provides means for controlling, locking and unlocking of the collet or spear slip structures.
	*The pulling tool structure is provided with a controllable locking mechanism.
	*The locking mechanism includes a plurality of spring elements that ensure alternate latching and unlatching of the pulling tool mechanism.

* The invention is not restricted to wire line service operations, but is effectively adapted to be provided on a wire line controlled pulling tool.
	*The tool can be run into the well casing or well bore for the purpose of establishing a mechanical connection with an object.
	*The tool can apply sufficient force to remove the object from the well.

* The invention provides a closed circuit feature by means of appropriate cam surfaces.
	*The pin is capable of moving only within the restrictions of the closed circuit.
	*This enables operating personnel to provide efficient selective control.

* The invention allows for latching and unlatching of the pulling tool from the object to occur any suitable number of times.
	*There is no necessity to cause jarring or mechanical vibration of the fishing tool.
	*The pulling tool can be removed from the well bore, if desired, without necessitating removal and recocking of the latching mechanism.

* The invention is intended for use in accomplishing a wide variety of

<summary>
  • The present invention relates to stave floors, in particular to modular composed stave floors, and provides a method for the manufacture of composed stave floors.
	• The method includes providing a sight substrate having a thickness of at least 4 mm and providing a base substrate having a thickness of at least 12 mm.
	• The base substrate and sight substrate are assembled together with glue and multidirectional holding means, which consist of dendrites, adhesion and horizontal reinforcement means, in the union plane; and adhesion and vertical reinforcement means, normal to the union plane.

  • The invention aims to preserve the physical, aesthetic and functional properties in sight substrate of composed stave floors or engineering floors.
	• It also provides a sight substrate for composite stave compounds or engineering floors, without any trend to be deformed, and bonds both sheets without displacement or change of dimensions.

  • The invention provides improved composed stave floors with a major time of useful life and allows giving it corrective maintenance.
	• It also provides improved composed stave floors with applied glaze from the supplier, eliminating the time and the inconveniences of the application of the glaze in a period of the installation.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to ladder attachments that improve the stability and safety of ladders by preventing slipping, sliding, and damage to work surfaces.
	*The attachments achieve this by increasing the contact area between the ladder and the work surface, and by providing a non-slip gripping portion that grips the work surface without damaging it.
	*The attachments are designed to be versatile and can be used on various types of ladders, including those with different widths and materials.
	*The attachments can also be adjusted to accommodate different sizes of ladders and can be used to straddle corners, making it easier to access hard-to-reach areas.

* The invention includes a brace assembly that consists of an arm, a flange, and a U-bolt that secures the arm to the ladder's rung.
	*The arm has a bore that pivotally connects a resilient pad assembly, which can be adjusted to fit different sizes of ladders.
	*The U-bolt is secured with nuts and washers, and the arm can be made of a single piece of steel or other strong, durable material.

* The attachments can be installed by attaching the resilient pad assembly to the arm, moving the arm towards the rung, and securing the U-bolt and clamp in place.
	*The clamp exerts a force against the bottom face of the siderail to prevent motion of the arm towards or away from the siderail.
	*The nuts on the U-bolt can be tightened to secure the brace assembly in position, and the attachment can be adjusted to fit different sizes of ladders.

* The invention provides several benefits, including improved lateral stability, increased contact area, and the ability to straddle corners.
	*The attachments can be used on various types of ladders, including those made of aluminum, fiberglass, and other materials.
	*The invention can be modified and adapted to fit different situations and materials without departing from the essential teachings of the invention.
</summary>

<summary>
  • The present invention relates to a collated nail strip formed with a debris-free plastic material for use in a fastener driving tool. The plastic material defines a collar portion that captures or at least substantially encircles the fastener shank and a connecting portion extending between and connecting adjacent collar portions.
    • The plastic material is formulated from an adhesive polymer such as a polyolefin, a polyolefin blend, an epoxy or the like.
    • The plastic material is molded onto and adhered to the fasteners, and the collar portion remains adhered to the fastener such that the collar portion penetrates the substrate with the fastener.
    • The connecting portion can be formed as a bridge and a rib in which the bridge and rib have a generally cruciform shape.

  • The nail strip can be configured to influence or encourage separation of the fasteners from one another at a desired location, reducing debris by reducing the impact on the connecting portion by the fastener as it is driven by the tool into the substrate.
    • A preferentially weakened region can be formed by a notch in the connecting portion, such as at an upper edge of the connecting portion.
    • The preferentially weakened region can be formed by the connecting portion having a varying cross-sectional area with a smaller cross-sectional area at the desired location than at other locations in the connecting portion.
    • The fasteners can also be positioned eccentrically relative to their respective sleeves to define a thin-walled sleeve section at the desired location.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a nozzle for applying sealants such as silicones in various industries like aviation, automotive, naval, railway, and robotics.
	• The nozzle has a bell or hood shaped tip and an injection button that provides several advantageous and novel characteristics for its intended function.
	• The nozzle is designed to facilitate the injection of silicone or other sealants in multiple industrial applications.
	• The nozzle has an outlet shaped as a bell or hood to facilitate the encapsulation of rivets or screws, particularly applicable in the aeronautical industry.
	• The injection button has a special design with a number of channels and orifices for carrying out sealing operations with greater accuracy.
	• The nozzle can be used in both manual and automated sealant injection machines, and its design allows for a non-permanent connection between the bell-shaped tip and the injection button.
</summary>

<summary>

* The present invention relates to sensors, particularly position and motion sensors, and provides a method of multiplexing multiple sensors on a minimum number of wires with a minimum of energy required from each sensor monitoring system.
	*The invention is directed to sensing position or movement of an object.
	*The sensor may comprise a waveform generator and an error correction generator for modifying a sensing signal by removing unneeded power and providing the signal to a remote monitor via two wires useful in multiplexing multiple sensors.
	*The waveform generator is operable for receiving an unconditioned sensing signal from a transducer and modifying the unconditioned sensing signal in response to an error correction signal for providing a conditioned sensing signal.

* The error correction generator determines and eliminates strong static signals and error signals that do not deliver information about a position of an object being sensed, wherein inclusion of the static and error signals would require energy.
	*The error correction generator may provide the error correction signal using a comparator for receiving the conditioned sensing signal and determining a value thereof.
	*A controller may provide first and second timing signals responsive to the value of the conditioned sensing signal.
	*A signal processor may provide the error correction signal responsive to the first and second timing signals.

* One embodiment of the invention may include a digitally stored offset and error correction closed-loop compensation circuit for constantly comparing a value of the conditioned sensing signal to a desired minimum value and generates a correction signal that is subtracted from the offset and error signal to deliver a sensor signal output that is close to a desired minimum value.
	*The constant comparing of the sensor signal output to the desired minimum value proceeds in a first direction relative to a direction of sensor output signals generated when an object being sensed moves in a relatively slow manner compared to a nominal speed of objects being monitored.
	*The constant comparing of the sensor signal output to the desired minimum proceeds in a second direction relative to the direction of signals generated when the object being monitored moves in a relatively fast manner compared to the speed of objects being monitored.
	*The constant comparing of the sensor signal output to the desired minimum value is done such that signals generated as the objects move are not subtracted from the sensor output to a degree significant enough to cause significant variance between a position of the object and a signal level delivered by the sensor.

* The sensor may include a window reference circuit that constantly compares a desired conditioned sensor signal output to an existing conditioned sensor signal output and adjusts the conditioned sensor signal output if it is above a preset high reference signal or below a

<summary>
* The present invention relates to a desmodromic valve actuation system for intake and exhaust functions of a four-stroke piston in internal combustion engines.
	* The system aims to provide a means to significantly reduce gas consumption by efficiently and effectively controlling valve port openness in concert with the requirements of the operation of a vehicle.

* The invention eliminates the need for springs in the functioning of valves, instead using a kinematic system that positively controls the valve cycling.
	* This system requires considerably less energy than traditional spring-cam systems, as the mass inertia of the valve system is less and the kinematics of the valve actuation are more effective.

* The valve actuation system of the present invention is capable of variable displacement, allowing for the adjustment of valve stroke and the ability to close the valve port indefinitely while the engine is running.
	* This feature enables the system to be controlled to present the most advantageous configuration of valving, including any percentage port opening on the intake cycle to closure of the intake port.

* The system uses a rotary cam with a grooved track to displace a translating means, which in turn reciprocates in a slot to achieve a linear movement.
	* The translating means is attached to an assembly that contains a rotatable link, which presents an angle to the line of action of the first translating means, allowing for the adjustment of valve displacement.

* The system can be controlled by an actuator, such as a hydraulic cylinder, which can be used to rotate the circular drive disk and adjust the valve displacement.
	* The control block assembly is constrained in lateral and axial directions to ensure a vertical up and down motion that maintains the juxtaposition of the slot parallel to the line of action of the reciprocating intake valve assembly.

* The invention can be applied to engines with multiple valves per cylinder, including four and six valves per cylinder.
	* A single cam on the camshaft can control multiple valves, with duplicate actuating mechanisms required for each valve.

* The present invention offers several advantages over traditional spring-cam systems, including increased performance, reduced energy consumption, and simplified manufacturing and installation.
	* The system also provides a more efficient delivery of power for each gallon of gasoline, making it a desirable solution for internal combustion engines.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to aquarium lighting using LEDs, providing a light member with a housing and a lighting control region disposed on the bottom side of the housing.
	• The lighting control region includes a first control channel associated with a first color of light, a second control channel associated with a second color of light, and a neutral channel.
	• The light member also includes a switch coupled to the housing, operable to control the first control channel, and one or more light-emitting modules releasably coupled to the lighting control region.

• The light-emitting modules can be positioned anywhere along the lighting control region and can be added or removed as desired, each including a tab that releasably couples the module to a protrusion on the lighting control region.
	• The modules include electrical connectors that couple to the control channels and the neutral channel, providing electrical power to the module and the LEDs.
	• The electrical connectors are biased toward the cover plate and the openings by springs, ensuring a good electrical connection.

• In some constructions, a single module is used in place of separate modules, emitting both white and blue light, and is coupled to both control channels with a manual intensity control.
	• The modules can include narrow incident angle LEDs, wide angle LEDs, or optical elements that change angles of the light emitted from the LEDs, diffuse the light, and/or focus the light.
	• The optical elements can be removable and snap onto the modules.

• The light member can be controlled with in-line timers, allowing a user to set a time limit for various colors emitting from the modules and programmable to set on/off times and gradually ramp power up/down.
	• The timers can be digital controllers, allowing a user to manually select an on/off, timer mode, and demo/preview mode to preview current settings.
	• The timers can be used to control a single channel or multiple channels.

• The light member can be used with various other types of enclosures and structures, including underneath office or kitchen cabinets to provide lighting beneath the cabinets.
	• The light member can be coupled to a cabinet using a bracket, and multiple light members can be coupled together to provide a series of light members disposed underneath one or more cabinets.
	• The light member can include switches disposed along either a side or bottom of the light member, providing accessible control of the modules.

• In some constructions, the light member includes an optics member that is coupled along a bottom side of the light member, either by sliding or snapping into place

<summary>
* The present invention relates to a cooled flow deflection apparatus for a fluid-flow machine which operates at high temperatures.
	*The invention aims to provide a cooled flow deflection apparatus that avoids the disadvantages of known apparatuses, such as complex casting, high blade weight, and thermal stresses.
	*The invention achieves this by constructing the separating walls as separate inserts that are subsequently inserted into the apparatus and secured there.
* The use of inserts has several advantages, including reduced material in the transitional region, no thermal stresses between the insert and the hot-gas wall, and reduced blade weight and centrifugal-force stresses.
	*The inserts can be composed of metal or non-metal materials and can be secured by soldering or welding.
	*The cooling system can be easily adjusted by replacing the inserts.
* A preferred embodiment of the flow deflection apparatus is in the form of a hollow casting with holders in the form of rails that are integrally formed in the interior of the flow deflection apparatus.
	*The separating walls are preferably flat strips composed of a metallic or heat-resistant non-metallic material.
	*The separating walls can be straight or bent into a U-shape to connect cooling channels.
* The invention is particularly advantageous for rotor blades that rotate at high speed, as it reduces the blade weight and centrifugal-force stresses.
	*The cooling channels and separating walls can extend essentially in the radial direction with respect to the rotation axis of the gas turbine.
	*The integral material joint can be arranged at the end of the separating walls close to the axis.</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to a system and method for controlling the operation of a fuel delivery system for a vehicle, which can be switched between manual and automatic control.
	• The system comprises a control unit that receives signals indicating accelerator pedal position and throttle valve position, and processes these signals to provide a control signal to a DC motor or stepper motor that sets the throttle position for optimum performance.
	• The system also includes a clutch that connects the accelerator pedal directly to the throttle valve when manual control is desired, allowing the vehicle driver to have full control of the vehicle.

• The invention aims to provide a system that can smoothly switch between automatic and manual control without causing the vehicle to lurch forward or stall.
	• This is achieved by ensuring that the throttle valve is moved to a predetermined position or is positioned to match what is commanded by the accelerator pedal before control is shifted from automatic to manual.
	• The system also provides full operation of the vehicle when under manual control, allowing the vehicle to be operated at any speed.

• The invention can be used in conjunction with a system for controlling the operation of a continuously variable transmission.
	• At high transmission ratios, it is desirable to manually control the throttle valve position, while at low transmission ratios, automatic control is preferred.
	• The control unit can be programmed to detect the transmission ratio and switch to the optimum control mode for the throttle.</summary>

<summary>
• The invention provides a waste fuel burner that emits minimal quantities of particulate materials, operates with little slag or clinkers, and can effectively burn wet wood of 70% moisture content.
	• The burner achieves this through a two-stage combustion process, where the primary chamber gasifies the waste fuel and the secondary chamber completes the combustion.
	• The burner is self-regulating, easy to control, and has fast response times to changes in the load, comparable to conventional gas and oil burners.

• The burner's design features a conical pile of waste fuel, fed from below, with preheated underfire air percolating up through the pile, and high-pressure swirl air admitted tangentially to drive heavier non-combusted materials to the outer wall.
	• The secondary chamber features a refractory lining, an air-cooled flame holder, and adjustable tuyeres for introducing secondary combustion air, which spirals down the walls and merges with the volatile gases.
	• The burner can be adjusted to operate with a low volume of fuel or a high volume of fuel, and has a quick response time of less than 1 minute.

• The invention has several advantages, including the ability to burn fuels with high moisture content, minimal clinker or slag formation, and a longer refractory lining life.
	• The burner's control system features a pneumatic control diagram, with overrides or trims provided on the swirl air and secondary air quantities, and manual or automatic selection controls.
	• The burner can be used for various industrial purposes, including boiler heat, kiln dryers, and other applications requiring a lower temperature.</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention is an evaporative refrigeration system that provides a highly efficient apparatus for cooling air. 
	*The system operates by using a heat exchanger that separates its dry and wet sides, keeping evaporating water separate from the useful air.
	*The system also draws the major portion of the working air from the load, i.e., the working air is recirculated from the enclosure to be cooled to the wet side of the heat exchanger.

* The system includes a heat exchanger with an array of spaced vertically directed hollow elongated tubular members, where the wet side is accomplished by gravity flow of water downwardly along the inner surfaces of the tubes in conjunction with countercurrent flow of returned air from the load.
	*The dry side is accomplished by fresh air flowing in thermal conductive contact with the outer surfaces of the tubular members for cooling thereof, the cooled fresh air being delivered to the enclosure.
	*The system also includes a blower that pushes the working return air upwardly through the tubular member countercurrently to flow of the water, resulting in evaporation of a portion of the water.

* The system can be modified to include a recirculation stream of return air that mixes with the fresh air, increasing the cooling rate, and a bypass stream of cooled air that mixes with the working return air, achieving a lower useful air temperature.
	*The system can also include a hybrid evaporative cooler system that incorporates the components of a vapor compression refrigeration unit, where a portion of the cooled air stream is further cooled by heat exchange with the evaporator of the vapor compression refrigeration unit.
	*This hybrid system can achieve a dry bulb reduction of 3.8° F compared to operation without dehumidification.

* The system has a capacity of 30,000 BTU per hour and is comparable to a vapor compression refrigeration unit of about 37,500-42,800 BTU per hour total capacity, but with a lower power consumption of about 1 to 1.5 kilowatts.
	*The system also has a higher sensible capacity than vapor compression refrigeration units, which have inherent limitations in the sensible capacity of their cooling coils.
	*The system can achieve an efficiency of as much as 90% with an increase in the number of heat exchange tubes.</summary>

<summary>
* The fluid pump comprises two or more pump heads configured in series so that fluid being pumped moves from a reservoir into one pump head and thence to the next pump head in the series, to be eventually discharged from an outlet in a final pump head.
	*Each pump head comprises a housing within which an impeller is contained, the impeller being driven by the drive structure to move fluid.
	*The housing of the pump head comprises an inlet through which fluid is drawn from outside the housing, and the fluid is moved by the impeller from the housing into at least two fluid conduits, preferably at least three fluid conduits, more preferably three or four fluid conduits, to be combined into one fluid flow before exiting the pump head.

* The drive structure may comprise any one or collection of structures that is configured to impart rotational motion on the impellers.
	*Although more than one power source may be employed, preferably, the drive structure is powered by a single power source, for example a suitable motor.
	*The motor may be, for example, an electric motor, a hydraulic motor, a combustion motor or any other motor that can be configured to drive the drive structure.

* The pump heads are disposed in series so that fluid flows sequentially through each pump head of the pump, each pump head being in fluid communication with the pump head before and after in the series.
	*The initial and final pump heads are in direct fluid communication with only one other pump head, the initial pump head drawing fluid from a reservoir in through an inlet in the housing of the initial pump head, and the final pump head expelling fluid out through an outlet of the final pump head.
	*Pump heads may be connected to provide rigidity and a fluid seal between the pump heads.

* A pump assembly comprises a fluid pump mounted on a support structure.
	*The support structure may comprise any suitable apparatus that permits operation of the pump at a fluid reservoir.
	*Some examples of support structures include a wheeled boom, a hitching assembly and a trailer.

* The fluid pump cannot be constructed by simply stacking known pumps together.
	*The initial and final pump heads have different design features to permit fluid flow from one pump head to the other, while commonly driving the impellers.
	*Intermediate pump heads have design features of both the initial and final pump heads to permit the intermediate pump heads to cooperate with neighboring pump heads to permit series flow of fluid and common driving of the impellers.
</summary>

<summary>
  • The present invention relates to engine compression release brakes, particularly to engines having engine compression release brakes for less than all engine cylinders.
	• The engine includes an engine housing defining a plurality of engine cylinders, with an engine compression release brake provided for each of a portion of the engine cylinders, wherein the portion is less than all of the plurality of engine cylinders.
	• The engine compression release brake is operably coupled to a cam actuated exhaust valve.

  • The engine compression release brake system includes a hydraulic system, an electronic control module, and a high pressure pump.
	• The electronic control module controls multiple aspects of engine operation, such as fuel injection timing and engine compression release brake timing.
	• The high pressure pump pumps oil from a low pressure reservoir and delivers it to a high pressure manifold.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to a mounting link between an engine structure and an attached structure such as an auxiliary gearbox.
	• The mounting link is designed to withstand various loads, including routine vibrational loads and sudden or extreme shocks caused by hard landings.
	• The mounting link is also designed to absorb extreme shocks without detaching the gearbox from the engine or transmitting potentially destructive loads.

• The mounting link includes a male link, a female link, and a pin that selectively prevents the relative translation of the male and female links.
	• The male and female links are formed with suitable geometry and material to provide the desired level of coulomb damping.
	• The pin is designed to shear at a known load magnitude corresponding to the maximum structural capability of the gearbox assembly.

• The female link includes a link mounting end and a link interface end, which receives the male link to allow translation and form a radial interface.
	• The male link includes a link mounting end and a link interface end, which is received by the female link.
	• The link interface end of the female link and the link interface end of the male link are in contact at the radial interface.

• The radial interface between the male and female links provides coulomb damping to dissipate energy created by the translation.
	• The amount of coulomb damping is determined by the coefficient of friction, geometry, and contact areas of the male and female links.
	• The materials of the male and female links are selected to provide the desired level of coulomb damping.

• The mounting link can be utilized as a medium to long link to connect the engine to an associated structure, such as the gearbox.
	• The mounting link can rigidly constrain one degree of freedom between the engine and the gearbox.
	• The mounting link can absorb extreme shocks without detaching the gearbox from the engine.

• The pin is designed to serve as a fusible link, which can shear when a sufficiently strong shock or heavy load is applied.
	• The pin is formed of a less durable material than the male and female links to facilitate the desired shear characteristics.
	• The pin is designed to shear at a known load magnitude corresponding to the maximum structural capability of the gearbox assembly.

• The snap ring can be utilized to limit the relative travel of the male link within the female link.
	• The snap ring can be installed after the male link is disposed within the female link to retain the male link at the end of the travel range.
	• The snap ring can

<summary>
  * The present invention relates to archery equipment, specifically to apparatus and methods for attaching arrow points and nocks to arrow shafts and for balancing arrow shafts.
   *The invention solves the problems associated with prior art, such as stress exerted on the wall of the shaft, dirt entering the shaft, and the need for a lightweight point cap system that can be adjusted in weight for perfect balance.

  * The invention provides a point cap system that is small and lightweight, greatly reducing the material and weight of the point or broadhead that may be attached.
   *The point cap system includes a point cap and a balance pin that can be varied in size to be of adjustable weight, allowing for perfect balance of the arrow shaft.</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to military weapons and particularly to apparatus for simulating the sound and flash thereof.
	• The invention is an electronically controlled pyrotechnic sound and flash simulator for use with small arms training.
	• It utilizes a low-cost plastic expendable housing a metal/oxidizer pyrotechnic in conjunction with an electrical ignition system.
	• The expendable would contain a plurality of rounds and would be installed in a firing unit which can be inserted into the weapon via the magazine breech.
	• The invention produces sound and flash by the electrical ignition of the pyrotechnic in a confined space and venting the combustion produced in a manner which utilizes the weapon's ejection port.

• The invention has several objects, including providing a realistic simulation of small arms fire noise and flash.
	• Another object is to provide an inexpensive means to provide realistic training using an actual weapon.
	• Yet another object is to provide a reliable, low maintenance, reusable small arms training device.
	• The invention also aims to provide a pyrotechnic simulation of small arms fire without dangerous pressuration of the ignition chamber.

• The circuitry of the Small Arms Firing Effect Simulator (SAFES) consists of ten functional blocks.
	• The embodiment shown in the block diagram utilizes a bolt interface, a trigger interface, an oscillator control, a 500 Hertz oscillator, a 10 Hertz oscillator, a firing counter, firing decoder, firing control, firing sensors, and a Multiple Integrated Laser Engagement System (MILES) interface.
	• The implementation of the functional block diagram is shown in FIG. 2 utilizing seven CMOS IC's, thirty-one SCR's, five diodes, six capacitors, seventy-four resistors, and three switches.
	• The bolt interface is constructed to provide a realistic simulation of operator actions as would occur during the firing of live rounds.

• The invention is packaged to resemble the magazine clip of the M16 rifle.
	• The small arms firing effect simulator is packaged within a reusable housing having an upper end and a lower end.
	• Upper end is designed for insertion into an M16 in the manner of a magazine clip, said upper end having an exhaust port designed for cooperation with the ejection port of said M16 rifle.
	• Within upper end, switch 101 of bolt interface 10 is positioned for cooperation with the bolt of said M16.

• The plastic expendable is designed to be fabricated in an automatic process, thereby reducing cost

<summary>
  • The present invention relates to an air intake device of an internal combustion engine that utilizes the dynamic effects of the air flow to improve the volumetric efficiency of the engine.
	• The device comprises a tank providing a volumetric area extending along an intake tube, a valve disposed in an interconnecting portion between the tank and the intake passage, and valve activating means to open or shut the valve in response to the engine load.

  • The invention aims to reduce noise from the air intake by providing a narrow passage that constitutes a resonator which absorbs the noise.
	• The resonator effect can be determined by the relationship between the frequency of the intake noise, the speed of the sound, the cross-sectional area of the passage, the length of the passage, and the volume of the tank.</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a two-part bracket for mounting speakers or other equipment to a pole, flat surface, or other structure, allowing simple mounting by connecting the two parts of the bracket together.
  • The bracket assembly consists of a stationary bracket and an adjustable bracket, which can be used to mount a product on a pole, pipe, column, or the like, and allow the product to be easily aimed in a particular direction.

• The adjustable bracket is attached to the object to be mounted, and then positioned on the stationary bracket to mount the object on the surface or pole, providing a means to mount a product on a pole, pipe, column, or the like.
  • The bracket assembly is suitable for loudspeakers, lighting, signage, displays, monitors, video cameras, etc., and is specifically designed for one person to install a fairly heavy item.

• The bracket assembly uses a minimal amount of inexpensive but robust components, providing both economic and time-based efficiency for the installer, and can be used on walls without the pole adapters.
  • The invention provides the means to mount a product on a pole, pipe, column, or the like, and allow the product to be easily aimed in a particular direction, using separate pole adapters.

• The stationary bracket can be mounted to a wall or other flat surface via holes, in any conventional manner, and for pole mounting, the arrangement shown in FIGS. 7-9 can be used.
  • The mounting of the bracket to a pole is shown in FIGS. 8 and 9, where the bracket is placed against a pole, and a strap is threaded through the bracket to keep it in place until further securing measures are taken.

• The invention also includes a speaker mounting bracket that can be attached to the adjustable bracket, so that a loudspeaker can be mounted using the assembly according to the invention.
  • The speaker mounting bracket is securely screwed to the adjustable bracket, and the speaker is mounted on the speaker mounting bracket, allowing the assembly of the speaker, speaker mounting bracket, and adjustable bracket to be easily mounted on the stationary bracket.
</summary>

<summary>
  • The present disclosure relates to a burner that can be part of a system including a plurality of interchangeable or modular heat utilizing appliances, such as cooking grills, cooktops, food smoking apparatus, space heaters, and pyrolyzers.
    • The burner is designed to optimize efficiency and limit unburned fuel emissions, and features a combustion chamber enclosed by an outer wall surrounding a fuel holder, with air flowing through the fuel holder to support initial combustion and around the fuel holder to support secondary combustion.

  • The burner has a shroud providing a second wall that surrounds the outer wall, establishing a flow path for tertiary combustion air and providing an external surface cool enough to avoid burns if casually contacted.
    • The shroud also constrains air immediately outside the housing to flow by convection radially inwardly to join exhaust products flowing upwardly from the exhaust outlet, further supporting secondary combustion.

  • The burner features manual couplings for removably coupling modular heat utilizing appliances, including closed and open cookers, a food smoker, a space heater, and a pyrolyzer, and may comprise a fuel feed feature to enable renewing the fuel supply during operation.
    • The modular heat utilizing appliances can be detachably coupled to the burner using at least one draw latch, and may include a cooker, a gas-to-gas heat exchanger, or a pyrolyzer with a condenser for condensing vaporized liquid products of pyrolysis.</summary>

<summary>
* The rotary internal combustion engine's water cooling system is crucial for improving fuel economy and durability. 
	*The housing water cooling system functions to lower the temperature of the metal areas exposed to the highest heat input and to minimize temperature differences throughout the housing for preventing destruction.
	*The most severe cooling problem resides in the area where combustion and expansion of the working gases takes place; this area immediately surrounds the spark plugs.

* The in-line arrangement of spark plug bosses in the water passageway contributes to preventing adequate heat extraction. 
	*The up-stream plug boss creates a flow shadow effect upon the down-stream plug boss preventing a controlled or well ordered flow regime.
	*Boiling at the plugs results in a vapor stream which widens the uncontrolled flow zone and aggravates the heat transfer problem.

* The invention provides a housing structure which facilitates circumferential cooling flow in the rotor housing while permitting the intrusion of spark plug bosses therethrough. 
	*The housing is structured to minimize thermal distortion, particularly in the zone surrounding said spark plug bosses.
	*The invention employs circumferential cooling having a vertical flow moving past bosses therein which are an integral part of said structure, the structure being made to increase the heat transfer coefficient of said cooling circuit at the spark plug boss zone by at least 20 % over prior art capabilities.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to a method of minimizing flow disturbance caused by the closing and reopening of turbine control valves during periodic operational testing.
	*The method uses control valve positions as feedback to minimize flow disturbance, maintaining the total mass flow through several parallel turbine inlet flow control valves constant.

* The flow is determined as a function of control valve position, and the flow change due to closure of one of the several parallel flow paths during valve testing is calculated.
	*The flow characteristic for each valve of the system with N valves, and for the system with N-1 valves, is determined during the turbine design process.

* The test compensation circuit uses control valve positions as feedback and compensates by adjusting the flow through parallel control valves to minimize flow disturbance caused by the closure and reopening of turbine control valve during testing.
	*The circuit includes a test compensation array, a sample and hold circuit, a multiplier circuit, and a summing circuit to calculate the flow compensation required for the three input control valves not being tested.

* The method and system of the present invention were tested using a mathematically modeled turbine system, and the results showed a 95% reduction in pressure excursion of the turbine inlet main steam pressure.
	*The test results demonstrated the effectiveness of the control valve test compensating control of the present invention in minimizing flow disturbance during valve testing.</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a mixing valve for an aircraft cleaning apparatus that combines fluids from two separate sources into one mixture.
	* The valve has two inlets A and B, and one outlet, with the outlet mixture ranging from 0% inlet A fluid, 100% inlet B fluid to 100% inlet A fluid, 0% inlet B fluid.
	* The valve is designed to provide a constant pressure cleaning solution to each user, with the cleaning agent to water ratio being continuously adjustable.
	* The valve system is capable of operating multiple identical valve systems from a common soap solution source and common water source without affecting fluid pressure.

* The valve body defines a bore with a predetermined diameter, and two inlet passages for receiving a first fluid and a second fluid at different pressures.
	* The valve body also defines an outlet passage for providing a proportional mixture of the two fluids.
	* A flow restricting device is used to reduce the flow rate of fluid from one inlet passage to the other.
	* The valve body is preferably made of a uniform construction material, such as 304 S/S.

* The valve includes an elongated valve member with a cylindrical portion and a sealing sleeve.
	* The valve member has a series of consecutive cylindrical spools and channels for retaining fluid seal rings.
	* The valve member is designed to direct the flow of soap solution and water in varying proportions to the outlet passage.
	* The valve member is slidably received within the valve body bore.

* The valve system includes a handle for manually adjusting the valve, with a gripping portion and a pin for locking the handle to the valve.
	* The handle is designed to rotate freely within the valve body bore.
	* The valve system includes stops for restraining rotational motion of the valve.
	* The valve system includes a set screw for restraining translational motion of the valve.

* The valve system allows continuous analog control of the proportional quantities of soap solution and water emerging from the outlet passage.
	* The system allows for a mixture ranging from approximately 0% water, 100% soap solution, to 100% water, 0% soap solution.
	* The system includes mechanisms to maintain constant fluid pressures at the inlet passages.
	* The system is designed to operate multiple identical valve systems from a common soap solution source and common water source.

* The valve system includes a flow reducing device to significantly reduce the flow rate of soap solution entering one inlet passage.
	* The system includes a bore with a size that significantly reduces

<summary>
• The present invention relates to a method of compressing gas in a compressor station for a gas pipeline, particularly in permanent frost areas.
	• The method includes compressing the gas delivered in the pipeline with an entry pressure in a compression procedure to a higher pressure.
	• Subsequently, the gas is cooled by a heat exchange and again fed for further transportation to the pipeline with a lower exit temperature.
	• The exit temperature is particularly an exit temperature of at most 0° C., and with an increased exit pressure as compared to the entry pressure.
	• The present invention also relates to an arrangement for carrying out the method.
	• The arrangement includes at least one compressor for compressing gas, at least one heat exchanger for cooling compressed gas, and valve-controlled pipelines.
	• The arrangement also includes control units for controlling the compressor and the valves.

• The invention starts from the fact that it is known to carry out the compression of a gas supplied at an entry pressure below the nominal pressure to an increased pressure.
	• The compression can be carried out in a single stage or in multiple stages in compressors which are connected in series.
	• Between the compressor stages and particularly after the last compressor stage, cooling by heat exchange takes place.
	• The required lower exit temperature of at most 0° C., preferably -5° C., is reached for the re-entry of the compressed gas into the gas pipeline.

• The present invention utilizes the known physical effect according to which a compressed gas is inevitably cooled when expanded to a lower pressure.
	• The expansion can be carried out by throttling or with the simultaneous performance of work.
	• In order to ensure the required exit pressure or nominal pressure at the exit of the compressor station, the present invention provides that the gas to be transported is compressed to an excess pressure.
	• The excess pressure is substantially above the exit pressure, for example, 10 to 50 bar above the exit pressure.

• The compression to the excess pressure is carried out in a total of three stages.
	• A predominant portion of the compression takes place in two successive primary compression stages which are equipped with machines which produce approximately the same pressure ratio.
	• The compressors of the primary compression stages may be essentially of the same construction.
	• Only the compressor housing of the subsequent compressor or compressors must be dimensioned for a higher pressure than the housing of the compressor or compressors of the first primary compression stage.

• The present invention provides an altogether better possibility of using

<summary>
• Electronic components produce heat during operation, and in many applications, free convection cooling is insufficient to prevent overheating.
	• Free convection cooling relies on the unaided movement of air.
	• Electric fans are often used as a low-cost solution to move ambient air across electronic components at a higher rate.
	• Cooling fans are typically integrated with an enclosure that houses the electronic components.
	• The use of cooling fans is common in various industries, including automotive, computer, and electronic instrumentation.

• Traditional fastening techniques for securing cooling fans to an enclosure increase product costs due to labor and tool requirements.
	• Fasteners such as screws, dowel pins, and rivets are commonly used.
	• The handling costs associated with fasteners also contribute to increased product costs.
