	• The need for a fastener-free solution has led to the development of alternative mounting systems.
	• The present invention aims to eliminate the need for traditional fasteners.

• The cooling fan assembly of the present invention includes a motor, fan blade, and motor carrier.
	• The motor carrier has a plurality of mounting legs with resilient leg portions and a compression gap.
	• The mounting legs are designed to engage with recess portions on the panel.
	• The motor carrier also includes spring members that urge the motor carrier away from the panel.

• The installation process involves moving the cooling fan assembly from a load position to a partially installed position and finally to a fully installed position.
	• A combined compressive and rotating force is applied to the cooling fan assembly or panel.
	• The compressive force compresses the spring member, and the rotating force repositions the resilient legs.
	• The resilient legs enter into a residual opening, where they spring outwardly and capture the leg portion pair.

• The present invention provides a fastener-free solution for mounting cooling fans to an enclosure.
	• The spring member remains in a compressed state, urging the turned-out portions against the panel.
	• This urging function prevents vibrational noise and ensures the resilient leg portions do not back out of their respective openings.
	• The invention is applicable to various industries and can be modified or added to without departing from the spirit of the invention.
	• The subject matter sought to be protected extends to the subject matter defined in the appended claims.</summary>

<summary>

* Spacecraft structures require advanced lightweight and stiff composite materials, but these materials have low inherent damping, leading to high vibration levels that can compromise instrument functionality.
	* Instruments mounted on precision kinematic mounts (KM) are particularly vulnerable to vibration.
	* 14% of spacecraft launches through 1984 suffered vibration/shock related failures, with 50% resulting in catastrophic mission loss.

* Current efforts to reduce vibration in spacecraft structures may not be sufficient to meet instrument design levels.
	* Additional vibration reduction techniques are needed to protect instruments.
	* Kinematic mounts can be modified to incorporate novel damping features.

* Conventional kinematic mounts have limited success in reducing vibration.
	* These mounts are designed to safely carry launch loads but do not minimize loads transmitted to the instrument.
	* The six suspension modes introduced by the mounts have very little damping.

* The present invention aims to provide kinematic mounts with passive energy dissipating mechanisms.
	* The mounts incorporate novel damping features to protect instruments from potentially damaging flight loads.
	* The design preserves the fundamental features of kinematic mounts, such as strength, stiffness, and kinematic features.

* The damping mechanism can be provided at machined hinge or flexure locations of the mounts.
	* Local dampers can be designed at these locations to dissipate high energy disturbances.
	* Two embodiments of the damper design are depicted in FIGS. 3A and 3B.

* The first embodiment uses a spherical damper with a viscoelastic (VEM) damping material.
	* The VEM material is frequency and temperature dependent, allowing for significant levels of damping.
	* The damper can be composed of titanium alloy or non-metallic materials.

* The second embodiment uses a cylindrical slot damper with space-qualified high damping VEM.
	* The damper induces compression/tension into the VEM, providing similar damping performance to the spherical damper.
	* VEM washers can be used instead of VEM O-rings.

* The proposed mounting concept uses six identical strut elements, simplifying manufacturing complexity and costs.
	* The design involves simple machining of standard bar stock, such as titanium alloy.
	* The mounting scheme can be arranged to approximately uncouple the mount suspension modes.

* The center-of-gravity mounting system provides a set of six nearly uncoupled modes.
	* This is important in applications where dynamic disturbances are inherent within the instrument.
	* The proposed mounting scheme provides this capability, allowing for improved instrument performance

<summary>
* The invention relates to a large size clutch unit of the oil shear type, used in an aircraft catapult system, which overcomes the disadvantages of previously known constructions.
	*The clutch unit is capable of applying strong coupling forces between the plates and discs while maintaining high control accuracy in accordance with various input conditions.

* The clutch unit utilizes hydraulic fluid for the dual purpose of retracting the plate actuating means to reduce residual drag, and as a coolant for the clutch discs.
	*The auxiliary fluid supply maintains a pressure in the chambers in accordance with the rotational speed of the unit, causing the piston and cylinder means to positively retract and separate the clutch plates from the clutch disc segments.

* The clutch unit comprises an input shaft, an output shaft, a plurality of clutch plates connected to one of the shafts, and a plurality of clutch discs interleaved between the clutch plates and connected to the other shaft.
	*The clutch discs are mounted in such a manner as to permit the easy removal and replacement of individual segments without the necessity of disassembling the entire mechanism.

* The invention provides a new and improved clutch unit with highly improved cooling, minimum disc friction, and convenient inspection of the disc segments without requiring total "tear-down" of the unit.
	*The clutch unit minimizes residual drag, which is extremely important in clutch units of the capacity of the present invention, i.e., 85,000 h.p.</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to an internal combustion engine with a combustion cylinder and one or more expansion cylinders, where the expansion cylinders receive hot exhaust gas from the combustion cylinder and expand it to generate additional power.
	*The expansion cylinders may be two-stroke or four-stroke cylinders, and may be arranged in a cascade configuration to maximize energy extraction.
	*The engine may include a water injection system to inject water into the expansion cylinders, which helps to cool the exhaust gas and generate additional power.
	*The engine may also include a gear reduction system to optimize the output of the engine and minimize heat loss.
		*The gear reduction system may include a planetary transmission or a coaxial gear reduction.
		*The gear reduction system may be designed to provide a 2:1 or 4:1 reduction in speed.
* The engine may include a water cooling system to cool the combustion cylinder and expansion cylinders, which may include a water jacket and a pump to circulate the water.
	*The water cooling system may be designed to capture heat from the combustion cylinder and transfer it to the expansion cylinders.
	*The water cooling system may include a temperature sensor and a control system to regulate the temperature of the engine.
* The engine may include a catalytic conversion system to reduce emissions, which may include a surface material with catalytic properties.
	*The catalytic conversion system may be integrated into the engine cylinders or exhaust system.
	*The catalytic conversion system may include a surface material such as platinum, palladium, or rhodium.</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention provides a plate consisting of a steel substrate and a precoat, which includes an intermetallic alloy layer topped by a metal alloy layer, with the metal alloy layer removed in an area at the periphery of the plate.
	*This removal of the metal alloy layer is done to prevent the formation of intermetallic areas within welded assemblies, which are sources of the onset of rupture, and to ensure good corrosion resistance.

* The width of the area from which the metal alloy layer has been removed is preferably between 0.2 and 2.2 mm, and is adjusted to enable welding with no introduction of any element of the precoat into the molten area, and sufficient corrosion resistance of the welded assembly after subsequent alloying and austenizing heat treatment.
	*The removal of the metal alloy layer can be monitored by means of micrographic examination, optical inspection, or spectrometer reflectivity or emissivity measurement.

* The present invention also provides a method for fabricating a precoated steel plate, which includes coating a steel plate to obtain a precoat having an intermetallic alloy layer topped by a metal alloy layer, and removing the metal alloy layer in an area not totally contiguous with the periphery of the plate.
	*The method can be used to fabricate complex finished parts by assembling more than two plates, which can be of different thickness or composition to provide the required properties locally.

* The invention provides a use of a plate, blank or part according to the present invention for the fabrication of structural or safety parts for motorized terrestrial automotive vehicles.
	*The parts fabricated using the present invention have good ductility and good corrosion resistance, and can be used for the fabrication of safety parts, such as anti-intrusion or underbody parts, reinforcing bars, B-pillars, for the construction of automotive vehicles.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention is a Supervisory Control And Data Acquisition (SCADA) remote control system for a mobile structure that recovers naturally occurring energy from severe weather patterns.
	• The system includes computer servers that gather data through diverse means such as Global Position Satellite (GPS) systems, weather satellite systems, and telecommunications satellites.
	• The SCADA system tracks the position and velocity of the mobile structure through a GPS system and communicates with the central service facility through a wireless physical medium.
	• The system uses a Velocity Prediction Program (VPP) to estimate or forecast energy efficiency of the mobile structure and suggests optimal points of sail based on prevailing wind and optimal least-cost or highest yield path analysis inputs.
	• The system includes a Graphical User Interface (GUI) that allows a human operator to interact with the system, invoke SCADA algorithms, and alter visual representations and instantaneous control of the mobile structure.
	• The system can be used for various types of mobile structures, including sailing vessels, propelled vessels, and barges, and can be used for different types of energy recovery, including wind energy, water current energy, and wave energy.

	• The system can be used for remote control of any system that exploits energy from weather patterns, including electrical storms, windstorms, offshore tropical storms or hurricanes.
		• The system can guide navigation of vessels for logistics-only purposes past such weather patterns.
		• The system can be used for automatic operation of a mobile energy recovery system.
		• The system can be used for navigation and control of a mobile structure in a severe weather pattern.

	• The system includes a central service facility that houses the server for the primary purpose of aggregating weather data from various sources.
		• The central service facility can be a large vessel, such as a tanker ship, or a port facility.
		• The central service facility can be equipped with energy storage systems, such as compressed hydrogen, metal hydride storage, or charged batteries or capacitors.
		• The central service facility can be connected to a Wide Area Network (WAN) for weather satellite data or alternate sources of weather information.

	• The system includes a control and communications microprocessor system that executes certain functions, including input, output, and input/output (I/O) functions.
		• The microprocessor system can be a Programmable Logic Controller (PLC) that is ruggedized and robust to physical environments.
		• The microprocessor system can communicate with sensors and control circuits through

<summary>
* The invention relates to a rolling body guide cage produced from at least one ring element and several guide structures arranged in succession in the circumferential direction.
	* The ring element is composed of at least two flat material ring segments joined to one another in succession in the circumferential direction.
	* The flat material ring segments are connected to one another in a production step which precedes the formation of the axial profiling.

* The flat material ring segments are cut out from a sheet metal material and are preferably formed as 120° ring segments.
	* Only three weld points are required for joining together a ring element from such flat material ring segments.
	* The 120° segments can be punched out in close succession from a sheet metal strip.

* The joint contours of the flat material ring segments form an undercut geometry which preliminarily couples the ring segments to one another in the circumferential direction.
	* The geometric profile of the joint contours is selected such that adequate coupling of the ring segments is produced with as short as possible a weld seam length.
	* The joint contours are configured such that the weld seams taper both towards the ring element inner circumferential edge and towards the ring element outer circumferential edge with as obtuse an angle as possible.

* The invention is particularly advantageous in the manufacture of rolling body guide cages with an internal diameter of more than 140 mm.
	* The process costs associated with the formation of three weld joints are substantially below the material costs of the cutting waste which has hitherto arisen.
	* The invention has been shown to be particularly advantageous in the manufacture of rolling body guide cages for groove and angular ball bearings.

* The ring segments can be produced in such a manner that they initially have a slight oversize and are initially further cut and where necessary calibrated after welding.
	* The ring segments can in principle also be cut to their final dimensions in terms of their material width and are subsequently only formed and where necessary punched internally.
	* The ring segments can be punched out from a sufficiently wide strip material and thereby pushed directly into a positioning device.

* The welding is preferably carried out by a laser beam guided in a path-controlled manner.
	* The welding can where necessary be carried out with the addition of welding material, in particular via a welding wire.
	* The weld seam is preferably formed by only local fusing of the material along the joint edges.

* A particularly high-quality design of the weld connection points can be achieved in that a material bead close to the

<summary>
  * The present methods and systems relate to processing and transmitting information to facilitate providing service in a telecommunications network, particularly using global satellite positioning to facilitate processing and transmission of information associated with telecommunications service locations and routing travel between more than one such service location.
    * The methods and systems include requesting at least one set of coordinates associated with the customer service location, accessing a technician server to direct a global satellite positioning system to obtain the set of coordinates, and obtaining the coordinates and updating one or more databases with the coordinates.

  * The methods and systems also include generating directions for a service technician traveling from a first customer service location to at least a second customer service location, by obtaining through a technician server at least one set of “from” coordinates associated with the first customer service location and at least one set of “to” coordinates associated with the second customer location.
    * The directions are generated in a mapping system based on the “to” and the “from” coordinates, and can be transmitted to and stored in a database associated with the address guide system, and used to assist in determining the service location of a customer and to provide driving directions to a service technician.</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a system for compensating electromagnetic interfering fields, particularly magnetic fields, using two sensors and a digital processor.
	*The system aims to compensate both homogeneous and inhomogeneous magnetic fields, and to simulate measuring electromagnetic interfering fields at the location of the object to be protected.
	*The system also aims to equalize potentially arising feedback effects when using two magnetic field compensation systems in immediate vicinity.

	*The system consists of two real triaxial magnetic field sensors, three pairs of compensation coils, and one control unit.
		*The control unit is designed as a control processor, such as a Digital Signal Processor (DSP) or a field programmable gate array (FPGA).
		*The control unit receives the output signals of the two real magnetic field sensors and combines them to form a virtual sensor signal.

	*The system can be used in various configurations, including a single compensation system and two compensation systems operated directly beside each other.
		*In the case of two compensation systems, a feedback matrix is used to account for the feedback effects between the two systems.
		*The feedback matrix can be experimentally determined by applying a signal to an output of the first compensation system and measuring the components absorbed by the sensors of the second system.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a method for investigating a sample using CARS microscopy, where a resonance signal is generated by coherent anti-Stokes Raman scattering.
	• This method involves exciting at least one resonance site of the sample by means of laser irradiation and sensing the resonance signal in image-producing fashion.

• The present invention aims to provide a remedy for the limitations of conventional CARS microscopy methods.
	• The object is to furnish a correspondingly improved method for CARS microscopy.

• The method comprises furnishing at least one resonance site by means of a bioorthogonal reaction of an intrinsic chemical structure of the sample with at least one further reaction partner.
	• This allows for the introduction of a corresponding structure that is not inherently contained in the sample.

• The term "bioorthogonal reaction" refers to chemical reactions that can proceed in living systems without appreciably interfering with natural processes.
	• Bioorthogonal reactions can proceed with no cell-damaging effects.

• Typical bioorthogonal reactions include 1,3-dipolar cycloaddition between azides and cyclooctynes, and the reaction between nitrones and cyclooctynes.
	• Other typical reactions are oxime/hydrate formation from aldehydes and ketones, tetrazine reactions, isonitrile-based click reactions, and quadricyclane formation.

• A Diels-Alder reaction and/or a Staudinger ligation are considered particularly advantageous for use in the bioorthogonal reaction according to the present invention.
	• Staudinger ligation is a highly chemoselective method for producing bioconjugates.

• The use of bioorthogonal reactions in combination with CARS microscopy makes possible dedicated detection of target sites in any samples.
	• This allows for the CARS-active scattering cross section of the respective target to be increased or generated in the first place by suitable synthesis reactions.

• A method in which a structure of the sample which does not intrinsically have a resonance site is equipped with a resonance site by means of the bioorthogonal reaction is regarded as particularly advantageous.
	• This relates in particular to the inherently non-resonant background, which in conventional methods yields statistical signals that are nevertheless not reproducible.

• The invention makes it possible to tag the non-resonant background with corresponding resonance sites and thus to generate a stable, reproducible background signal.
	• This enables an improvement in the reproducibility of corresponding CARS methods, as well as improved quantitative conclusions.

<summary>
• The present invention provides a system for assessing segmentations from various sources, such as clinicians or software systems, to evaluate the quality of segmentations in radiation therapy.
	• The system compares segmentations by converting them to volume models and identifying missing or extra volume elements.
	• The system provides a metric method to measure the quality of the segmentations, which can be customized by the user.

• The system uses electronic files, such as DICOM-RT files, to record segmentations and provides a graphic display screen to display the results.
	• The system allows users to input multiple segmentation files and select the structures to be compared.
	• The system provides a table to assign measurement metrics to particular structures.

• The system provides a formula parameter table to allow users to develop their own metric methods.
	• The table includes parameters for extra and missing volume elements, such as mm Forgive, mm UpperCutoff, A, B, C, and D.
	• The system plots the metric method as a graph to assist users in developing custom metric methods.

• The system voxelizes the segmentations to create a voxel model, which is then adjusted for origin offsets.
	• The system compares the voxel models to identify common, missing, and extra volume elements.
	• The system determines the scalar distances between the volume elements.

• The system provides an analysis window to display the segmentations, shaded to indicate common, missing, and extra volume elements.
	• The system superimposes the shaded volumes over an image of the actual structure.
	• The system provides a quantitative evaluation of the comparison, including primary volume, secondary volume, missing volume, extra volume, and metric method/metric score.

• The system provides a histogram table to tally the voxels of the missing and extra volumes according to a distance measurement bin.
	• The system allows users to print a report of the results.
	• The system can be used for training clinicians, periodic quality assurance testing, and assessing anatomy auto-segmentation routines or systems.

• The system can be used to assess whether a new treatment plan should be prepared based on changes in the internal anatomy of the patient during radiation therapy.
	• The system provides a tool for comparing the quality of segmentations from different sources.
	• The system is sensitive to both overinclusive and underinclusive segmentations.

• The system provides a simple method of comparing segmentation volumes through the use of digitized volume elements.
	• The system provides an intuitive display form that can be rapidly assessed by an

<summary>
• The invention relates to data processing systems and the apparatus for executing floating point operations.
	• The floating point format represents a numerical quantity by a fraction value and an exponent argument value.
	• The principal advantage of the floating point format is the increased range of numbers that can be manipulated.

• The execution of addition and subtraction operations in the floating point format is more complex and requires a greater time period than the same operation in the standard data format.
	• This complexity is due to having to align fractions prior to their addition or subtraction so that the exponents are identical.
	• The result may also need to be normalized by shifting the fraction until a logic "1" is stored in the most significant bit position and adjusting the argument of the exponent accordingly.

• The invention provides an improved data processing system and apparatus for the execution of floating point operations.
	• It accelerates the effective subtraction operation in a floating point unit by using a difference between a subset of signals of the operand exponent arguments.
	• The subset difference is used to begin subtraction of differences between operand fractions prior to the availability of the complete difference between the operand exponent arguments.

• The invention divides the effective subtract operations into two procedures to accelerate their execution.
	• The first procedure is used when the absolute value of the difference of the exponent arguments is greater than one.
	• The second procedure is used when the absolute value of the difference of the exponent arguments is less than or equal to one.

• The invention uses a difference between a subset of the operand exponent arguments to accelerate the effective subtraction operation.
	• The subset difference is used to initiate the computation of the final fraction result.
	• The correct final fraction result is determined based on the calculation of the complete difference between the operand exponent arguments.

• The invention provides a technique for accelerating the computation of the final fraction result.
	• The technique uses a difference between the seven least significant bit signals of the operand exponent argument.
	• The technique selects the correct final fraction result based on the calculation of the complete difference between the operand exponent arguments.

• The invention includes an apparatus implementing the procedures for accelerating the effective subtraction operation.
	• The apparatus includes a subtraction unit, a detection logic unit, a shift and selection logic unit, and a selection logic unit.
	• The apparatus determines the correct final fraction result based on the calculation of the complete difference between the operand exponent arguments.

• The invention accelerates the effective subtraction operation by calculating a difference between an subset of signal positions of an operand exponent argument.

<summary>
  • The present invention relates to the collection of blood and medical specimens in a medical facility, aiming to reduce or avoid mislabeling of specimen vials.
	• The invention uses a system of machine-readable codes, including barcodes, to track specimens and ensure accurate identification and processing.
	• The system includes a computer, computer storage, and electronic reading means, such as a barcode scanner, to read and store the machine-readable codes.
	• The codes are used to identify the patient, the specimen, and the specimen-taker, and to verify the relationship between the patient and the specimen.

  • The method of collecting a specimen according to the invention includes several steps, including:
	• Storing patient information and a unique patient barcode number in the computer storage.
	• Generating a unique order barcode number and storing it in the computer storage.
	• Inputting the patient barcode number, order barcode number, and specimen-taker barcode number into the computer.
	• Verifying the relationship between the patient barcode number and the order barcode number, and storing the specimen-taker barcode number and specimen barcode number in the computer storage.
	• Outputting a signal to draw the blood sample and send it to the lab for analysis.
</summary>

<summary>
  • The device is a voice-activated distance measuring device that uses GPS technology and voice recognition to provide golfers with information such as distance to the pin, green size, and pin placement.
    • The device can be incorporated into various designs of headgear, such as hats or visors, and can also be used for other applications like hiking, surveying, and hunting.

  • The device features a bone conductance vibration sensor that receives audio from the user through vibrations in the skull, providing clear voice recognition while rejecting external noise.
    • The device can also be connected to a personal computer or other technology via a serial, USB, or wireless connection to upload and download data, facilitating functions such as graphical display of scores and ball trajectories.</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to the field of semiconductor design technology, particularly to systems and techniques used for implementing circuit designs into silicon-based integrated circuits (ICs).
	*It provides a design rule checking system and method that accurately reports appropriate errors for appropriate regions in a system that includes two different kinds of circuits, such as memory and logic.
	*The invention eliminates false errors caused by design rule checking tools examining regions that are not subject to the same design rules supported by the design rule-checking tool.
	*It ensures that all types of memory regions have to fulfill all memory rules of their group, and all logic regions have to fulfill logic and memory rules.

* The invention creates customized rules appropriate for different types of memory regions that might be included on a chip.
	*These customized rules are based on modifying a standard logic rule by “pushing” more liberal memory-based parameters onto stricter logic-based parameters.
	*The customized rules are used to check against mask pattern data for layout violations detected in a layer (or layers) of an IC.
	*The results include separate error reports for real logic errors, real memory errors, and other types of errors.

* The invention provides a system and method for creating customized design rule check command files based on modifying a standard logic rule file.
	*It takes into consideration minimum dimensional values extracted from memory bit cell design parameters.
	*The system derives customized memory rules from standard logic design rules.
	*It uses a design rule checker to check a memory bit cell mask pattern data against a design rule command file.

* The invention can be applied to any mask pattern database, including one having no memory blocks, or even multiple types of memory blocks.
	*It requires different types of memory to be identified in some way, such as with different memory ID layers to define core bit cell regions.
	*The invention can be implemented using conventional GDS formatted data.
	*It can be performed in software with a conventional computer system adapted to execute the types of code described herein.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention uses waveguide holograms as illuminators for objects with specific illumination requirements, such as display holograms or spatial light modulators.
	• The waveguide holograms are based on thin substrate waveguides, which are characterized by the relationship between the width of the incident laser beam and the thickness of the waveguide.
	• The waveguide holograms can be used to provide controlled illumination of objects, with high diffraction efficiencies and minimal stray light.

• The illumination system comprises a thin substrate waveguide optically coupled to a coherent light source, such as a laser.
	• The waveguide hologram can be recorded non-uniformly to compensate for non-uniformity of the diffracted wavefront along the propagation direction.
	• The waveguide hologram can also be used to produce a uniform illumination beam by exposing a photographic emulsion to the uncompensated beam.

• The waveguide hologram illuminator occupies much less space than conventional lens illumination systems.
	• The active volume for a WGH illuminator is typically much smaller than the volume for a conventional lens illumination system.
	• The gain of a WGH illuminator is typically much higher than that of a conventional lens illumination system.

• The diffraction efficiency of a WGH illuminator can be very high, approaching 0.99.
	• The local diffraction efficiency in each region of the hologram can be defined as the ratio of the intensity of the diffracted light to the intensity of the illumination beam.
	• The global diffraction efficiency of the WGH is defined as the ratio of the total intensity of the diffracted light to the intensity of the illumination beam.

• The waveguide hologram illuminator can produce two diffracted beams, one out of each side of the waveguide.
	• The unutilized beam can reduce the useful efficiency and introduce noise into the system.
	• The problem of two-sidedness can be solved by absorbing the light emerging from one side or by using off-axis illumination.

• The waveguide hologram illuminator can be used to illuminate spatial light modulators (SLMs).
	• The SLM can be used to modulate the polarization of the diffracted light.
	• The polarization analyzers can be used to control or block the unmodulated light.

• The waveguide hologram can be recorded using a modified conventional holographic recording system or a configuration with a prism coupler.
	• The recording medium can be optically contacted to a

<summary>
• The invention relates to testing rotors of dynamoelectric machines, specifically squirrel cage rotors for induction motors.
	• The test apparatus and method aim to measure resistance, reactance, and effective electrical skew of the rotor.
	• The apparatus comprises a test head with exciting means, voltage sensing means, current sensing means, and processing means.
	• The test head includes a core of magnetic material, primary windings, voltage pick-up coils, and skew pick-up coils.

• The test apparatus includes a data acquisition, processing, and control system with a terminal, printer, and power supply.
	• The system controls testing, acquires data, and processes the data without operator intervention.
	• The system includes a sample and hold circuit, analog multiplexer, and analog to digital converter.
	• The system also includes a data processor and control processor for data processing and control.

• The test method involves rotating the rotor within the test head, inducing voltages in the rotor, and sensing the magnetic flux.
	• The method includes sampling the sense signals, processing the data, and calculating resistance, reactance, and effective skew.
	• The method also includes determining dissymmetry and skew dissymmetry values.
	• The results are displayed on a display and may be printed on a printer.

• The test apparatus includes a retraction and drive mechanism for retracting and rotating the rotor.
	• The mechanism includes a spindle, hydraulic cylinder, and drive motor.
	• The mechanism also includes a clutch mechanism for holding the rotor in place during rotation.
	• The clutch mechanism includes annular sleeves, o-rings, and an annular ring.

• The test apparatus includes a control processor for controlling the sequence of events during a test.
	• The control processor generates control signals for the retraction and drive mechanism.
	• The control processor also generates signals for the drive motor and position sensor.
	• The control processor receives input signals from the start switches and position sensor.

• The test apparatus includes a Winchester disk for storing statistical data.
	• The data includes totals of passed and failed rotors, running sums of calculated values, and running sums of squares of values.
	• The data also includes averages and standard deviations of the calculated values.
	• The data is used for statistical analysis over a series of tests.

• The test method includes comparing calculated values to predetermined threshold values.
	• The method includes determining pass/fail indications based on the comparisons.
	• The method also includes generating reject signals

<summary>
* The present disclosure provides a method for securing a mobile device by granting access to native resources of an operating system to a managed library in response to validating a digital certificate associated with the managed library, while denying access to a managed application that includes a digital certificate authorizing the managed application to access a specific native resource of the operating system through the managed library.
	*The method involves receiving a request from a managed application to access a native system resource through a managed library, authorizing the request by a manager that includes information identifying managed libraries that the managed application is authorized to access, and sending a request to access the native system resource to a runtime host that is effectuated by native instructions.
	*The runtime host accesses the native system resource, and the manager authorizes the request to access the native system resource by the managed library based on information obtained from a digital certificate associated with the managed library.
	*The method also involves verifying managed metadata associated with an executable, inspecting the managed metadata at runtime to determine that the executable includes type-safe code, and storing the verified executable in a digitally signed container.
		*The digitally signed container is transmitted to a mobile device, and the mobile device determines that the executable in the file includes managed dependencies.
		*The verification system checks the header fields of the executable to determine whether they include expected header values and validates the metadata by exercising it.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to an improved identification card with an internal antenna and integrated circuit chip laminated between two protective, non-rigid layers.
	*The card has a core layer made of silica-filled polyolefin with a first side and a second side.
	*The core layer has at least one antenna fixed to the first side and at least one computer chip electrically connected to the antenna.

* The card has a bottom sheet made of silica-filled polyolefin attached to the first side of the core layer by a first adhesive layer.
	*The bottom sheet has an alkyd resin spid containing an anti-binding agent printed on the first side of the core layer.
	*The spid is printed in a "racetrack" or oval pattern.

* The card has a first laminate layer attached to the second side of the core layer by a second adhesive layer.
	*The first laminate layer is made of a substantially transparent polymer such as polyester or polycarbonate.
	*The first laminate layer provides mechanical strength to the image-receiving layer.

* The card has a second laminate layer attached to the bottom sheet by a third adhesive layer.
	*The second laminate layer is also made of a substantially transparent polymer.
	*The second laminate layer provides additional protection to the electronic components.

* The card has an image-receiving layer formed on the first laminate layer.
	*The image-receiving layer is suited to accept a printed image or portrait by dye diffusion thermal transfer methods.
	*The image-receiving layer is made of a polymer system that is incompatible with the polymer of the donor sheet.

* The card has a protective layer applied over the image-receiving layer.
	*The protective layer is made of a biaxially oriented polyester or other optically clear durable plastic film.
	*The protective layer prevents bleeding of dye from the image-receiving layer.

* The card can have a low cohesivity polymeric layer, security ink, or other security feature.
	*The security feature protects the document against tampering or counterfeiting.
	*The security feature does not compromise the ability of the protective layer to protect the identification document.

* The card can be personalized with a common inkjet printer prior to addition of the polyester layers.
	*The personalized information is printed between the core layer and the polyester layers.
	*The inkjet receiver coating is only applied in the area where printing will occur.

* The card provides significant improvements in durability and ease of manufacture compared to prior art

<summary>
* The invention relates to the implementation of a queue, particularly a FIFO-type queue, in a memory, specifically in connection with functional memories.
	*Functional memories are memories in which updates are carried out in such a way that first the path from the root of a tree-shaped structure to the point of updating is copied, and thereafter the update is made in the copied data.
	*The solution in accordance with the invention is intended to reduce the amount of required copying in a functional structure.
* The invention uses a tree-shaped data structure to implement a queue, where the nodes have a given maximum size and the additions of data units are directed to the first non-full node on the first edge of the data structure.
	*The deletions of data units are directed to a leaf node on the edge of the tree, typically on the opposite edge.
	*The tree-shaped data structure will also be termed shortly a tree in the following.
* The invention also comprises a separate header node comprising three elements, each of which may be empty or contain a pointer, to point to the end of the queue, the tree-shaped structure, and the beginning of the queue.
	*The header node makes use of an identifier indicating which of said separate nodes constitutes the beginning and which constitutes the end of the queue.
	*The queue can be inverted by changing the value of the identifier, and the tree structure will be interpreted as a mirror image.
* The invention can be used to implement a double-ended queue, where additions can also be made to the beginning and deletions can be made from the end of the queue.
	*The queue can be inverted in constant time and space.
	*The structure is also fully symmetrical, allowing for the use of the queue as a double-ended queue.</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to electrically programmable random access memory (EPROM) devices, and more particularly to embedded EPROM devices manufactured by existing integrated circuit (IC) technologies.
	• The invention aims to provide EPROM devices that can be manufactured using existing DRAM technology and standard logic technologies, without requiring high voltages for operations.
	• The invention also aims to provide EPROM devices that can be used for programmable redundancy circuits in DRAM devices, replacing fuses and reducing testing costs.

• The invention uses novel device structures that utilize existing circuit elements to build EPROM devices without complicating existing manufacture technologies.
	• For example, DRAM storage capacitors are used as the coupling capacitors to build floating gate EPROM devices.
	• Another example is to utilize transistor properties changed under stress conditions to support EPROM operations.

• The invention also introduces a new type of EPROM device called "stress effect programmable read only memory" (SEPROM) devices, which use the damages caused by electrical stresses on common transistors to store data.
	• SEPROM devices can be manufactured by any IC technologies and are ideal for embedded applications, with each data point memorized by one transistor.
	• SEPROM devices have advantages such as low cost, security, and flexibility, but may have disadvantages such as longer writing time and limited re-programming capability.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a method of determining feedback gain for use in feedback control systems, such as those used in automatic guidance vehicles (AGVs).
	*The method involves provisionally determining a feedback gain value, executing feedback control using the provisionally determined gain, detecting an error between a designated value and an actual value, calculating an evaluation value indicative of the character of feedback control, and repeating these steps to calculate a feedback gain value that provides a suitable evaluation value.
	*The evaluation value is calculated based on the error detected during the execution of the feedback control, and the feedback gain value is adjusted to minimize or optimize the evaluation value.
	*The method can be used to determine the optimum values of proportional, integral, and differential gains in a PID control system.

* The method can be applied to various types of feedback control systems, including those used in AGVs, and can be used to determine the optimum values of different types of feedback gains.
	*The method involves using evaluation functions to calculate the evaluation value, and the evaluation functions can be selected based on the type of feedback gain being determined.
	*The method can be used to determine the optimum values of feedback gains for different sections of a running course, and the optimum values can be stored in a memory device for use in controlling the AGV.
	*The method can be used in conjunction with other control methods, such as limit sensitivity processes, to determine the optimum values of feedback gains.

* The invention also relates to an AGV that uses the method of determining feedback gain to control its movement along a running course.
	*The AGV includes a central processor that executes the method of determining feedback gain, and a memory device that stores the optimum values of feedback gains for different sections of the running course.
	*The AGV also includes sensors and detectors that detect the error between the designated value and the actual value, and a control system that adjusts the feedback gain value based on the evaluation value.
	*The AGV can be used in various applications, such as manufacturing and logistics, where precise control of movement is required.

* The method of determining feedback gain can be implemented using various types of hardware and software, and can be used in conjunction with other control methods to achieve precise control of movement.
	*The method can be implemented using a computer system that includes a central processing unit, a memory device, and input/output devices.
	*The method can be used in conjunction with other control methods, such as fuzzy control and neural network control, to

<summary>
* The invention relates to zoom lenses with increased relative aperture and good optical performance over the entire zooming range, while minimizing physical size.
	* The zoom lens is designed for photographic cameras and video cameras, particularly for 2/3 in. and 1/2 in. image pickup tubes.

* The prior art has a demand for a zoom lens with a good compromise between increasing relative aperture and reducing bulk and size.
	* The prior art has a total length of the entire lens system in a range of 10φA to 12φA, which is comparatively long.

* The object of the present invention is to provide a zoom lens with a small F-number, high zoom ratio, and standard image angle at the wide angle end.
	* The zoom lens has a reduced size while preserving high-grade optical performance throughout the entire zooming range.

* The zoom lens of the invention comprises five lens units with specific powers and arrangements.
	* The lens units are designed to satisfy certain conditions to achieve good correction of aberrations.

* The conditions include inequalities for the refracting power of the rear surface of the first lens in the fourth lens unit.
	* The conditions also include inequalities for the refractive power ratio of the second lens in the fifth lens unit.

* The invention achieves a reduction of the physical length of the entire lens system while minimizing the variation with zooming of the aberrations.
	* The total length of the lens system is reduced to as short as L=9.13φA to 9.19φA.

* The invention provides four examples of specific zoom lenses with numerical data for the radii of curvature, axial thicknesses, and refractive indices.
	* The examples demonstrate the achievement of a large relative aperture, high range zoom lens of reduced size.

* The invention has achieved a great advance in reduction of the size of the zoom lens.
	* The invention is suited to photographic cameras or video cameras.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a method and device for detecting elementary particles, such as protons, ions, electrons, neutrons, photons, etc.
	*The method involves generating a charge pulse in a detector when a particle passes through, converting the charge pulse into an electric signal, and amplifying the signal.

* The device includes a detector, an amplification device, and optionally a display and/or recording device.
	*The amplification device includes a first, fast amplifier for amplifying individual signals and a second, slow amplifier for integrating signals.

* The method and device enable both the detection of individual particles and the integration of count rates, without knowing in advance the count or signal rates to be expected.
	*This is achieved by discharging the charge pulse or signal from the detector on the low-voltage side.

* The invention also proposes the use of a material enabling fast charge transport at room temperature, such as diamond, as the detector material.
	*This enables the detection of individual particles up to high count or signal rates at a high time resolution.

* The device can be used for detecting particles in various applications, including particle accelerators, reactor installations, and diagnostic devices such as X-ray devices and CT devices.
	*The device can also be used for measuring the intensity in particle accelerators and for detecting the actual formation of a particle beam.

* The invention also proposes the use of a converter material for detecting uncharged particles.
	*The converter material can be implanted into the detector material or coated on one of its surfaces.

* The device can be optimized for read-out performance by adapting the wave resistance of the detector to the input impedance of the preamplifier.
	*This enables the optimum adaptation to the input impedance of the preamplifier and to the wave resistance of the cable.

* The invention enables the detection of packets of particles, each comprising more than a single particle, and the summation of pulse heights to enable a statement as to the overall particle rate.
	*This is particularly useful in particle accelerators where packets of particles may comprise an extremely small distance.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to an apparatus for automatically spin checking driven disc assemblies used in friction clutches.
	• The apparatus includes a stationary ring and a movable ring that can be moved towards or away from each other.
	• The driven disc assembly is mounted on a splined hub and is frictionally engaged between the two rings.

• The apparatus uses a torque motor to exert a predetermined torque on the driven disc assembly.
	• The torque motor is connected to an optical encoder that measures the rotation of the output shaft.
	• The optical encoder generates an electrical signal that is representative of the direction and magnitude of rotation.

• The apparatus also includes a position sensor that measures the distance between the two rings.
	• The position sensor generates an electrical signal that is representative of the distance between the rings.
	• The signal is used to determine the amount of warpage in the driven disc assembly.

• The apparatus is controlled by a microprocessor that executes a program to perform the spin checking operation.
	• The microprocessor reads the signals from the optical encoder and position sensor.
	• The microprocessor uses the signals to determine whether the driven disc assembly is within specified tolerances.

• The apparatus can automatically determine whether the driven disc assembly is good or bad.
	• The apparatus generates an external indication to the operator of the test results.
	• The indication can be a visible alert on a display.

• The apparatus can store measurements for each assembly being tested.
	• The measurements can be used for statistical process control.
	• The apparatus can minimize the chances of operator error.

• The invention provides an improved apparatus for spin checking driven disc assemblies.
	• The apparatus operates automatically without manual involvement by an operator.
	• The apparatus generates an external indication of the test results.

• The apparatus includes a servo motor that moves the movable ring towards or away from the stationary ring.
	• The servo motor is connected to a ball screw shaft that rotates to move the ring.
	• The servo motor is controlled by the microprocessor.

• The apparatus includes a display that shows the test results.
	• The display can show a visible alert if the driven disc assembly is defective.
	• The display can show the measurements taken during the test.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to the field of image processing, specifically face age-estimation and methods, systems, and software therefor.
	* The invention aims to provide an accurate, efficient, uncooperative, and cost-effective solution to the problem of face age-estimation.

* The invention uses a contourlet appearance model (CAM) algorithm to extract feature vectors from face images.
	* The CAM algorithm is a combination of shape variation and texture variation, making it robust against noise and able to extract more robust facial features.

* The invention includes a method of face age-estimation training, which involves generating a database of second image data comprising faces with assigned landmark points.
	* The method uses a feature extraction algorithm, such as a CAM algorithm, to extract feature vectors from the face images.

* The invention also includes a method of face age-estimation, which involves extracting facial features from an image of a test subject.
	* The method uses a feature-space-to-age-space mapping unit to map the facial features to one of at least two differing age groups.

* The invention uses support vector regression (SVR) to construct two differently-calibrated aging functions, a growth and development mapping function and an adult aging mapping function.
	* The SVR is used to build a hyper-plane that is close to as many of the training points as possible.

* The invention uses support vector machines (SVMs) to build an age classifier that can distinguish between youths and adults.
	* The SVMs use a Gaussian kernel to generate the best classification rate among possible kernel functions.

* The invention includes a computing system that can implement the methods of the present disclosure.
	* The computing system includes a processor, a memory, a storage device, an input device, a network interface device, and a video display adapter.

* The invention can be used in various applications, such as automated control and surveillance systems, homeland security technologies, and management of e-documents and electronic customer relationships.
	* The invention can also be used to prevent children from viewing or consuming unacceptable media or programming.

* The invention can be used to estimate the age of a person represented in an image, and provide an estimated age or age indicator with a corresponding confidence factor.
	* The estimated age can be stored in a face age-estimation system using an appropriate computer storage system.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to a matrix display device for displaying two merged images, particularly suited for applications where the two images have different definitions.
	* The device comprises a matrix of pixels organized in a mosaic of identical arrangements of a predetermined number of pixels.
	* Each arrangement has a first plurality of pixels dedicated to the display of a first image and receiving light intensity signals associated with the pixels of the first image.
	* The remaining pixels of the arrangement are dedicated to the display of a second image and receive light intensity signals associated with the pixels of the second image.
	* The device produces the merged display of the first image and the second image, with the two images being redimensioned by scaling means if necessary.

* The invention proposes various embodiments of the matrix display device, including arrangements of four pixels with different configurations.
	* In one embodiment, three pixels of each arrangement are associated with the light intensity signals intended for the corresponding pixels of the first image.
	* In another embodiment, two pixels of each arrangement are associated with the light intensity signals intended for the corresponding pixels of the first image.
	* The pixels dedicated to the display of the first image can emit a first single color, while the pixels dedicated to the display of the second image can emit a second single color different from the first color.
	* The remaining pixels of the display device can be configured to display two colors which, by combination, make it possible to restore the color associated with the first pixel.

* The controller of the display device can be configured to apply an attenuation function to the light intensity signals of the first image.
	* The attenuation function can attenuate the quantified values of the light intensity signals to be applied to the pixels of the first image.
	* The attenuation function can be applied to the pixels of the first image for which the light intensity signal of the second image is greater than a predetermined threshold value.
	* The attenuation function can be defined by a relationship that takes into account the quantified values of the light intensity signals of the first image.
	* The parameters of the attenuation function can be defined and set by means of the controller according to the targeted applications.

* The display device can be based on a dedicated hardware architecture, offering an advantage in terms of lower consumption in operation.
	* The display device can comprise a matrix of pixels associated with two controllers.
	* Each controller can be interfaced with a subset of the pixels of the matrix.
	* The video streams generated by each controller can have different definitions and

<summary>
* The invention relates to a mobile identification transmitter for keyless activation of a security system of a motor vehicle, with an enlarged functionality and simple design, providing a comfortable mobile identification transmitter.
	*The transmitter has a housing with electronics and a communication means, and a payment element removably fastened in a receptacle of the housing, allowing for various payment actions.

* The payment element can be removed from the housing by the user, and the identification transmitter can be set in a normal state and in a secure state, with communication with the security system possible in both states.
	*In the secure state, the payment element is removed, and a closure protects and seals the receptacle, preventing unauthorized payment actions.

* The payment element can have a microprocessor, storage device, and communication means, allowing for remote financial transactions, and can be designed with a credit card function and/or debit card function.
	*The payment element can communicate with the payment system, and the communication means can work in a frequency range of approx. 13.56 MHz, with data transmission rates of more than 400 kBits per second.

* The identification transmitter can include an energy storage device to supply the electronics and/or payment element with current, and the closure can be designed as a dummy plug or a cap that pivots about an axis, providing a reliable seal for the receptacle.
	*The closure can also serve as an advertisement or information board, with information printed or applied to it.</summary>

<summary>
  * The disclosed embodiments address issues related to the tribo charge of toner in imaging devices, particularly when the device is inactive for a long period.
	*The tribo charge of toner may decrease during inactivity, affecting image quality.
	*The disclosed embodiments provide methods and apparatus for charging toner to a predetermined level based on the period of inactivity.
	*The methods and apparatus may include determining periods of inactivity, measuring the toner charge level, and charging the toner based on the difference between the measured charge and a predetermined level.
	*The disclosed embodiments may be implemented in software or hardware and can be used in various imaging devices, including printers, copiers, and fax machines.

  * The disclosed embodiments may include an inactivity determining section that determines the period of inactivity and a charging section that charges the toner to a predetermined level.
	*The inactivity determining section may include a user usage pattern determining section that determines the user's usage pattern.
	*The user usage pattern determining section may monitor the user's usage during the day and determine the usage pattern.
	*The usage pattern may be determined using an adaptive algorithm that detects long periods of inactivity and records the time and day of the week associated with these periods.

  * The disclosed embodiments may also include a predicting section that predicts the next user usage based on the determined usage pattern.
	*The predicting section may predict the time for the first usage of the day by taking an average of recorded times of daily first usage.
	*The disclosed embodiments may also include a measuring section that measures the toner concentration sensor (TC sensor) level.
	*The calculating section may calculate the decay of the tribo charge of the toner based on the difference between any two sensor levels of the TC sensor.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to a rotary magnetic head type apparatus that can control the recording and reproduction of signals by plural heads with high precision.
	• The apparatus uses a recording/regenerative integrated circuit with plural magneto resistive heads (MR heads) connected thereto.
	• The invention provides a simple structure for independent and precise regulation of bias currents supplied to plural MR heads mounted on a rotary drum.

• The apparatus includes a control signal generator, a decoder circuit, and a current supply circuit.
	• The control signal generator generates control signals for controlling the operating amperages of MR heads.
	• The decoder circuit discriminates data of the control signals and controls the current supply circuit.

• The current supply circuit supplies operating currents to the MR heads in response to the output signals of the decoder circuit.
	• The control signals are transmitted over a single channel of a rotary transformer.
	• The control signals may include control information regarding a regenerative amplifier and recording current setting.

• The apparatus can switch over among plural heads with high precision.
	• The apparatus includes a recording/reproducing unit, a generating unit, and a transmitting unit.
	• Data for controlling the switching over among the plurality of heads are transmitted with priority over other control data.

• The invention can be applied to various types of apparatuses, including disk apparatuses and apparatuses that transmit frequency-modulated analog signals.
	• The invention can be applied to apparatuses provided with MR heads or other types of heads.
	• The invention can be applied to apparatuses that use integrated circuits or do not use integrated circuits.

• The apparatus can control the decoder and the regenerative integrated circuit via a single control line.
	• The apparatus can use a rotary transformer or other types of transformers.
	• The apparatus can use a slip ring or other types of contacts.

• The invention provides a simple structure for independent and precise regulation of bias currents supplied to plural MR heads mounted on a rotary drum.
	• The invention can be applied to various types of apparatuses.
	• The invention can provide stable data recording and reproduction.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention is concerned with locating and tracing concealed elongated conductive objects, such as pipes or cables, and improving the locating and tracing of a first object when a second object is adjacent to the first.
	• This is achieved by using a transmitter with a pair of antennae to induce distinguishable alternating currents in the objects, and a receiver to sense the magnetic fields associated with the currents.

• The prior art uses a passive technique with a gradiometer or magnetic locator to detect ferrous metal objects, and an active technique with a transmitter and receiver to detect non-ferrous metal pipes and cables.
	• However, the prior art has limitations when trying to locate and trace a cable in the presence of an adjacent cable.

• The invention uses a transmitter with a pair of antennae to generate magnetic fields that induce distinguishable currents in the cables.
	• The antennae are preferably spaced a few feet apart and are driven by RF signals.

• The transmitting apparatus is optimally positioned relative to the cables, with the antennae on either side of the cables.
	• This positioning allows for the production of two distinct output signal nulls over the respective cables.

• The receiver senses the magnetic fields associated with the currents in the cables and produces an output signal dependent upon the sensing of both fields.
	• The output signal characteristics may be shifted upwardly or downwardly with respect to a base line by adjustment of a receiver deadband control.

• The invention uses various techniques to make the currents distinguishable from one another, including different carrier frequencies, amplitude modulation, and pulsing at different repetition rates.
	• These techniques allow for the production of a beat frequency signal that is dependent upon the presence of both currents.

• The invention is especially useful in environments where the horizontal separation between the cables is related to the depth of the cable to be located and traced.
	• The effect achieved by the invention is enhanced by the fact that the field from the transmitter decreases by the inverse cube of the distance between an antennae and a cable.

• The receiver may be optimized by adjustment of a threshold sensitivity control to enhance the desired performance.
	• This allows for the receiver to detect the beat frequency signal and produce an output signal that is dependent upon the presence of both currents.

• The invention may be modified to use only one antennae for cable locating and tracing when only a single cable is present.
	• This allows for the transmitter to be designed to be more versatile and adaptable to different situations.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to an apparatus for interfacing a speaker phone with a telephone network to permit hands-free automatic answering and communication.
	• The apparatus includes a source of power, selective switch means, a coupler, a timer, and a bypass switch to control the length of time of the interconnection.

• The invention provides a device that can be used on or in connection with a private telephone line or switchboard extension with a telephone speaker phone.
	• The device is particularly advantageous for the physically handicapped or for an outpatient during a period of convalescence to respond to an inquiry from trained hospital personnel.

• The apparatus includes an optically coupled circuit for coupling the telephone ringing circuit in a manner which discharges a charging capacitor to a predetermined signal level.
	• The optocoupler includes a blocking capacitor at the input thereof for blocking DC components of the ringing signal from the optocoupler to permit cycling of the discharge of the charging capacitor.

• The invention also includes an alternative embodiment using electromechanical techniques, which uses a neon lamp optically coupled with a photocell to latch contacts and couple the speaker phone to the telephone line.
	• The electromechanical embodiment also includes a timing and extension feature, allowing the user to extend the conversation indefinitely by placing the switch in the extend position.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to the field of optical fiber communications, specifically to system network design and incorporation of branch powered amplification within such networks.
	• The invention aims to develop more reliable undersea lightwave systems that provide multipoint-to-multipoint connectivity.
	• A key feature of the invention is the use of a trunk and branch structure with a ring geometry to enhance network survivability.
	• The invention replaces traditional undersea optical repeaters with remotely pumped optical amplifiers and remotely supplies energy to those optical amplifiers over the same branch cables that distribute communications signals.
	• The system utilizes the branch fiber optic cable to transmit optical energy at a wavelength other than that of the signal wavelength, which is used as a power source for an optical amplifier.
	• The invention has several advantages, including maintaining full connectivity along the trunk and to all cable stations via their respective branch fiber optic cables, and reducing the capital costs as well as the operating and maintenance costs of communications networks.

• The system consists of a hub assembly with remote pumping, a hub assembly without remote pumping, and branch assemblies, all serially coupled by an optical fiber cable trunk and configured in a ring topology.
	• The hub assembly with remote pumping includes a hub, a light emitting power source, and an optical amplifier.
	• The hub assembly without remote pumping includes only a hub.
	• The branch assemblies are convenient add/drop locations for telecommunications signals along the optical fiber cable trunk.
	• The branch assemblies include a cable station, a light emitting power source, and an optical amplifier.

• The light emitting power source is a multiple order cascaded Raman laser, producing an output light source with a wavelength in the range of 1450-1500 nanometers.
	• The light source is coupled onto the optical fiber cable trunk, either through the hub or directly onto the trunk.
	• The wavelength of the light source must be distinct from the band of signal wavelengths contemplated for transmission along the optical fiber cable trunk.
	• The light source is used as an energy source for the optical amplifier.

• The optical amplifier is an erbium doped fiber amplifier, which is spliced or coupled with the optical fiber cable trunk.
	• The optical amplifier is used to amplify attenuated telecommunications signals.
	• The amplifier is located serially downstream the optical fiber cable trunk, and remotely located from the coupled hub and light emitting power source.
	• The exact location of the optical amplifier is determined by the network designer.

• The branch fiber optic

<summary>
  * The invention is directed to the field of installing wiring devices to ganged boxes mounted in building walls and more particularly to the provision of cover plate devices which can be used to cover such wiring devices to prevent unwanted access to such wiring devices and at the same time provide a finished look without exposed fasteners.
	*The invention provides a cover plate device that is quickly and easily installed using simple tools and available fasteners and which can be quickly and easily removed and can be fit upon walls that are not flat and even.
	*The invention is a two part device, the first an attachment member which is installed over a wiring device and mounted to such wiring device, and the second part is a cover plate member which has no fastener holes extending through it and only has apertures to receive the wiring device projections as needed.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to a collapsible light-shielding device for a screen, intended for use with television sets, monitors, etc.
	* The device aims to improve upon existing shielding devices by providing a more compact, reliable, and easily attachable solution.

* The known shielding device disclosed in U.S. Pat. No. 4,444,465 has several disadvantages, including the need for a special fastening device, bulkiness, and limited viewing angles.
	* These disadvantages affect the outward appearance of the housing and the user's viewing experience.

* The object of the invention is to provide an improved extendable shielding device that addresses the issues of the known device.
	* The device consists of annular strips concentrically nested and essentially enclosing one another in a tight manner.

* The light-shielding device according to the invention can be folded around the displaying screen, allowing it to be of very small size and taking up relatively little space.
	* The device can be easily fitted to a screen using Velcro or other attachment means.

* The strips of the light-shielding device have a decreasing wall thickness, viewed in the axial direction, allowing the device to be set to various angular positions relative to the screen.
	* This feature enables the displaying screen to be viewed from different angles without hindrance.

* The invention provides an adapter member that provides a flat attachment face for the light-shielding device, allowing it to be fixed to virtually any type of monitor.
	* The adapter member can compensate for convex shapes on the front of the monitor and provide a secure attachment.

* The strips of the light-shielding device can be produced by injection-moulding or by bending plate material, and may be provided with integrated hook or locking elements.
	* The use of different materials and manufacturing methods allows for flexibility in the design and production of the device.
</summary>

<summary>
  *The present invention relates to automated speech technologies and provides a solution to automatically inform a speaker to decrease their speaking rate when it exceeds a rate that a listener can understand.
    *The solution can be implemented in various aspects, including a method for automatically notifying a speaker to decrease their speaking rate, a device for facilitating understanding between discourse participants, and a program for controlling computing equipment to implement the functions described.
     *The method can include steps such as determining a speaking rate threshold for a listener, automatically determining a speaking rate of a speaker, and notifying the speaker to decrease their speaking rate when it exceeds the threshold.
     *The device can include components such as a microphone, a sensory mechanism, a speaking rate processor, and a comprehension comparator, which work together to detect the speaking rate and notify the speaker to slow down.
 
  *The invention can be applied in various scenarios, including face-to-face conversations, telephone conversations, and Web-based interactions, and can take into account factors such as language proficiency, speech clarity, and network quality.
    *The solution can be implemented in a wearable device, a teleprompter, or a portable device worn by the listener, and can utilize various technologies such as speech analysis, video analysis, and RFID tags to identify the listener and determine their language proficiency.
     *The invention can also be realized in hardware, software, or a combination of both, and can be embedded in a computer program product that enables the implementation of the methods described.
     *The solution can be used to improve comprehension in various situations, including conversations between native and non-native speakers, and can provide a more effective way of communicating in multilingual environments.</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a device for the optical recording of rapid processes with a TV camera, which comprises means for deviating and suppressing the beam.
	• The device allows for a higher picture sequence frequency with simple means and in a very flexible way.
	• It is suitable for laboratory and industrial processes that require the optical recording of rapidly changing phenomena.

• The device comprises a cyclic line counter, a sawtooth generator, and a beam suppression circuit.
	• The cyclic line counter carries out one counting step for each line pulse and supplies an end-of-count pulse after p line pulses.
	• The sawtooth generator is synchronized with the output pulses of the counter and controls the vertical deviation of the beam.

• The device can be used to record pictures with a high and selectable resolution in time.
	• The spatial resolution of the picture may suffer in the vertical direction, but the resolution in the line direction remains high.
	• The pictures can be projected on the picture plane of the camera in such a way that the axis in which a high resolution is required runs parallel to the line direction.

• The video signals can be digitized and stored in a data processing device for purposes of analysis.
	• The jumped-over lines can be completed by a repetition of the information in the preceding lines or by an interpolation between successive lines.
	• The device is also suited for recording IR, UV or X-ray pictures.

• The device can be adjusted to determine the optimal time resolution with the best possible spatial resolution.
	• The counting capacity of the counter can be switched to a greater value of p, such as 12, 13, 24, 26, 39, 52, 78.
	• The picture scanning can be provided in different times, such as 0.77 ms, 9.83 ms, 1.53 ms, 2.66 ms, 3.33 ms, or 5 ms.

• The device can be used for automatic digital picture evaluation.
	• The scanning cycles can be used to fill up the gaps between the lines of a picture.
	• The grade of actuality of the scanning cycles can be taken into account during the analysis of the observed process.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to multimedia communications, particularly handling multimedia calls with clients having legacy phones and services.
	• The invention integrates voice calls with multimedia sessions as a blended call.
	• A blended call is a call that blends voice and multimedia functions into a single communication session.
	• The invention uses a multimedia server associated with a telephony server to manage blended calls.

• The multimedia server has software that manages blended calls, using the functions of the multimedia server where appropriate and the telephony server where appropriate.
	• The software is sometimes referred to as a blender.
	• The blender may be a function of sequential logic devices or other hardware that performs the same functions.
	• The blender initiates two parallel components for the call: a voice component and a multimedia component.

• The invention takes an incoming call from a remote caller and accesses a database to determine if the intended recipient of the phone call has blended capabilities.
	• If the answer is negative, the call is handled according to conventional protocols.
	• If the answer is affirmative, the intended recipient supports blended calling, then the telephony server directs the call to a multimedia server.
	• The multimedia server has blender software associated therewith.

• The blender software receives the call request and initiates a single session with two call components: a voice call component and a multimedia call component.
	• The voice call component is handled through the telephony server.
	• The multimedia call component is handled through the multimedia server.
	• The blender software may integrate the signaling paths into a single signal path as part of the single session.

• The invention is well suited for use with a Session Initiation Protocol for Telephones (SIP-T) configuration.
