	• The SIP-T messages contain the information helpful in setting up and tearing down the parallel call components.
	• The invention may be used on any number of network systems using a number of different protocols.
	• An exhaustive list of suitable networks and protocols is beyond the scope of the present discussion.

• The communication environment includes a communication network, which may preferably include a packet switched network with SIP enabled devices.
	• The network may include any type of packet switched network having devices using SIP to facilitate communications between two or more devices.
	• The communication environment includes two clients connected to the communication network.
	• Each client may have customer premises equipment (CPE) associated therewith.

• The CPE may include a telephone type device and a computer type device.
	• The telephone type devices are directed to voice

<summary>
* The present invention relates to electronic service delivery and content synchronization frameworks using dynamic attributes and file bundles for connected devices.
	* The framework allows any connected device or appliance to perform contextual synchronization over a wide variety of communication network topologies.

* The present systems and methods make use of transport optimization such as data compression to save bandwidth and time over low bandwidth connections.
	* Data compression reduces the size of data files transmitted, allowing faster communication between the central reference point and client device.

* The present synchronization framework provides a central reference point, such as a server or group of servers, and each communicating device synchronizes to the content determined by this central reference point.
	* The central reference point is preferably hosted by a server in accordance with the present systems and methods.

* The present invention is highly scalable, preferably due to the client device performing a major portion of processing.
	* The client device creates and maintains a delta list of bundle files, embodying differences between the client's local copy of a file or data and the central reference point indicated file or data.

* The present systems and methods preferably employ file compression and concurrent priority-based downloading to further optimize the present synchronization algorithm and to optimize communication bandwidth usage.
	* The client device retrieves files in the ordered delta list from various servers indicated in the bundles, such as the central reference point, download servers, and external partners.

* The present content synchronization frameworks preferably provide for creation of a delta list of bundle files, which is performed by the client device.
	* The client device composes a delta list of all the files in the bundle that are different from local copies available to the client device.

* The present systems and methods preferably support both synchronous and asynchronous interaction between the central reference point and connected devices or appliances.
	* The client device can continue synchronization where it left off during the previous, failed or disrupted session.

* The present invention enables a client device to have the latest and most relevant content at all times, based on a user's and/or device's context.
	* The context is preferably expressed by the device to the central reference point as dynamic attributes that are subject to change during later synchronizations.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to methods and systems for allowing a person to communicate with the owner of a valuable or other object.
	* The invention provides a timely and anonymous communication channel between a finder of an object and an owner of an object.
	* The system includes a virtual locale, a database for storing an association between owner contact information and a unique ID, and a module for forwarding finder communications to the owner.

* The owner is provided with specially prepared tags that include a unique identifying feature such as an ID and a reference to a specific website or other unique virtual locale.
	* The owner registers the tag IDs and their contact information on a centralized and network accessible database.
	* The owner can then associate the ID and a virtual locale with the article.

* A finder who has found an object with an attached tag can access the website or virtual locale and select the finder option.
	* The finder can then enter the ID number of the found object and search for the owner's contact information.
	* The finder can choose to send a quick one-way anonymous message to the owner or open up a new case and communicate using anonymous email addresses.

* The system generates anonymous email addresses for the owner and the finder, which are used to facilitate communication between the two parties.
	* The system checks the "To" email address to determine whether it is addressed with an anonymized email address.
	* If the email address is valid, the system swaps the "To" anonymous email address with the real email address and forwards the email to the new "To" email address.

* The system also handles incoming messages from multiple messaging protocols such as AOL, Yahoo, and MSN Text Messaging.
	* The system checks the first word of the message to see if it is a valid ID.
	* If the ID is valid, the system checks the messaging screenname that sent the message against all forms of messaging names and protocols associated with the owner.

* If the message originated from an owner of an ID, the system looks in the alert database for the record created by the sender of the original message.
	* If a record is found, the system pulls the screenname and protocol from the record and creates a new message.
	* The new message is then sent to the screenname and platform from the record in the alert database.

* The system can be implemented in a programming language such as Perl in conjunction with the Apache open source web server software and the MySQL open source relational database.
	* The system can also use open

<summary>

* The invention relates to electron multipliers used in photomultipliers and particle detectors.
	* Electron multipliers are used to amplify weak signals in various applications.
	* The invention aims to improve the gain and efficiency of electron multipliers.
	* The invention uses a sequential series of thin foils in an evacuated enclosure.

* The foil electron multiplier has several advantages over conventional electron multipliers.
	* Higher gain per multiplication stage.
	* Simplicity of fabrication.
	* Lower cost of fabrication.
	* Ability to cover a larger area.

* The foil electron multiplier uses a series of thin foils in an evacuated enclosure.
	* Each foil is held by a foil holder in the enclosure.
	* A voltage is applied to each foil to accelerate electrons.
	* The electrons are transmitted through the foils and collected on an anode.

* The gain of the foil electron multiplier is maximized by optimizing several parameters.
	* Electron transmission through the foil.
	* Transmission through the support grid.
	* Secondary electron emission yield.

* The foil electron multiplier has a higher gain efficiency than conventional electron multipliers.
	* The gain per stage is higher.
	* Fewer stages are required to achieve the same gain.
	* The invention has a higher gain advantage.

* The foil electron multiplier does not experience ion feedback.
	* Ions generated at the input surface of a stage are accelerated toward the previous stage.
	* The ions cannot penetrate the foil and initiate another avalanche.
	* The avalanche is generally indistinguishable in time from the initial avalanche.

* The foil electron multiplier can be used in various applications.
	* Photomultiplier tubes.
	* Particle detectors.
	* Electron spectrometers.
	* Mass spectrometers.

* The foil electron multiplier has a simple design.
	* A series of thin foils in an evacuated enclosure.
	* A voltage is applied to each foil.
	* The electrons are transmitted through the foils and collected on an anode.

* The foil electron multiplier has been demonstrated experimentally.
	* A 2.7-mm-diameter 50 keV O+ ion beam was directed into the input end of the multiplier.
	* The output current was measured as a function of the applied voltage.
	* The results showed a higher gain efficiency than conventional electron multipliers.

</summary>

<summary>
* The 3-D Phenomenoscope invention relates to the field of motion pictures and allows almost any motion picture to be viewed effortlessly by the viewer with the visual effect of 3-dimensions.
	* The invention uses the Pulfrich effect, which creates a 3-dimensional illusion when lateral motion is detected in a motion picture.
	* The Pulfrich effect is achieved by darkening one lens of the viewing glasses, causing a delay in the image registration by the brain, and creating a disparity between the two images that is perceived as depth information.
	* The 3-D Phenomenoscope uses a computer algorithm to detect lateral motion in the motion picture and control the darkening of the lenses.
	* The algorithm uses an intensity edge finding algorithm to identify vertical edges in the foreground of the motion picture and detect movement.
	* The algorithm can detect left-to-right or right-to-left lateral motion and adjust the lenses accordingly.
	* The 3-D Phenomenoscope can be used with any type of motion picture, including those shot on regular or digital film, and can be viewed on a TV, DVD player, PC, or in a movie house.
	* The invention overcomes problems associated with 3-dimensional motion pictures, such as the need for special equipment and the potential for eyestrain and discomfort.
	* The 3-D Phenomenoscope is a self-contained unit that does not require any external connections or control signals, making it a convenient and portable solution for viewing 3-dimensional motion pictures.
</summary>

<summary>
  • The present invention relates to the dicing of semiconductor devices, specifically an apparatus and method for dicing semiconductor wafers using pressure to mechanically separate individual die from the wafer.
	• The invention addresses problems associated with traditional wafer saws, such as slow processing time, maintenance issues, and chipping of thin wafers.
	• The method and apparatus disclosed provide a solution for efficient and effective wafer singulation without the use of a wafer saw.

  • The method involves forming trenches along scribe lines on a semiconductor wafer and applying mechanical pressure to separate individual die.
	• The trenches are formed by etching the wafer, and the depth of the trenches can vary depending on the wafer thickness and desired outcome.
	• An adhesive tape is applied to the back surface of the wafer to facilitate the singulation process.
	• The wafer is then placed on a soft pad, and mechanical pressure is applied to cause the wafer to break along the trenches.

  • The apparatus comprises a pad for supporting the semiconductor wafer, a positioning member to position the wafer on the pad, and a pressure mechanism to apply mechanical pressure to the wafer.
	• The pressure mechanism can include a roller, blade, or squeegee to apply pressure in the X, Y, or circular direction.
	• A ring can be used to hold the wafer in place during singulation, and the pressure can be applied in various directions to cause the wafer to break along the scribe lines.
	• The invention can be used with wafers of various sizes and types of die, and the trenches can be formed using alternative methods, such as partial cutting with a wafer saw.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to a field emission display device having a protection structure that prevents burn-out damage to field emission elements.
	* The protection structure includes at least one reduction plate or electrode that deflects the discharge path of ionized gases away from the cathode.
	* The reduction plate or electrode is typically provided on the cathode and is electrically connected to a bias voltage source that applies a negative voltage thereto.
* The field emission display device includes a cathode, an anode, and multiple field emission elements that emit high-energy electrons toward the anode.
	* The device also includes an operating voltage source that establishes an electric field between the cathode and the anode.
	* The protection structure prevents surges in electrical current from being drawn to the cathode, thereby preventing damage to the field emission elements.
* The reduction plates or electrodes can be fabricated in various shapes and configurations, including elongated and parallel structures, as well as meshwork- or net-shaped configurations.
	* The reduction plates or electrodes can be formed on the cathode plate using photolithography techniques and etching methods.
	* The manufacturing process involves depositing metal layers, patterning masks, and etching the metal layers to form the reduction plates or electrodes.
* The protection structure can be applied to various types of field emission display devices, including those using microtips and nanotube emitters.
	* The protection structure can be used to prolong the lifetime of field emission elements and prevent current-induced damage.
	* The protection structure can be designed to be compatible with various device configurations and operating conditions.
* The present invention provides a novel solution for preventing burn-out damage to field emission elements in field emission display devices.
	* The protection structure is simple and effective, and can be easily integrated into existing device designs.
	* The invention has significant implications for the development of reliable and long-lasting field emission display devices.</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to an image sensor that includes multiple imaging planes, overcoming the limitations of prior art image sensors that can only image in a single plane.
	* The image sensor comprises a semiconductor substrate of a first conductivity type with opposed major surfaces and opposed edges between the surfaces.
	* One of the edges has a surface receptive to light, and an image sensor element is formed in the substrate adjacent to the one edge.
	* The image sensor element includes a charge collection and transfer means and an image sensing region in which charge carriers are generated by light impinging on the surface of the one edge.
		* The charge collection and transfer means is a buried-channel CCD, and the image sensing region is a photodiode.
		* The image sensor also includes means in the substrate for guiding charge carriers in the image sensing region toward the charge collection and transfer means.
* The image sensor can be used to image in a plurality of planes, allowing for simultaneous imaging of two opposing surfaces or surface imaging of passageways.
	* The image sensor can be formed using processing techniques compatible with techniques used in forming other types of image sensors.
	* The invention can be easily incorporated into various types of known image sensors.
* A principal advantage of the present invention is that it can be used in many image formats, such as formats involving the simultaneous imaging of two opposing surfaces.
	* The image sensor can also be used for color applications, where a red filter is placed over the image sensor elements in one imaging plane, a green filter covers the elements in a second imaging plane, and a blue filter covers the elements in a third imaging plane.
* The image sensor includes a P-type substrate with a highly doped bottom layer and an upper layer that is more lightly doped with a P-type material.
	* The substrate comprises three columns of image sensor elements, each including an image sensing region and a charge collection and transfer means.
	* The image sensor elements are arranged in rows and columns along the length of the image sensor.
* The image sensor has a first imaging plane on one edge, a second imaging plane on the top surface, and a third imaging plane on the other edge.
	* Photons impinging on the imaging planes generate charge carriers in the image sensing regions, which are guided toward the CCDs by the P+ layers.
	* The charge carriers are transferred to the CCDs by means of voltages supplied to the transfer gates.
* A second embodiment of the present invention includes an image sensor with

<summary>
• The present invention relates to networks, specifically home networks employing devices with power management systems.
	• The invention aims to minimize total power consumption while ensuring optimal network administration.
	• It addresses the need for a network master node to perform administrative functions while in a power management state.

• The invention provides methods for transferring network administrative functions from a master device to a slave device.
	• This transfer enables the master device to enter a power management state while ensuring continued network administration.
	• The transfer process involves sending data from the master device to the slave device, enabling the slave device to perform administrative functions.

• The network master node performs network administrative functions, such as beacon transmission, device association, and bandwidth assignment.
	• The master node also manages traffic on the network and assigns bandwidth to slave nodes as needed.
	• The master node can be instructed to enter a power management state, triggering the transfer of administrative functions.

• The transfer process involves the master node sending a transfer request to slave nodes, which respond with their ability to assume administrative functions.
	• The master node selects a slave node based on predetermined criteria, such as visibility or intelligence/functional capabilities.
	• The selected slave node receives the transferred administrative functions and becomes the new master node.

• The invention ensures that the network is not lost when the master node enters a power management state.
	• It also ensures that the administrative functions are performed by the most qualified available slave node.
	• This approach minimizes total power consumption while maintaining optimal network administration.

• The invention can be applied to various types of networks, including powerline networks, wired or wireless networks, and local area networks.
	• It can also be applied to different types of devices, including video servers, audio servers, and video systems.
	• The invention is not limited to specific network topologies or device configurations.

• The transfer process can be completed within a few tens of milliseconds, ensuring minimal disruption to network operations.
	• The invention also allows for self-promotion of a slave node to the master node role if the current master node is unavailable.
	• This ensures continued network operation even in the event of a master node failure.

• The invention provides a means for transferring network administrative functions while a slave node is performing its nominal device functions.
	• It also allows for intermittent transfer of administrative functions with the slave node's performance of its nominal device functions.
	• The invention enables the transfer of administrative functions after the slave node has performed its nominal device functions.

• The invention has various

<summary>
• The invention relates to arrangements of antenna elements to measure the direction of propagation of electromagnetic radiation.
	• The invention aims to overcome the ambiguity in angle measurements using a single equi-spaced triplet arrangement of similar antenna elements.
	• The invention extends the ideas of UK Patent No. 1449196 to optimize angle measurements using the triplet itself.

• The prior art of UK 1449196 describes the use of a triplet to define fixed angles in the elevation plane, within which angle measurements were made by other means.
	• The prior art shows that the quotient of (A+C) and B is independent of the unknown ground reflection coefficient.
	• The quotient of other functions of (A+C) and B, for example the square or the modulus, is also independent of the unknown ground reflection coefficient.

• The invention uses at least four antennae spaced to provide at least two equi-spaced linear triplets perpendicular to a ground plane.
	• Each triplet is characterized by the spacing of its elements and the height of the centre element above the ground plane.
	• Radio receiver means obtain from each antenna of each triplet an information signal of which both amplitude and phase relative to the amplitude and phase of information signals obtained from other antennae of each triplet are functions of the elevation angles θ of incidence upon the array of a radio wave arriving from a remote source and of the ground reflection coefficient p.

• The invention uses first logic means to combine vectorially the information signals obtained from the outermost antennae of each triplet.
	• Second logic means derive from an information signal obtained from the centre antenna of each triplet a second derived signal of which the amplitude represents the modulus of that information signal from the said centre antenna.
	• Dividing means divide one derived signal by the other to provide a quotient signal for each triplet which is a function of θ but not of p.

• The array may operate in a receive mode or in a transmit mode.
	• In the transmit mode, the transmitted signal from each antenna in the array must be coded so that it can be identified to enable a quotient representing angle to be derived for each triplet in a remote receiver.
	• A common coherent carrier is required for the transmissions from each element of any triplet to achieve the interferometric performance.

• FIG. 3 shows a practical embodiment of an antenna arranged as three triplets.
	• The design aims to provide unambiguous angle measurements up to about 7 degrees.
	• The design aims to provide measurement accuracy and resolution of the order +/-

<summary>
• The present invention relates to high intensity, thermal, efficient incandescent lamps, subminiature lamps, lamp assemblies, and a lamp system and method of making an efficient high intensity bulb and sleeve system having a liquid tight seal.
	• The invention aims to combat the degradation of conventional subminiature lamps due to thermal cycling, adhesive breakdown, and liquid invasion.
	• The invention utilizes a high temperature polymer to directly surround and be in compression contact with the glass envelope.

• The polymer may derive support from a metal base and is somewhat rigid/molded, allowing for manual handling and manipulation of the subminiature lamp.
	• A fluoroelastomer is a preferable type of elastomer due to its chemically resistive properties and ability to withstand high temperatures.
	• The elastomer used for the seal supported lamp assembly provides extended axial length sealing, heat resistance, ease of handling, and increased resistance to invasion and chemical attack.

• The polymeric seal support forms a housing around both the glass envelope and the abbreviated height one piece conductive base, encapsulating the glass envelope and making a liquid tight seal.
	• The material used for the polymeric seal support should be non-thermally conducting and able to withstand significant subminiature lamp temperatures.
	• The polymeric seal support may be chosen based on the maximum working temperature of the elastomer, with fluorocarbon and silicone being suitable options.

• The polymeric seal support makes a static radial seal with the straight sidewall of the subminiature lamp glass envelope surface, with a seal length much longer than conventional "o" ring type seals.
	• The seal length of the polymeric seal support is approximately 13 times longer than conventional "o" ring seals.
	• The polymeric seal support eliminates the need for adhesives or cements, allowing for closer tolerance centering of the subminiature lamp glass envelope.

• The polymeric seal support has the inherit quality to allow much closer tolerance centering of the subminiature lamp glass envelope to the axis of the abbreviated height one piece conductive base.
	• The stretch ratio of the polymeric seal support is sufficient to hold the subminiature lamp in place.
	• The polymeric seal support eliminates the need for "o" rings, dead spaces, and passageways that can collect debris.

• The current objective is to fabricate a lamp, and in particular a medical subminiature lamp, as a seal supported lamp assembly having a liquid tight seal.

<summary>
• The present invention relates to multiple-input multiple-output (MIMO) communications systems, specifically to precoder configuration in MIMO systems.
	• The invention aims to optimize system capacity or bit error rate in multi-user MIMO systems.
	• A technique is used to realize a GDFE Precoder for multi-user MIMO systems, significantly reducing computational cost without capacity loss.
		• The technique is suitable for improving the performance of various MU-MIMO wireless systems, including 4G cellular networks.
		• The described implementation of a GDFE Precoder relaxes the requirement for knowledge of the covariance matrix (Szz) corresponding to "Least Favorable Noise."
• The invention provides a uniform framework for realizing a GDFE Precoder, which does not require channel reduction when the Input Covariance Matrix (Sxx) for downlink channel is rank deficient.
	• The described implementation of a GDFE Precoder achieves significant improvement in computational cost over conventional GDFE Precoders.
• The invention includes a method for configuring a GDFE based precoder in a base station of a multi-user MIMO wireless system.
	• The method involves computing a filter matrix C using alternative formulas and computing a transmit filter matrix B, feedforward filter matrix F, and interference pre-cancellation matrix G.
• The invention also includes a GDFE based precoder in a base station of a MU-MIMO wireless system.
	• The GDFE precoder comprises a feedforward path, a feedback path, and an interference pre-cancellation block denoted by I-G.
• The interference pre-cancellation matrix G in the interference pre-cancellation block is determined by computing a filter matrix C and other dependent matrices.
	• The computation of GDFE precoder matrices is performed using different methods, including one that assumes knowledge of Szz and others that avoid using Szz.
• The invention provides numerical examples to illustrate the computation of various matrices involved in the design of a GDFE Precoder.
	• The examples demonstrate the computation of matrices B, G, and F for different scenarios, including when Szz is known and unknown.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a heat-dissipating device and a housing thereof, particularly to an axial fan with increased intake airflow rate without modifying assembling conditions.
	• The conventional fan has a rectangular fan housing with a reduced air passage at the lateral side, restricting the design of the blade and wasting space and material.
	• The invention aims to provide a heat-dissipating fan and housing with an increased intake airflow area without changing the assembling conditions.

• The invention includes a housing with an outer frame having a passage for guiding air streams, where an sidewall of the passage extends radially outwards to enlarge the intake or discharge area.
	• The sidewall extends radially outwardly with respect to a central axis of the passage in a symmetrical manner.
	• The sidewall may be formed with an inclined portion or a beveled edge.

• The housing includes an air inlet, an air outlet, and a passage for guiding air streams, where the sidewall at the air inlet side extends radially outwardly to enlarge the intake area.
	• The sidewall at the air inlet side extends radially outwardly with respect to a central axis of the passage in a symmetrical manner.
	• The sidewall may be formed with an inclined portion extending from the air inlet to the air outlet.

• The heat-dissipating device includes an impeller and a housing, where the housing includes a passage for guiding air streams, and the sidewall of the passage at least one of the opening sides extends radially outwards.
	• The dimension of the blade of the impeller increases along with the radially outwardly extending direction of the sidewall of the passage.
	• The airflow rate may be increased and the heat-dissipating efficiency may be enhanced.

• The heat-dissipating system includes a casing, at least one electrical element, and a heat-dissipating device mounted on the casing for dissipating heat.
	• The heat-dissipating device includes an impeller and a housing, where the housing includes a passage for guiding air streams.
	• The sidewall of the passage at one of the openings extends radially outwardly with respect to a rotational axis of the heat-dissipating device.

• The invention may be used with a heat sink, which may be mounted to the heat-dissipating device by screws.
	• The assembly may be mounted to a central processing unit (CPU).

<summary>
* The present invention relates to an electroluminescent display panel that can display images in different colors according to the situation.
	* The display panel is composed of various layers laminated on a glass substrate, including a first electrode layer, a first insulation layer, a first luminescent layer, a second luminescent layer, a second insulation layer, and a second electrode layer.
	* The first luminescent layer is made of a material that emits light including no visible red light components, and the second luminescent layer is made of a material that emits light including visible red light components.
	* The display panel can display different colors simply by changing the voltage level, and it can be made in a simple structure and at a low cost.
	* The display panel is suitable for use as an instrument panel for an automobile, which can display images in different colors in day time and in night time.

* The first embodiment of the present invention includes a first luminescent layer made of TbOF-added ZnS and a second luminescent layer made of Mn-added ZnS.
	* The first luminescent layer has a thickness of 600 nm, and the second luminescent layer has a thickness of 400 nm.
	* The display panel is driven by a driving voltage at the vicinity of point c in night time, and at the vicinity of point d in day time.
	* The display panel can display images in green which is tender to driver's eyes in night time, while images are displayed in a lemon color having a high luminance to cope with sun light in day time.
	* The color purity can be changed by selecting the width of the second luminescent layer.

* The second embodiment of the present invention includes a double layer portion made in a square shape, which is orthomorphic to the shape of the picture element.
	* The display will be more comfortable to a viewer, because both of the picture element and the double layer portion are orthomorphic.
	* The double layer portion is made of the same material as the first embodiment.
	* The display panel can display images in different colors simply by changing the voltage level.
	* The display panel is suitable for use as an instrument panel for an automobile.

* The third embodiment of the present invention includes a red color filter additionally disposed on the second electrodes.
	* Red light is emitted through the red color filter, though the double layer portion emits lemon color light.

<summary>
  • The invention relates to an electronic portable communications terminal for Internet/network telephony, which uses a network and/or the Internet for transferring information/data representing digitized speech, sounds, music, etc.
	• The terminal comprises audio means, converting means, protocol means, and wireless communications means for wireless near field communication of received and/or transmission data in a wireless data format with a connecting unit adapted to establish a connection to a network and/or the Internet according to a standardized Internet/network protocol.
	• The terminal can independently control and communicate data packets according to a standardized Internet/network protocol, making it possible to use simplified standardized equipment.
	• The terminal can establish a connection to a service server on the network and/or the Internet via the connecting unit, allowing for the transfer of information concerning a desired communication receiver.
	• The terminal can communicate additional information and/or data with the connecting unit, such as IP addresses, TCP/IP packets, speech mails, commercials, music, stock exchange and financial news, chat-lines, chat-rooms, and telephone meetings.
  • The invention also relates to a system for Internet telephony, which comprises a portable communications terminal, a connecting unit, and a service server connected to the Internet and/or a network.
	• The system allows for the handling and control of the connection between a large number of users, and provides additional functionalities such as news, reading of mails, speech mails, commercials, music, stock exchange and financial news, chat-lines, chat-rooms, and telephone meetings.
	• The system can also provide speech recognition for analysis and interpretation of data representing sound to identify one or more commands.
	• The system can use various wireless communications protocols, such as RF communications protocols, infrared communications protocols, or other wireless communications protocols.
</summary>

<summary>
  • The integration of non-SiO2 based oxides directly or indirectly on Si is difficult due to the strong reactivity of Si with oxygen, resulting in the formation of a low dielectric constant layer.
	• This layer degrades the usefulness of non-SiO2 based oxides with Si, but a Ge buffer layer can be used to prevent or minimize its formation.
  • A Ge buffer layer on Si provides a good buffer layer compatible with Si and many oxides, allowing for the epitaxial growth of high dielectric constant oxides on Ge and hence epitaxially aligned to the Si substrate.
	• The Ge buffer layer can also increase the capacitance of large dielectric constant oxide films compared to films grown directly on Si, and enable the use of ferroelectrics in non-volatile non-destructive readout memory cells.</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a receiver input circuit with multiple amplification control loops to eliminate undesired signal actuation of non-linear components, ensuring adequate small signal behavior and using conventional components.
	* The circuit comprises a preamplifier, a tunable selective network, a mixer and oscillator stage, and an intermediate frequency selective filter.
	* The control signal for the control loop is derived from the intermediate frequency signal and supplied to the part of the circuit preceding the mixer stage.

* The invention provides a third amplification control loop with a lower response threshold and frequency band width than the first and second control circuits.
	* This third control loop supports the other control circuits and can be used to lower the amplification of the circuit even in the case of a small usable signal.
	* The response threshold of the third control circuit can be controlled by the control signal of the second control circuit.

* The input circuit according to the invention includes a PIN diode for controllable signal attenuation and a preamplifier stage with a bipolar transistor.
	* The signal-dependent direct signals are smoothed by a capacitor and directed to a controlled shunt resistor in the circuit section.
	* The control of the PIN diode is effected by the distribution of the operating current determined by the shunt resistor to the PIN diode and the shunt resistor.

* The invention also provides an extended, permanently tuned input network with a second PIN diode and an extended reactance network.
	* The PIN diodes act in series with respect to direct current and attenuate the series-resonance of the reactance combination.
	* The series and parallel-resonant frequency of the reactance combinations are identical to the center frequency of the signal frequency band to be transmitted.

* A further development of the input network includes a tunable selective circuit with elements connected between the terminal and the signal input terminal.
	* This circuit has the advantage of higher selectivity while simultaneously avoiding strong attenuation of the tunable selective circuit during control.
	* The desired source impedance for actuation of the preamplifier transistor is adjusted by selection of the tapping of reactance or by a correspondingly dimensioned coupling coil.

* The invention also provides an embodiment of the tunable network with a separate supply and adjustment of the tuning voltage for the varactor diodes.
	* This circuit permits an iteration-free alignment of all tunable tuning circuits of the receiver input circuit.
	* The circuit operates by aligning the manipulated variable generated by the tuning voltage generator to the minimum

<summary>
* The invention relates to a system for initiating a collaborative work-share environment between two or more parties to a telephone call, without complex and time-consuming setup processes.
	* The system uses a collaboration button and an indicator on the telephone set to establish a work-share environment.
	* The collaboration button is used to launch network-enabled applications on the individual users' desktop computers.
	* The indicator signals to the user that the party has the capability of collaborating with the user.
	* The system can be used for various types of collaboration, including video conferencing, document sharing, and joint document editing.

* The system consists of a telephone, a desktop PC, and a local area network (LAN) that connects the telephone and PC.
	* The telephone is a component of an IP-based PBX system and has a collaborate indicator and a collaborate button.
	* The PC runs a collaboration control program that communicates with the telephone and other PCs on the LAN.
	* The collaboration control program launches collaboration application programs and controls the collaborate indicator.

* The system can be used in various network configurations, including a corporate LAN, WAN, or the Internet.
	* The system can also be used with non-Internet communications terminals, such as terminals located at a private home.
	* The system can be implemented using a peer-to-peer architecture or a client-server architecture.
	* The system can be used for multiparty collaboration with minor modifications.

* The invention can be implemented in various ways, including using a separate telephone or integrating the telephone equipment within the computer.
	* The indicator and collaborative button can be provided by an input device of the computer, such as a keyboard.
	* The voice capability of the telephone can be provided by a microphone input into the computer.
	* The system can be implemented using a computer program operating on a computer.

* The invention encompasses a computer program and any form of carrier medium that can carry the computer program.
	* The carrier medium can be a storage medium, such as a floppy disk, CD ROM, or programmable memory device.
	* The carrier medium can also be a signal, such as an optical signal or an electrical signal carried over a network.
	* The invention can be implemented remotely by computers connected over a network.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to the insertion of clips or advertising sequences into a sequence of video pictures, with the goal of optimizing the visual impact of the advertising clip.
	*The invention takes into account the regions of interest of the video sequence and of the advertising clip to ensure continuity between the two.
	*This is achieved by generating salience maps for the video sequence and the advertising clips, and determining a degree of similarity between them.
* The degree of similarity can be determined using various methods, including calculating the correlation coefficient or the Kullback-Leibler divergence between the salience maps.
	*Alternatively, the degree of similarity can be determined by selecting the N most salient points in the salience maps and calculating the Euclidean distance between them.
* The advertising clip with the highest degree of similarity is then selected and inserted into the video sequence at a predetermined point, such as a shot change.
	*The insertion point can be predefined or manually defined by an operator, and the device implementing the method can also detect shot changes automatically.
* The invention also relates to a device for processing pictures that implements the method, comprising a processing unit, a random access memory, a read-only memory, and an input/output interface.
	*The device can also include a man-machine interface for selecting the shot change into which the advertising clip is to be inserted.</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to the use of a recessed mask structure to prevent localized high electrical fields at intersections with resulting lower electrical breakdown in very small dimension semiconductor devices.
	• The recessed mask structure is achieved through a unique process that permits both the benefit of having a recessed surface of the mask with respect to a device surface where there may be aspects to avoid, such as high electric field concentration points.
	• The process involves removing mask material between points after chemical-mechanical polishing, down to a level that is away from the surface where the high fields are located and continuing until a selected mask thickness is reached.

• The invention provides several beneficial features, including minimizing damage from planarization operations to the conductive liner, reducing the overall capacitance of the device, and providing faster signal propagation in the interconnect wiring.
	• The high field at points are now away from the cap-mask interface, and the material of the mask which usually has a higher k and which can effect overall dielectric properties of the device can be minimized.
	• The structure of the invention, following generally FIGS. 3 and 4, is made using a standard substrate in the art of a material such as silicon on which is deposited a bulk layer of intralevel dielectric material.

• The invention is particularly useful in the damascene type device structure in the art wherein adjacent conductors lined with an electrically conductive and diffusion barrier film are disposed in thin trenches in an intralevel dielectric material.
	• The invention is also useful in applications involving metals such as copper, aluminum, silver, gold, and tungsten and alloys thereof, and in applications where the dimensions are in the sub 250 nanometer range.
	• The invention provides a lower and predictable overall capacitance which parameter in turn is very valuable because it results in faster signal propagation in the interconnect wiring.
</summary>

<summary>
* The Downconverting Digitizer invention is a novel design implementation for an analog to digital converter that can sample and downconvert to baseband a modulated (IF) carrier.
	* It achieves three processes: conversion of the modulated IF signal to the digital representation, downconversion of the modulated IF signal to a digital representation of the baseband in-phase (I) and quadrature (Q) components, and automatic control of the processed modulated IF signal amplitude to extend the dynamic range of the digitization process and minimize quantization noise.
	* The invention utilizes predictive coding principles to implement a simple down converting A/D converter, eliminating the complexities introduced by discrete-time analog circuitry.
	* The predictive loop filter is implemented using DSP techniques, allowing for flexibility in re-programming the predictive filter characteristics, which results in improvement in the converter dynamic range and noise performance.
	* The invention is distinguished from prior art in four major aspects: placement of the sampler inside the predictive loop, operating the predictive encoder in a subharmonic mode, using the digital predictive loop output to control the gain level applied to the input signal, and incorporating a built-in offset nuller.
	* The Downconverting Digitizer has been implemented and verified as part of a wireless telephone receiver, providing more than 52 dB of dynamic range, equivalent to the dynamic range performance provided by a dual 8-bit baseband analog-to-digital converter, while simultaneously performing the downconversion from IF to baseband with reduced noise performance.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to active solid state devices, specifically to apparatus and method for making and using sensors with nanodimensional features that are responsive to molecular compounds, organisms or gas molecules.
	*The invention uses nanoimprint lithography to define groups of semiconducting nanotraces between electrodes, which can be used as a sensor or for multiplex detection of analytes.
	*The method provides controlled fabrication of nanophase features, enabling detection of gases adsorbed on the semiconductor surfaces or multiplex detection of many simultaneous detection zones.

	*The sensor devices consist of a set of two interdigitated electrodes, a gate electrode, and a set of parallel semiconductor nanotraces that are perpendicular to and disposed across the interdigitated finger region of the electrodes.
	*The semiconductor nanotraces are fabricated using nanoimprint lithography and have a width of 10-100 nm and a depth defined by the thickness of the originally deposited semiconducting active layer.
	*The pitch between neighboring nanotraces can vary depending on the number of nanotraces and the total surface area of the interdigitated finger region of the electrodes.
	*The length of the semiconductor nanotraces spans the full distance from the outside source interdigitated finger to the outside drain interdigitated finger of each sensor device.

	*The method of nanoimprint lithography involves fabricating an imprint template, depositing a hard mask or back anti-reflection coating layer, and depositing a photoresist layer.
	*The template is brought into contact with the photoresist layer, and ultraviolet light is used to expose the photoresist through the template.
	*The photoresist is then developed, and the features are transferred into the semiconductor active layer using a series of dry etch processes.
	*The etched hard imprint features and etched BARC features are removed using a piranha wet etch process.

	*The set of parallel semiconductor nanotraces is functionalized with a sensitizing compound, which consists of "probe" molecules that are covalently attached to the surface of the semiconductor nanotraces.
	*The probes have specific affinity for different targets, and the anchored probes are designed to respond very specifically to the binding of the complementary sequence.
	*The probe molecules can be nucleic acid sequences, proteins, polymers, or other macromolecules that exclude or specifically bind different solution analytes or gas phase analytes.
	*The anchored probes

<summary>
• The present invention provides a new, useful, and non-obvious method of singulating and plating semiconductor packages, employing plating of the side surfaces of the leads of the leadframe in order to prevent contamination of the lead surfaces.
	• The method involves providing a plurality of semiconductor dies coupled to a single common leadframe, singulating the plurality of semiconductor dies, and plating the exposed side surfaces of the leads with a plating material.
• The plating material is preferably a material configured not to react with oxygen, such as a metallic material, and can be tin, silver, gold, nickel-gold, nickel-palladium, or nickel-palladium-gold.
	• The method can be performed using full cutting or partial cutting, and can involve using blades with different shapes and thicknesses to form steps or beveled surfaces on the side of the semiconductor package.
• The semiconductor package can have a leadframe with a top surface and a bottom surface, and the method can involve plating the top surface of the leadframe before or after singulating the plurality of semiconductor dies.
	• The molding compound can comprise a top surface, a bottom surface, and side surfaces between the top surface and the bottom surface, and can have a step or beveled portion on the side surfaces.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a dual mode mobile terminal and a connecting method for selectively connecting to a wireless wide area network (WWAN) and a wireless local area network (WLAN).
	* The method involves using a mobile terminal with two wireless modules, one for connecting to the WWAN and the other for connecting to the WLAN.

* The mobile terminal can switch between the WWAN and WLAN based on the signal level of the WLAN.
	* When the signal level of the WLAN is above a certain threshold, the mobile terminal accesses the WLAN, and when it drops below a certain threshold, the mobile terminal switches to the WWAN.

* The invention aims to solve the problem of dropped or delayed connections when switching from the WLAN to the WWAN.
	* This is achieved by using the WLAN to gather information about neighboring base stations and transmitting this information to the mobile terminal.

* The mobile terminal can use the received information to select a serving base station and connect to the WWAN.
	* The information includes signal strength, channel information, and base station identity codes of the neighboring base stations.

* The invention also provides a method for the mobile terminal to select a serving base station based on the received information.
	* The method involves the mobile terminal turning on its WWAN module, receiving the information from the WLAN, and selecting a serving base station based on the information.

* The invention can be applied to various communication systems, including GSM, GPRS, WCDMA, and 4G networks based on LTE.
	* The WLAN can be WiMax, WiFi, or Bluetooth network.
</summary>

<summary>

* The invention relates to the production of multilayered components, particularly multilayered electrical components.
	* The conventional process for producing commercial multilayer capacitors involves several steps, including casting a ceramic slip, printing a registered matrix of metal pigmented inks, stacking and laminating the printed ceramic sheets, cutting the compacted structure, thermal processing, metallizing the ends of each individual capacitor element, and testing for electrical parameters.
	* The conventional process has several limitations, including the need for precise control of dielectric thickness, dielectric constant, active area of the electrode, and number of active layers.

* The invention provides a new process for manufacturing multilayered components, which simplifies the process and eliminates several steps.
	* The new process involves providing a first electrode and a first electrical component and locating the electrode in a recess formed by the component to produce a first laminate sub-assembly.
	* The process also involves providing a second electrode and a second electrical component and locating the electrode in a recess formed by the second component to produce a second laminate sub-assembly.

* The laminate sub-assemblies are then stacked in mutually registered relation to form a resultant assembly.
	* The stacking process involves displacing the carriers or decals to effect precision registration of the sub-assemblies and removing the carriers.
	* The resultant assembly can be a capacitor, coil, resistance, or combination thereof.

* The invention also provides methods for interconnecting electrodes in stacked sub-assemblies and for locating sub-assemblies in precise registered relation.
	* The methods involve using a transfer release agent to retain the composites for transfer and releasing them in response to heating.
	* The methods also involve using guide posts to guide the decals into accurate registration upon assembly of electrode and electrical component composites.

* The invention enables the production of smaller parts, lower voltage ratings, and no shape limitations.
	* The invention also enhances in-process inspection, eliminates cutting stress cracks, and eliminates internal delamination caused by laminating stress disturbing green density.
	* The invention reduces labor content per part and enables the provision of a variety of tab configurations with no extra process time.

* The invention is adaptable to a number of other electronic ceramic devices, including multilayer ferrite inductors.
	* The method of producing an electrical coil involves forming multiple laminates, each laminate including electrically conductive material in the form of a portion of a coil, and non-conducting material laminated to said electrically conductive material.

<summary>
• The present invention relates to cellular materials used in structural applications, specifically to materials comprising hierarchical cellular lattices and related methods of using and manufacturing the same.
	• The invention provides a hierarchical lattice structure that comprises unit cells of various sizes connected together to form a lightweight lattice structure with improved specific stiffness and strength.
	• The lattice structure can be used in various applications, including sea, land, and air transportation, ballistics, blast and impact impulse mitigation, thermal transfer, multifunctional structures, armors, ballistics, load bearing, construction materials, and containers.

• The lattice structure comprises a primary array of unit cells and an ancillary array of unit cells, which can be nested together to form a hierarchical structure.
	• The primary array and ancillary array can be made up of unit cells of different sizes and shapes, and can be constructed from various materials, including metals, metal alloys, inorganic polymers, organic polymers, ceramics, glasses, and composite derivatives.
	• The unit cells can be connected together through their ligaments by various means, including brazing, transient liquid phase bonding, welding, diffusion bonding, or adhesive bonding.

• The lattice structure can be mated with an oppositely oriented lattice structure to form a balanced or mated lattice structure.
	• The mating process involves abutting the ligaments of the highest order cells of the two lattice structures along at least a substantial portion of their respective lengths.
	• The resulting mated lattice structure has improved strength and stiffness compared to a single lattice structure.

• The lattice structure can be used as the core of a sandwich panel or other structure, and can be attached to face sheets or panels by various means.
	• The face sheets or panels can be made of the same or different materials as the core, and can be attached by brazing, transient liquid phase bonding, welding, diffusion bonding, or adhesive bonding.
	• The sandwich panel or structure can be used in various applications, including minimum weight structural applications, impact or blast load mitigation, and thermal transfer.

• The lattice structure can be fabricated using various methods, including injection molding, lattice block construction, constructed metal lattice, and metal textile lay-up techniques.
	• The injection molding process involves feeding a granular thermoplastic polymer into a cylinder, heating it into a liquid form, and propelling it into a mold to form a unit cell.
	• The unit cell can be used as a template for further processing, such as deposition of other materials or investment casting

<summary>
• The invention relates to a process for co-producing power and hydrocarbons, integrating an Integrated Gasification Combined Cycle (IGCC) facility with a coal-to-liquid (CTL) hydrocarbon synthesis facility.
	• The IGCC facility uses a wet gasification stage to produce combustion gas, which is then used to generate power.
	• The CTL facility uses a dry gasification stage to produce synthesis gas precursor, which is then converted to hydrocarbons.
	• The two facilities share utilities, such as an air separation unit, to improve economy of scale and reduce costs.

• The process includes enriching a portion of the combustion gas with hydrogen to produce an H2-enriched gas, which is then mixed with the synthesis gas precursor to increase the H2/CO molar ratio.
	• The H2-enriched gas is produced through a sour shift reaction, which converts CO and water to CO2 and H2.
	• The resulting synthesis gas is then converted to hydrocarbons through a Fischer-Tropsch synthesis process.

• The IGCC facility generates power through a gas combustion and expansion stage, which includes a gas turbine expander and a steam turbine.
	• The facility also includes a waste heat recovery stage, which produces high-pressure steam to drive the steam turbine.
	• The steam turbine generates additional power, which can be exported or used internally.

• The integration of the IGCC and CTL facilities allows for the capture and sequestration of CO2, which is produced as a byproduct of the CTL facility.
	• The CO2 is compressed and mixed with oxygen, which is then fed to the combustor of the IGCC facility.
	• The resulting off-gas from the IGCC facility is a relatively pure combination of CO2 and water vapor, which can be combined with the remaining CO2 produced by the CTL facility for export.</summary>

<summary>
  * The present invention relates to a method for preparing a solid device for use as an oxide superconducting material, with a focus on improving the properties of the material at the surface or portion close to the surface.
	*The invention aims to provide a highly reliable surface utilizing-device, particularly a Josephson element, by preventing the removal of oxygen from the surface of the superconducting material.
	* The method involves uniformly coating a blocking film or passivation film over the spaces or micro-holes in the surface portion of the superconducting material.
		*The film is formed using a photo CVD method, which provides superior stepped coverage, and is typically 10 Å to 2μm thick.
		*The film can be made of insulating materials such as silicon nitride, aluminum nitride, or oxidized metals, and can be used as a passivation film or as a tunnel barrier in a Josephson element.
</summary>

<summary>
  • The present invention relates to an apparatus for preparing foam sheet samples for microscopic examination, particularly for examining the cell structure within the sheet.
    • The apparatus includes a base structure, a clamping arrangement, and a screw thread specimen advance mechanism, allowing for the preparation of repetitive samples with uniform thickness and parallel cut edges.

  • The apparatus is designed to grasp a foam sheet sample and permit linearly oriented parallel cuts to be made, without damaging the delicate cell structure.
    • The sample is advanced through the apparatus a prescribed amount, and a planar surface is provided for interaction with a cutting knife, allowing for precise control over the cutting process.

  • The invention provides samples for physical testing, such as tensile, stretch, elongation, solvent resistance, and surface cell size, and allows for the comparison of different foam materials.
    • The precisely cut foam samples prepared by the present invention can provide insight into the differences between foam materials, including their insulative qualities and cell structure.</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to seismometers, especially those designed to operate on the ocean floor, and more particularly to a method and apparatus for determining the angle of inclination with respect to the vertical assumed by such a unit during its operation and for leveling the seismic motion detectors carried by such a unit.
	*The invention is a simple and inexpensive method for determining the angle of inclination with respect to the vertical assumed by a seismometer in its operating position, such as an OBS on the ocean floor, and an apparatus for preserving the orientation assumed by the seismometer for later measurement of that angle.

* The present invention also comprises a method and apparatus for automatically leveling seismic motion detectors employed in a seismometer.
	*Seismic motion detectors such as geophones are commercially available from numerous commercial sources and are in themselves beyond the scope of this invention.

* The invention provides a mounting and clamp for a seismic motion detector which provide good acoustic coupling between the ocean bottom and the detector.
	*The mounting plate 7 is designed to prevent the geophone 1 from striking other surfaces including the inner surface of the door 12.

* The invention provides a simple and inexpensive apparatus for self-leveling the seismic motion detectors used in a seismometer especially designed to operate on the ocean floor.
	*The geophone 1, shaft 4, and spherical ball 5, supported in this manner, form a simple pendulum.

* The invention provides an apparatus which both levels the seismic motion detectors carried in a seismometer especially designed to operate on the ocean floor and preserves the angle of inclination with respect to the vertical that the seismometer assumes during its operation.
	*The coil spring 33 must be selected so as to remain in a sufficiently compressed state when the plunger 30 is fully extended to assure that sufficient forces are imparted by the head 31 to the spherical ball 5 to prevent its further motion or rotation.

* The invention is preferably mounted to the door of a water-tight instrument housing, a component of the seismometer.
	*The door 12, which pivots around a vertical axis, is an ideal surface on which to mount the detector as it offers easy access to "cock" a plunger 30 for operation.

* The operation of the invention is as follows: Before deploying the seismometer carrying the invention, the plunger 30 is cocked for operation by lifting it by its handle 30a and rotating it until the first bore 13 and second

<summary>
• The present invention provides a relative humidity sensing element that is energized by low voltage microscopic currents from solid state electronic instrumentation.
	• The sensing element does not depend on mechanical movements and is physically sturdy, requiring no special physical protection.
	• It is not affected by fingerprints or reasonably dirty environments and has a response time on the order of one second.

• The humidity sensing element comprises a first electron conductive electrode, a porous coating of dielectric, minute particles of electron conductive material, a second electron conductive electrode, and an ion-forming material.
	• The impedance between the electrodes varies generally linearly with relation to the relative humidity of the surrounding gaseous atmosphere in a suitable range of interest.
	• The element is manufactured by a method that includes coating a first electron conductive electrode with a porous coating of dielectric and depositing minute particles of electron conductive material in the interstices of the porosity of the dielectric.

• The preferred embodiment of the humidity sensing element has the first electrode formed from 99.4% pure aluminum, which is anodized to a thickness in the range of about 0.02 to 0.08 millimeters.
	• Atom-sized nickel particles are deposited in the interstices of the anodized dielectric, and the element is suitable for excitation by an alternating current sine wave voltage in the order of 10 Hertz.
	• The second electrode is formed by a deposit of nickel in quantity equivalent to an amount calculated for deposition of a layer approximately 100 Angstrom units thick on a smooth non-porous surface.
</summary>

<summary>
* The motor assembly comprises a motor, a gear train, and a force transmission structure.
	*The gear train includes a worm, a worm gear, a damper, a drive plate, and a shaft.
	*The force transmission structure comprises the drive plate and the shaft.
	*The drive plate has a mounting hole with at least three sections interconnected at a common area.

* The drive plate has a coupling formed at the center of the body, with a greater axial depth than the body.
	*The coupling has a Y-shaped mounting hole at the center thereof.
	*The coupling further has a plurality of buffer holes evenly distributed in the circumferential direction.
	*The buffer holes are located between adjacent sections of the Y-shaped hole.

* The shaft has a toothed portion with at least three teeth fittingly received in the sections of the mounting hole.
	*The toothed portion has a Y-shaped cross section.
	*The shape and size of the teeth conform to that of the mounting hole of the drive plate.
	*The shaft is made of low alloy steel or other metal material.

* The motor assembly provides a stable and quiet operation, with a greater torque withstand capability.
	*The contact area between the teeth of the shaft and the coupling of the drive plate is greater than in traditional designs.
	*The drive plate is made of an engineering plastics material with good strength and resistance to impact.
	*The buffer holes aid molding of the drive plate and reduce distortion of the mounting hole.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to wireless communication systems, specifically to systems and methods for detection, identification, and monitoring of multipath signals in WCDMA systems.
	• The invention provides a method and system for generating a mobile time reference for a portable transceiver.
	• The system comprises an antenna, a radio frequency subsystem, and a baseband subsystem.
	• The baseband subsystem includes a free running counter that provides a mobile time reference to the system.

• The free running counter has a wake mode and a sleep mode, using a high frequency oscillator during wake mode and a low frequency oscillator during sleep mode.
	• The high frequency oscillator is a temperature controlled crystal oscillator (TCXO) and the low frequency oscillator is a 32 KHz crystal oscillator (CO).
	• The TCXO provides a clock to the receiver, transmitter, and WCDMA modem, while the CO provides a 32 KHz clock to the WCDMA modem.
	• The two clocks are used by the WCDMA modem to create a mobile time reference with an accuracy of approximately 32 nanoseconds.

• The WCDMA modem includes a multipath monitor and a multipath radio signal recovery circuit.
	• The multipath monitor provides information regarding primary sync search, secondary sync search, and gold code search to the microprocessor.
	• The multipath radio signal recovery circuit includes a single-path processor (SPP) controller, SPPs, FIFO circuits, phase correctors, and maximal rate combiners.
	• The circuit recovers and tracks incoming clock information relative to a basestation and provides phase estimation for single and multiple basestation antennas.

• The system performs matched filtering of the primary synchronization code and creates a non-coherent energy measurement.
	• The energy measurement is transformed into the log2-domain to reduce memory requirements for multiple hypotheses of slot level timing.
	• Hypotheses are low pass filtered to enhance the probability of detection of signals that are candidates for further processing.
	• The system recovers the transmitted code groups and frame timing for the received signal components.

• A fast wakeup mechanism recovers multiple hypotheses in parallel to arrive quickly at a time base that can initiate subsequent demodulation of the spread spectrum signal.
	• This reduces power consumption and minimizes duty cycle of the slotted mode operations.
	• A method for recovery of network timing in the presence of frequency uncertainty uses energy measurements from the primary synchronization code.
